loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  He is 36 years old, married to Cecilia, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Andrew hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is married and has two children who attend school.  He is from the village of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela. He has been selling ice drops in the village where they are living with his family. He earns about 200 PHP a day.

Arthur is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase ice drops to sell. In the future, he would like to have his own ice drops stall, so he can continue to send his children to school and to provide his family with an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ice drops to sell

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a married man with four school going children. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Jumaa has operated a barber shop for the past ten years; in addition he also practices small scale farming. His potential clients are local community members and he faces a major challenge of low income due to low service charges. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a new hair shaving machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu because Yehu understands its’ clients needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new hair shaving machine for his business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está casado y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar pollos para el engorde y compra de los insumos para el crecimiento adecuado de ellos. El tiene la experiencia necesaria para retomar de nuevo el proyecto y generar ganancias para su bienestar. El tiene como meta aumentar las ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar cada día su nivel económico.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel is 67 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is his main priority.  He plans to use his loan to buy chickens to fatten and also supplies to help them grow adequately.  Miguel has the experience he needs to restart this project and make profits for his well-being.  His goal is to increase his profits for the well-being of his family and to improve his financial situation.

This is the first loan that Miguel has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is a 50-year old married man with three children who lives in the Philippines. He owns and operates farm land, planting crops to earn a living. He's been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,500 PHP per month. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Vicente has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, he wants to build a house and finish educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure for his crops.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene cuarenta y cuatro años, es casada tiene dos hijos.Vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos.
Ella tiene cinco años de operar su bazar ,el cual está ubicado su casa.En el bazar Leticia vende ropa que ella confecciona, cosméticos, bisutería y otros artículos para el hogar.

Todos los días, desde de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 11, ella cose y hace reparaciones a prendas de vestir. Y al mismo tiempo atiende a los clientes del bazar.Por las tardes atiende el bazar y algunos días viaja a una ciudad cercana a comprar mercadería y materiales.

Leticia ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Mujer, para comprar una máquina de coser plana, materia prima para producir prendas y mercadería (bisutería, bolsos, cosmésticos y artículos para el hogar).
Dada la temporada navideña ella identificó la posibilidad de incrementar sus ventas. Con la ayuda del préstamo ,Leticia podrá aprovechar el incremento en la demanda durante dicha época.

En un futuro Leticia sueña con trasaladar su negocio al centro de la ciudad, con mayor número de clientes,que permitirán mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Leticia, 44, is married and has two children; she lives with her husband and one of her children.  She has been running her store for five years; it’s home-based.  Leticia sells clothes that she makes herself in her store and also cosmetics, costume jewelry and other items for the home.

Every day from 7 in the morning until 11 she sews and does clothing repairs.  At the same time she takes care of store customers.  In the afternoon she tends to the store and on some days travels to a nearby city to buy merchandise and materials.

Leticia has asked Fundación Mujer for a loan to buy a sewing machine and raw materials to make clothes and merchandise (costume jewelry, purses, cosmetics and items for the home).  She identifies the Christmas season as a time of possibly increasing sales.  With help from the loan Leticia will be able to take advantage of increased demand during this season.  In the future, Leticia dreams with moving her business to the center of the city where there are more customers that will allow for greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread and costume jewelry to sell in her store.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina, de 49 años de edad, está casada con Augusto de 50 años y tienen 02 hijos, John de 19 años y Gilbert de 12. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en la comunidad de Palmapampa distrito de Samugari. Con mucho esfuerzo Faustina y su esposo, han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; Faustina es agricultora se dedica a cultivar plantaciones de cacao, y plantaciones de café; que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos de cosecha Faustina tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos de las plantas. Viene trabajando 10 años en la agricultura y es conocedora de la labor en el campo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que depende de eso el ingreso de su economía; considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por cada producto. En adelante, desea incrementar sus cultivos comprando más plantas de cacao y café para obtener buenos productos. Este será su crédito número 13 con MFP, por tanto se compromete una vez más en seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas. En su banco comunal se lleva bien con todos y comparten alegrías entre compañeros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de cacao y café para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
49-year-old Faustina is married to 50-year-old Augusto and the couple have two children: 19-year-old John and 12-year-old Gilbert.  They live together in their own home in Palmapampa community, in Samugari district.  With a lot of hard work, Faustina and her husband have managed to make their land very productive.  Faustina is a farmer who grows cacao and coffee plants.  These are products on which her finances depend.

At harvest time, Faustina has to hire day laborers to quickly pick the fruit from her plants.  She has been farming for 10 years and is well known for her farm work.  What she most likes about her business is caring for her crops as her household income depends on it.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce from the farm to the city of San Francisco which is where she receives the best prices for her product.  In the future, Faustina would like to increase her crops, buying more cacao and coffee plants so that she can obtain good produce.

This will be Faustina's thirteenth loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has in the past.  She gets on well with the other members of her community bank and they enjoy spending time together.  With the 2,000 soles that she has requested, Faustina will buy cacao and coffee plants so that she can increase her production.

loans.use: to buy cacao and coffee plants

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun is a 34-year-old widowed woman from Reussey Keo commune, a suburb area of Phnom Penh where she lives with her three children. Presently, she is a staff member of Bayon television station, and is able to earn an average of $5 per day. 

In order to gain more income and to offer her children better living conditions, she sells various products at home, such as sweets, biscuits, snacks, shampoos, canned foods, and groceries. She has requested a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a stock of her merchandise. 

She hopes that she will be able to sustain and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Sareth is 34 years old, married and has only one son who is still in primary school in a village located in the Ponhea Krek district. She has been planting cassava as a primary business for five years while her husband works for others to raise extra income. With her current income source, she earns more than five U.S. dollars per day. 

This is her first group loan with VisionFund. Leading a group of three female members, she is applying for a loan to buy cassava seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to make more cassava and earn more income to make a better living and also keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (El distrito peruano de Huayllabamba es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú). 

Augusto tiene 36 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él tiene dos actividades económicas principales que realiza durante todo el año y estos son: él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él durante los meses de abril hasta octubre se dedica cultivar y sembrar maíz, zapallos, zanahorias, tomates y otras verduras pero durante los meses de Octubre a Marzo se dedica al negocio de venta de choclo y lleva sus choclos a vender a la ciudades de Juliaca y Arequipa y los distribuye a los diferentes mercados mayoristas de esas ciudades. En esta oportunidad Augusto requiere el préstamo para comprar choclos.

Su sueño de Augusto es comprar un camión para poder transportar sus productos pues actualmente lo que hacer es alquilar un camión para llevar sus productos.    

Augusto es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en la ciudad de Yucay. El distrito peruano de Yucay es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Augusto was born in the city of Huayllabamba, and this is where he still lives. The Peruvian district of Huayllabamba is one of the seven districts of Urubamba province, located in the department of Cusco in the Cusco region of Peru.

Augusto is 36 years old and is in a common-law marriage that has produced 2 children.  He has two main economic activities that he carries out during the year, these are: farming and raising livestock.  During the months of April through October he plants and cultivates corn, squash, carrots, tomatoes and other vegetables, but during the months of October through March he has a business selling choclo (a Peruvian variety of large-kerneled corn). He takes his corn to sell in the cities of Juliaca and Arequipa where he distributes to the various wholesale markets in those cities.  At this time, Augusto needs a loan to buy corn.

Augusto's dream is to buy a truck to use in transporting his products, since now he has to rent a truck to take his products to the market.

Augusto is a member of the communal bank “Virgen Natividad," which has 15 members who live in the city of Huayllabamaba, and others who live in the city of Yucay. Yucay district is one of the seven districts of the province of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Michael  M.

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Michael.  He is married and has three children aged 19, 16, and 14, all schooling. He has two additional dependents, who live with him. They are his wife's nephews, staying with him for schooling.  

In 2003, Michael established his patient medicine business. He began his business because he wanted to engage in productive activity after he resigned from work and that is his only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.

 Michael has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy Novalgin tabs, Amoxicillin, Dexedrine and Paracetamol. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Michael plans to establish a desk-top publishing center, to build a house and educate his children.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy Paracetomal, Amoxicillin, Dexorange, and Novalgin.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen, 54, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Nguyen and her husband support their family by running a general store in front of their house. Nguyen started this business sixteen years ago. 

From the store Nguyen sells biscuits, sugar, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular confectionery and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular confectionery and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Fatmata B.

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Fatmata B. She is divorced and has two children, ages 28 and 26 years, all are school going children. She has one additional dependent who live with her to be fostered. In 2011, Fatmata B. established her provisions business, selling sweet milk, soft drinks, ovaltine, sugar, tea leaf, biscuit, and mayonnaise. 

She began her business after her husband divorced her. He gave her some amount of money for her and the children's up keeping. She used the money to start a business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 760,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Fatmata B. requires a loan in order to buy ovaltine, mosquito coil, sugar and soft drinks. In the future, Fatmata B. plans to acquire a piece of land, perform Hajj, and expand the business. Her main challenge is that the sales are sometimes slow.    She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Ovaltine, mosquito coil, sugar, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nonghai Group

texts.en: Bualai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Bualai and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Bualai and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Bualai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Marisela Gonzáles is a 28 year old woman who lives in San Bartólo Coyotepec, Oaxaca, in the Mexican southeast. This town is famous because there are a lot of specialist artisans working with black clay. According with the town’s tradition, people learn from the time they are children to knead the clay. And when they are grown, they learn different stages of the manufacturing process until the final stage of cofundation in the furnace. She learned this trade in the same way and now she has set up in the artisans market of her town. Eight years ago she formally started her small business by inheritance of her parents, because this is the popular tradition and the community way of living that was passed down to her. Marisela has two children, 2 and 4 years old, and this is the reason she wants to increase her business and get a better standard of living.

She is requesting a loan for $475 USD and hopes to be able to buy crude clay products (i.e. firewood and clay). She is committed to repaying the loan in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

Marisela González tiene 28 años y vive en San Bartolo Coyotepec en el estado de Oaxaca, esta comunidad es famosa por tener gente especialista en la elaboración de piezas en barro negro. De acuerdo con la tradición del pueblo, los niños aprenden desde muy pequeños a amasar el barro y conforme van creciendo van aprendiendo las diferentes etapas de la elaboración de las piezas, hasta llegar al cocimiento en el horno como etapa final del proceso. Es así como Marisela aprendió el oficio desde niña y en la actualidad tiene un puesto en el mercado artesanal del pueblo en donde ofrece sus productos a los turistas que visitan aquélla zona. Hace ocho años que inicio formalmente su negocio por herencia de sus padres ya que es la tradición en la población y es la forma de vida de la comunidad. Marisela tiene dos hijos pequeños de 2 y 4 años y por ellos quiere mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

Esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 475 USD para poder comprar algunos productos de barro crudo, comprar leña de encino y barro. El plazo para pagar que solicita es de 6-12 meses

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en: Shafiga is an IDP from occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She has three children.  In 1998 she started her business with her own money. In 2002 she borrowed five loans totalling $2500 from Normicro Baku branch. Now she would like to borrow $1000.

loans.use: To expand volume of business goods

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: Susitina and her husband run a small store in the Samoan village of Tapatapao.  This is their only source of income, and they are able to bring in about ST 250 (about USD 100) a week to meet their financial needs.  Susitina is confident that she can grow the store to a larger scale, but she will need to purchase additional goods for her store.  Because repaid her initial loan in full and on time, Susitina qualifies for additional funds, and with this loan, she should be able to get closer to her dream of being a successful proprietor of a large retail store.

loans.use: Re-stock the shop

loans.name: San Juana Maribel

texts.es:
San Juana is 38 years-old, married and has two sons. One of them works and the other is getting ready to begin his college classes. Her husband works at a gas station and his income is not enough to cover the house's and their son's college expenses. Faced with the need of creating another source of income, San Juana started selling cabinets two years ago out of an adapted room in her home. Business has gradually improved and now she has a greater amount of customers.

To expand her business and take it even further, San Juana requests a loan in the amount of $375.00. It will be used to purchase more cabinets and other merchandise to build up a better inventory and to continue being her clients' favorite retailer. She commits to paying the loan back within 6 months. You can contribute to this business' growth and help improve this family's quality of life. They truly appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

San Juana tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos trabaja y el otro esta por iniciar sus estudios universitarios. Su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera y el ingreso que recibe es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, San Juana inició con la venta de abarrotes hace dos años, acondicionando un pequeño lugar de su casa, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor y ahora cuenta con un mayor número de clientes.

Para ampliar su negocio y darle un impulso, San Juana solicita un préstamo de $375 dólares que empleará en la compra de estantes y mercancía para tener un mejor surtido y continuar con la preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia a mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Compra de estantes y mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue buying new products

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: I am only 18 years old and single, but I have always been very supportive of my mother and her younger brothers.  I am is the eldest of 5 children.  My father passed away two years ago, and he left my mother and her four brothers.  I left school at the age of 16 because my mother is had a hard time paying my high school fees.  My mother is also a member of Malie J Centre, and through her loan with SPBD she started her own canteen business. I also would like to receive a loan for my barbeque business so I can support my mother and her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Armando Xavier

texts.pt:
Armando Xavier M. is married and father of 4 children. He lives in the district of Corumana in Moamba. He has a stand where he sells soft drinks and some groceries such as cookies, butter and matches. He also works as a fisherman. Armando joined the credit program in November of 2006, and his first loan was of 6.000mt. He is now in the 3rd cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 15.000mt to be repaid in 6 months. Armando will use this loan to buy more goods for his stand.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Armando Xavier M. é casado e pai de 4 filhos. Vive em Corumana no distrito da Moamba. Tem uma barraca onde vende bebidas e refrigereantes, e alguns produtos de mercearia como pastas dentífricas, bolachas, manteiga, fósforos, entre outros.Para além deste negócio , tem barco e pratica pesca. Entrou para o programa em Novembro de 2006 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Vai para o 3º ciclo e vai tomar 15.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Pretende aplicar este valor no aumento do stock da barraca.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: My name is Safia B.. My husband and I live in Lahore, the second largest metropolis in Pakistan. My husband runs a small shoe factory, and I am a seamstress for neighborhood clients. I am expecting a baby and my husband and I want to give our child a sound economic future. Therefore, my husband would like to expand his shoe business with a loan of $250.

loans.use: To expand the shoe business

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique worked as an aviation mechanic in the commercial aviation company, Aero Continente. The owners of this company got involved in some legal problems and Enrique was fired without pay. After a year without a job and facing the pressure to pay his creditors, he decided to establish a wine bottling business with his brother.

He has owned this business for four years, with his brand “Vinos L. B. – L. B. Wines”, he sells premium wine in various areas of the capital city. Enrique is very dedicated to his business, he has refurbished the first floor of his house as a manufacturing facility.

Enrique’s dream is to produce his own wine and improve the manufacturing system by purchasing new equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Enrique trabajaba como mecánico aeronáutico en una empresa D. aviación comercial, Aero Continente; sin embargo, por problemas legales D. los dueños D. L. empresa, fue despedido sin remuneración alguna. Pasó un año sin trabajo y ante L. presión que tenía por las deudas, decidió poner junto a su hermano un negocio D. embotellamiento D. vino.

Ya lleva cuatro años en los que con su marca “Vinos L. B.” ofrece vinos D. óptima calidad en distintos puntos D. L. capital. Y es que Enrique se preocupa mucho por mejorar cada vez más su trabajo; por esto, ha acondicionado el primer piso D. su vivienda para poder trabajar.

El sueño D. Enrique es poder producir su propio vino además D. mejorar el sistema D. manufacturación D. sus productos con L. compra D. maquinaria.

loans.use:
Purchase equipment for his business

Comprar maquinaria para su negocio

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia is a single mother with three children ages 13, 16 and 17 who attend school. They live in a rural area called Villa Reconciliacion. The region is very poor and crime is a problem. Silvia has fought on her own to provide for her children, making sure they have an education so that they will be able to pursue professions and improve their lives. In order to meet all her obligations, she works selling clothing, perfumes and cosmetics to her friends and neighbors. The income from this has enabled her to pay her household costs.

Because of the cost of food and basic services, Silvia decided to fix up a small room in her house so that she could rent it out to a couple, increasing her income and doing her best to provide for the needs of her children. But the rains have been heavy the last few months, causing some damage to the room and the wooden walls and now the renters are asking that she fixes it. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to rebuild the walls from concrete. This will allow her to offer a nicer room to the tenants, as well as collect more rent.

La señora Silvia es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 13, 16 y 17 años, los cuales están estudiando, habitan en el asentamiento de Villa Reconciliación, zona rural, muy pobre, existe mucha delincuencia. Esta madre ha luchado sola por sacar adelante a sus hijos, le ha brindado lo necesario para vivir, como es la educación, la cual desea poderlos preparar para que sean profesionales de bien y opten a mejores condiciones de vida en donde se puedan desarrollar como individuo. Para poder cumplir con todas las obligaciones, esta madre trabaja de operaria en una zona franca, oportunidad en la que ha aprovechado para comercializar ropa, perfumes y cosméticos a las trabajadores de esa maquila así como a sus amistades y vecinas, ingresos que le han permitido pagar los gastos del hogar. Debido a lo costoso de los alimentos y servicios básicos, decide acondicionar un pequeño cuarto en su humilde vivienda con láminas de zinc y madera, el cual alquila a una pareja, es con todo esto que esta madre hace frente a satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos, todo con el objetivo de brindarles un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. Las abundantes lluvias de meses pasados, deterioraron el cuarto, ya que las paredes del cuarto son de madera, por lo cual están podridas y es por eso que los inquilinos le están solicitando a la señora que mejore el cuarto, ya que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, viendo esta situación la señora solicita un préstamo para construir de concreto las paredes del cuarto y brindar un mejor servicio lo que le ayudara a pedir un mejor precio por el alquiler.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CEMENT, SAND AND IRON TO REPAIR THE WALLS ON A ROOM SHE RENTS OUT IN HER HOUSE.  THE TENANTS ARE COMPLAINING BECAUSE THE RECENT HEAVY RAINS HAVE CAUSED A LOT OF DAMAGE TO THE WOODEN WALLS.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla Patricia is a 30-year-old single mother. She lives in the Reparto el Carmen with her two children, 9 and 6 years old, who are elementary school students. Karla Patricia opened an local store 6 years ago which became general store. She plans on providing her children with a good education so they can enjoy a better future. Karla Patricia wants to expand her inventory and infrastructure. She's requesting a loan in order to invest the money in her business, buy school supplies, basic grains, and expand a room that she uses to sell clothing and beauty products, her main source of profit.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Karla Patricia es una madre soltera de 30 años de edad. Habita en el reparto el carmen y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad que actualemnte se encuentran estudiando en primaria. hace 6 años montó una pulpería que con el tiempo se convirtió en una miscelanea. sus planes es darle educación a sus hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor. Quiere expandirse en inventario e infraestructura.Solicita un prestamo para invertir en su negocio, utiles escolares y granos básicos y ampliar un espacio que usa para la venta de ropa y cosméticos, de donde ellos obtienen mejores ganancias

loans.use: To buy basic grains, school supplies, and imitation jewelry

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
I am a dance instructor and I want to open my own dance school. I don’t have my own locale, I pay rent. I’m asking for a $500 loan to pay a month’s rent and make interior and exterior signs for my locale where I give dance classes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Soy instructor de baile y deseo abrir mi propia academia de baile, no cuento aun con un local propio, ya que pago renta; el crédito que solicito es de $500.00 dlls, para pagar una mensualidad de la renta y para rotular el local por dentro y por fuera en el que imparto mis clases.

loans.use: Open a dance school

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina M., 42, married mother of 3 children, sells charcoal and groundnuts in a nearby community market. She has been in this business for almost twelve years now. With this business, she has supported her first son to complete senior high school. She wants to use this loan to buy more supplies of charcoal and bags of groundnuts to increase her stock. She believes this will help to provide her with increased income for her children’s education.

Amina belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bags of groundnuts for re-sale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Mrs. Marcelina sells bread in the area of Tejar, a peri-urban area of the city of La Paz. For many years she has lived with her husband and her children. This activity will allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. She is a punctual client in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA MARCELINA VEND. PAN EN LA ZONA EL TEJAR UNA ZONA PERIURBANA D. LA CIUDAD D. LA PAZ, HACE MUCHOS AÑOS, VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS HIJOS, ESTA ACTIVIDAD LE PERMITE AYUDAR AL ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, ES UNA CLIENTE PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS

loans.use: Purchase of baskets

loans.name: Rofiya

texts.ru:
Rofiya H. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 46 years old, is a widow and has 3 children. Rofiya has a high school education. She purchases and sells food items. Rofiya has a small sales location at the central market. She has 6 years of experience in this business. Rofiya uses the income from her business to support her large family. She would like to increase the product selection at her sales location. Rofiya has decided to take out an 8 month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хамидова Рофия жительница района Румй. Возраст 46 лет , вдова , имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее .Клиентка занимается куплей продажей продуктов питания. На центральном рынке района она имеет небольшую торговую точку. Имеет опыт в этом бизнесе более 6 лет . На доходы от этого бизнеса она содержит свою большую семью. В данный момент Рофия хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решилда взять кредит сроком на 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.en: Vanesa was born in 1989. She is married, and her husband has a full-time job with a monthly salary of 500 KM. They don't have any children. This is Vanesa's first loan, and she requested 1000 KM. Her intent is to buy a cow which costs 2100 KM. She has some saved money, and she thinks that this loan would be a great help for her and her husband. Her wish is to improve her household income by selling milk to the local dairy.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que significa “Sol” en quechua.

Victoria es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos que están estudiando en colegio y en la universidad, Victoria vive en un barrio artesanal llamado Santa Ana, Victoria tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, bebidas, carnes y también tiene un teléfono publico, el local es alquilado, Victoria tiene un terreno en donD. tiene proyectado construir su casa y local para su negocio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos en sus horarios libres.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, verduras. Victoria sueña son incrementar su negocio, tener casa propia y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank 'Inti' which means 'sun' in Quechua.

Victoria is married and is 56 years old. She has 6 kids who are studying at college and university. Victoria lives in an artisan neighborhood called Santa Ana. She has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, drinks, meat and that also has a public telephone. She rents the store. She has some land where she plans to build her house and a store for her business, which her kids help her out with in their free time.

Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles; money that she will invest in buying sugar, rice and vegetables. Victoria dreams of her business growing, having her own house and her kids finishing their studies.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be invested in buying sugar, rice and vegetables/Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, verduras.

loans.name: Nadith

texts.es: Nadith, de 31 años, es madre de tres hijos que están estudiando, gracias a la educación y las buenas costumbres que les imparte, son muy buenos muchachos, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo Venancio, quien se dedica a trabajar como comerciante de forma ambulante. Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta, debido al carisma con el que cuenta y a la concurrencia de sus clientes se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, es por eso que necesariamente requiere de un capital para lograr su meta. Con tu apoyo la señora Nadith logrará lo que quiere en el tiempo menos pensado.
texts.en:
Nadith, 31, is the mother of 3 children of school age. Thanks to education and the good habits she has given them, they are very good boys. She also depends on the support of her husband, Venancio, who works as a traveling salesman. She sells fruit, and thanks to her charisma and the growth of her clientele, she finds herself needing to enlarge her business. This is why she needs a loan to accomplish her goal. With your help, Mrs. Nadith will achieve her desire in the shortest possible time.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To establish her fruit-selling business, building a kiosk for her sales

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira Y. was born in 1979 and lives in the Khirdalan settlement.

Sabira has been in the bakery business for two years. She bakes bread and biscuits, and needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy products needed for baking.

loans.use: To buy products needed for baking

loans.name: Flor De Amapola Group

texts.en:
The Flor D. Amapola ("Poppy Flower") Village Bank is located in the town of Chilcapite, just east of Acobamba, the provincial capital. The village is a hilly, mostly agricultural community located about 3,300 meters above sea level. Most group members raise livestock or crops since there is little commercial activity in the area. Maxima and Isidora are two members of the Flor D. Amapola group:

Maxima is married with five children in their late 20s and early-to-mid-30s. For the past 30 years, Maxima has been buying and selling fish and fruit in local markets, sometimes preparing the fish by frying them and other times selling them uncooked. The Juntos Program was recently launched in Maxima’s area to give low-income women in rural areas $30 per month. Seeing a business opportunity, she started selling her wares outsiD. the program office on payment days.

Maxima plans to use her share of the loan to buy more fish and produce to sell and to start traveling to more regional markets. Her goal is to open a wholesale store so that she doesn’t have to travel anymore, and she is now planning to use her FINCA savings to buy a stand in the Lima market.

Isidora, married with six children between the ages of 10 and 25, buys young chickens which she fattens up to sell. Isidora has been working with FINCA for six months and says that in that time her business and her family have improved and her income has grown a bit. She is planning to use her share of the loan to buy more chickens to sell.

Isidora’s goal for the future is to expand her business by buying more chickens as well as other animals such as guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.use: To buy produce, chickens and other animals.

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is 43 years old and divorced with two children. She sells crates of drinks and foodstuffs. Shola has been in this business since 2004.  She needs a loan of 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Kai

texts.en: Mr. Kai M. is a duck breeder in the Kouk Roka village in the Takeo province. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it. So he decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Im Moy, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. His wife is presented on the left of the photo. They now live without any children and they hope to increase their income with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Virgin

texts.en:
Virgin G. is already a widow. She was left with two children: Alpha – 22 years old, a high school graduate and Virnhood – 20 years old, a college student. Sending her younger child to school is very costly; she is thankful that her elder daughter is helping financially in providing her with educational needs, for she cannot do it alone. They are living in Barangay (township) Villa Gamiao, San Mateo, Isabela.

To support her children, Virgin is engaged in the hog-raising business. Due to limited capital, she is now asking for financial support amounting to PHP 4,000. The loan will be used to sustain her business and to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs to be free from diseases. Through the business, she is able to provide the basic needs of her family and somehow afford to send her daughter to school. She further said that “there’s nothing wrong in trying; what is wrong is when you have not even tried things you wanted to try”.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say L., 51, is a mother of five children and resides in Takeo, Cambodia. To earn a living, she sells vegetables at the market and earns approximately $50 in revenue per day. Her husband is a carpenter and makes $2.50 of profit a day. All of their children are employed as garment-factory workers and sellers. Mrs. Say L. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to resell it.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to resell

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 24-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his parents. Haidar has owned a mini-market since 2001. He also sells fruits and vegetables. Haidar requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Haidar has requested a loan.
Haidar is special in his work because he has a big variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Gulsora

texts.ru: Хатамова Гулсора проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 28 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей.  Муж работает ремонтом жилых домов. Домохозяйка . Занимается воспитанием детей. Но решила получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка, после откормки , которого сможет продать его, а полученную прибыль использовать для ремонта дома. таким образом она сможет улучшить условия жизни своих детей.
texts.en:
Gulsora H. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 28 years old, married and has four children. Her husband works in home construction. Gulsora is a homemaker. She raises her children. However, she decided to obtain a loan in order to purchase a bull that she can feed and sell. She wants to use the profit to make repairs to her house and improve living conditions for her children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise sheep

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth O. is 30 years old and single with no children. She is a hairstylist. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase a generator. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Oscar Luis

texts.en:
Mr. Oscar M. has been married to Mrs. Yolanda Armoa for eight years. They have a seven-year-old son named Oscar. 

Oscar began working with his uncle, who is a brick-laying contractor. One day his uncle told him he should study to be an electrician so that they didn’t have to hire another person. Oscar studied to be an electrician about nine years ago and now he has his own tools and works for himself. Thanks to Fundación Paraguaya he has his own vehicle to help him transport things for work such as cable.

In the future he would like to open his own hardware store where he could sell all of the things for construction like cable, electrical boxes, circuit breakers and other items for electricians.

loans.use: To purchase cable for electrical installation

loans.name: Zahiriddin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Захириддин Рахматуллаев - молодой человек 1973 года рождения, женат, имеет двоих детей. Занимается купля - продажей и откормом скота. Он покупает у пастухов молодых бычков и, откормив их 3 - 4  месяца, продаёт их на скотных рынках Джаббор - Расуловского района .   Таким образом, он зарабатывает деньги для своей семьи . Кроме того, он занимается производством сырых кирпичей на заказ у себя дома. Ему в этом помогают его младшие братья. Он рад сотрудничеству с нашей организацией и благодарит наших партнеров по КИВА.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Zahiriddin R. is a young man born in 1973. He is married and has two children. He buys and sells and growth feeds cattle. He buys young calves from shepherds and after feeding them for three to four months resells them on the cattle markets of the Jabbar Rasulov region. This way he makes money for his family. Besides that he also takes orders to make raw bricks at his home. His younger brothers help him in this business. He is happy to be working with our organization and is thanking our partners at Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sesariana

texts.en:
Sesariana S. owns and operates a business venture providing hairdressing and beauty services such as manicure, pedicure and others in her community. She is 42 years old, married and has six adult children. They are from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. Sesariana has been in this business for over 29 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sesariana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sesariana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand beauty services provided

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en:
Reyna is 61 years old and is married with eight children.  Three still live with her and her husband in the city of Pucallpa.  Reyna's husband works in agriculture and also helps Reyna with her business of selling clothes.  

Reyna has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank "Los Manguitos" (The Little Mangoes).  Reyna used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to buy staple food items.  She plans to use this loan of 1500 soles to purchase dresses, shirts, blouses, pants and other clothes for sale.  Reyna sells her clothing in the small communities located along the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and joins the Amazon to the north.     

Reyna is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the financial assistance the organization has provided her.  Reyna's goal is to help her children through their studies so that they can have professional careers.

loans.use: Dresses, shirts, blouses, pants and other clothes for sale

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna V. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 43 years old. Verna is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Verna owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Verna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Verna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Verna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Verna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=97760&_tpos=f&_tpg=h
María is a member of the United Friends village bank. 
She is 47 years-old, separated, and has four sons. Her three oldest are married and her youngest studies at the public school. 
María sells clothes, shoes, and now is selling school supplies as well because that’s what her clients have been requesting. Also, in the mornings she works at a restaurant helping to cook. 
María needs a new loan of 1200 soles to buy school supplies and more clothing and shoes merchandise. Her dream is to have her own stand in the market.

loans.use: buy school supplies and more clothing and shoes merchandise

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Minda is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Minda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Minda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Minda is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Minda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Gingoog. She is 54 years old. Conchita is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand the product offering at her store. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used again to purchase new items to expand the product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offering at her store

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Mrs. V., 48 years of age, is a direct seller of cosmetic products in their village, she sells different kinds of AVON products and her weekly net income is PHP500.00.  She wanted to request a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP7,000.00 for her additional requirements in her business. On the side, she also sells food processed products for almost two years.

She is married to Isabelo V., who works as a welder in their village. The couple is blessed with four children namely; Virginia, 28, a housewife, Victor,24, high school graduate, Virgilio,23, a factory worker, and their youngest is Isabelo Jr.,16, third year high school student. They are presently residing at the village of Sta.Cruz, Alicia, Isabela, a rural area where most of the people are blessed with the gift of industriousness. Their main of source of income is farming and vegetable vending.

loans.use: Additional capital for her direct selling business

loans.name: Rocio Magaly

texts.es: La señora  ROCIO MAGALY L. D. , tiene  31 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando en el colegio . La socia se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos como: cremas, colonias, labiales, talcos, anillos, aretes ,etc y  con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro cosméticos como: labiales, colonias, cremas, talcos, etc y con su próximo crédito de 1,700 nuevos soles  comprará cosméticos como: perfumes, cremas, rubores, delineadores, etc .Ella sueña con tener su propia stand en un centro comercial en donde vender sus cosméticos con mayor frecuencia y así aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
ROCIO MAGALY L. D., 31, lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SANTA ELENA II communal bank. She finished 11th grade and has four children who depend on her financially because they are still in school. She sells cosmetics such as: creams, colognes, lipsticks, talcs, rings, earrings, etc. With her initial, 300 new sol loan, she bought cosmetics like: lipsticks, colognes, creams, talcs, etc. With her next 1,700 new sol loan she will buy cosmetics like: perfumes, creams, blushes, eyeliners, etc. She dreams with having her own stand in a shopping center to sell her cosmetics more frequently thereby increasing her sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics like: perfumes, creams, blush, eyeliner, etc.

loans.name: Lagilelei

texts.en:
Lagilelei A. is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Puleia. She is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Lagilelei owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Lagilelei has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lagilelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lagilelei is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Lagilelei plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Maimuna Guyo

texts.en:
Maimuna Guyo A. is married and has six children. For the last two months she has sold charcoal to the soldiers at Barracks military camp near Thika, a market town forty kilometers from Nairobi. Self-described as patient and jovial, Maimuna also sees herself as a hardworking and persevering woman.

While Maimuna will use the proceeds of a 20,000 KES loan to buy more charcoal, the real challenge to Maimuna’s business is the lack of a bigger vehicle to carry more sacks to the camp. Maimuna’s greater goal is to start a new business selling home products such as cooking pots.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en: Maxima M. is from the village of Dulapo. She is 60 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Maxima owns and operates a retail flower business, selling flowers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Maxima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Maxima is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mohamed Traoré est un célibataire de 29 ans et père d’un enfant qui vit  chez ses parents dans le  quartier Niébala de  la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mlai)
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment les travaux journaliers auprès des commerçants de la place. Après des années expériences dans le domaine du commerce il décida de s’installer à son propre compte en ménant l’activité d’achat et de vente des articles d’alimentation. Il a sa boutique sise au grand marché de Bougouni.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à sa première expérience.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique d’alimentaion.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 67 000 FCFA  qui sera utiliser pour agrandir le commerce et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr, Mohamed Traoré is a single, 29-year-old man and father of one child. He lives with his parents in the Niébala quarter of the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having been to school, he very quickly started trying to make money, notably working every day with traders in the square. After gaining several years' experience of this, he decided to start buying and selling food items himself. His little shop is located in the large Bougouni market. Whilst looking for extra financial resources, he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan programme. This is his first time with the programme. With this loan he is planning to buy various food items. He buys his produce from wholesalers in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). His customers are members of the local population. With this loan, he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 67,000 FCFA which will be used to grow his business and cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various food items to sell

loans.name: Beatice

texts.en: Beatice B. bakes bread for sale at Elmina.  Beatice has received junior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher. Beatice has been baking bread for sale for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar, margarine and other ingredients to bake the bread for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: buy more flour, sugar, margarine etc., to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
Emelina F. is from the village of Agoho in Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Emelina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Emelina makes and sells specialty food/snacks products in the local community. Emelina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Emelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelina is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to buy ingredients for the products that she makes. This will be Emelina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Lili Filipe

texts.pt:
Lili Filipe T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 3 filhos de19, 14, anos e 1 de 9 meses de idade, os 2 mais velho vão a escola mas vivem com o pai. Frequenta 12ą classe, não foi possível continuar na altura devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o filho menor não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Matola afim de estar perto do seu local de trabalho. Trabalha no Tribunal Judicial de Maputo há mais de 3 anos como servente tem um horário único das 7:30h as 15:30min. Possui uma empregada que lhe ajuda nos trabalhos de casa e cuidar da filha menor. Recebe um salário mensal de 2.000.00mt e um valor não fixo de bónus de participação, que depende também de n º. de processos de julgamento. Este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos no Banco Procredit mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também já se beneficiaram dos serviços desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, barrotes, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. 
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar perfeitamente a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família
texts.en:
Lili Filipe T. was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 38 years old, single, and is the mother of 3 children. The older two are 19 and 14 years old, and the third is 9 months old. The older children go to school and live with their father. Lili studied up to 12th grade, but wasn't able to continue studying because she couldn't afford it. She lives in her own home with her youngest child, and doesn't support anyone else financially. She moved from the city of Maputo to Matola in order to be close to her work. She has worked in the court system of Maputo for more than 3 years as an assistant. She has a set work schedule, from 7:30 AM to 3:30 PM. She also employs someone to help her with housework and to care for her youngest daughter. She receives a monthly salary of 2000.00 meticales as well as a variable work bonus that depends in part on the number of court cases being tried. She uses her earnings to cover household expenses and also saves some in her bank account. Lili had taken out loans before with Banco Procredit, but later decided not to continue working with them. She heard about Hluvuku from neighbors of hers who had taken advantage of the services it provides. This is her first loan, in the amount of 10,000.00 meticales. She plans to use it to buy construction materials (iron, support beams, cement, sand and other items) to continue with her home improvement project. She promises to repay this loan as agreed, in order to be eligible to take out others in the future. She would like to take out other loans in order to finish working on her house and then furnish it, in order to offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (iron, cement, sand and other items)

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith sells medicines and groceries at retail prices to make a living; she hopes to own a big pharmacy stall in the future. She is 32 years old and is married with three children. Her husband also works to support their home.

Faith is a LAPO client. She is very determined and hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says a very big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

LAPO, (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Jeinalyn

texts.en:
Jeinalyn A. is from the village of Tinongos, Pugaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Jeinalyn runs a sari-sari (variety) shop that she has just started.

In 2010, Jeinalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeinalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jeinalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Puga-an, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Gardenia Dominga

texts.es:
Gardenia García de 43 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Su esposo Jorge vende carne al por mayor, ellos tienen 4 hijos de 23, 21, 17, 13 años de edad.

Cuando Gardenia y Jorge se casaron no tenían donde vivir, el primo de ella les alquilo un lugar para que vivan, ellos desde hay pusieron un puesto de venta de frutas para poder mantenerse. Pero después del tiempo ellos pudieron comprar un solar y construir su propia casa, decidieron continuar con el puesto de frutas e incluir víveres para tener su propia tienda. 

Por esa buena decisión ahora tienen una tienda surtida, en ocasiones su hija de 17 años le ayuda. Trabajan desde muy temprano hasta las 22:30 pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes para su tienda, cuadernos y hojas para la época escolar que comenzó el primero de abril. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para convertirlo en taxi.
texts.en:
Gardenia García is 43 years old, she lives in the urban zone of Guasmo (named after a species of trees; Guazuma Almifolia. Guasmo is a popular neighborhood,with people of humble background which used to be a hacienda) in Guayaquil. Her husband Jorge sells meat wholesale and they have 4 children, 23, 21, 17, and 13 years of age.

When Gardenia and Jorge got married they did not have a place to live. Her cousin rented them a place to live, and they set up a stand selling fruit to be able to live. But eventually they managed to buy a plot and build their own house. They decided to continue with the fruit stand and include groceries in order to have their own shop.

Because of their good decision they now own a well-assorted store. Occasionally their 17-year-old daughter helps them. They work from very early until 10:30 pm.

With the loan she will buy meat for her store, notebooks and sheets for the school season that starts early April. In the future she wishes to buy a vehicle to use as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, notebooks, sheets.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson runs a food stall and retail shop in Naivasha, Kenya. He is 39 years old, married to Ann Njeri, and they have three children who go to school.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan. He paid off the first loan of KES 15,000 successfully and on time. He plans to buy sugar, flour and rice, in bulk, to sell in his retail shop. He hopes his retail shop will grow into a wholesale store in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and rice in bulk to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 67 year old married man who has five children whose ages are between 26-39 years.  Only one of his children is still school.  He has been raising livestock for fourteen years.  He sells animal products such as milk and eggs and employs one person.  He has been a member of Faulu Kenya under a loan group where he saves his money weekly.  Being a member of the group, he can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya.  So far, he has taken two loans which he used to boost his business and has successfully repaid them.  He has requested for a loan of Kes. 70, 000 to buy a dairy cow and animal feed.  He hopes to own over ten cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Heing's Group

texts.en: Five people have selected Mrs. Heing K. as a group leader. This goup is located in Ta Reap Doun Sar village in Kandal province. The members of this group loan will each use a small portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Heing K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can earn a little money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Khom Korng, is a fisherman. Now she has some problems because her husband’s fish net is too old to use. So, to improve this fishing, Mrs. Heing K. is seeking for loan to buy a fishing net and morning glories to grow. She is a mother of two children, one is a construction worker, while the other is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials needed to improve his home

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Magaret B. operates a provision store at Takoradi. She has been through senior high school and is married with three children.

Magaret has been selling provisions for some time now and helps her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of four and all her children go to school. She owns a stall in Kawempe market selling vegetables. She buys these vegetables from the same market where she works and so doesn’t incur any transport costs. Besides this vegetable business she also sells Irish potatoes, cassava, sweet potatoes, and yams concurrently.  She has done this business for years and works seven days a week. She sells vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions, cucumber, etc.   

Mary wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of cabbages, onions, tomatoes, and a bag of Irish potatoes. Her main challenge is that selling vegetables is seasonal and she is aspiring of going directly to farmers.  Mary decided to join MCDT because of timely loans. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricitybut no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cabbges, tomatoes, onions, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 42 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Elena owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Elena is just starting this business.

In 2010, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and build a permanent pig shelter. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and build a permanent pig shelter

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: H. Elise est née le 26 Juillet 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elise est mariée et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elise vit avec sa famille au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Elise vend du pâté (fait à base de la farine de blé) dans son quartier. Elise s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Elise sollciite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son revenu. Le premier crédit que Elise avait obtenu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
H. Elise was born on July 26, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married and the mother of four children who are all in school.  She lives with her family in the Ayélawadjè district in Cotonou.  The couple jointly ensure that their family expenses are covered. To provide for her needs and those of her children, Elise sells pâté (made with wheat flour) in her area.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  This is the second loan that Elise has requested from ALIDé with the goal of boosting her business and increasing her revenues.  The first loan she obtained has been repaid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of wheat flour and some vegetable oil

loans.name: Saragoza

texts.es: Saragoza tiene 43 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ello tiene tres hijos; Ely, Roly y Dina, de 18, 15 y 13 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en el poblado de Triboline, donde tienen su propia casa. Para Saragoza, su pasión está en el campo, ya que lo vive con gran intensidad y le gusta estar en contacto con la naturaleza, es por ello que ya tiene 26 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, en donde produce y comercializa cacao y frutas en general.
