This loan will be used to buy 20 packages of calebasses and 4 baskets of condiments (garlic, peppers, fresh tomatoes, etc). They get their supplies in Tonan for the calebasses, and mostly in Bamako (capital of Mali) for the condiments. Calebasses are resold at the Château market in Ségou, at home, and at fairs in Dougabougou, Siribala and Macina. Condiments are resold at the Château market in Ségou, to a clientele comprising mainly women.

The women count on turning an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 65), to be used to repay the loan and to provide for the family expenses (soap and clothes for the children). They ambition to diversify their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 packages of "calebasses" and 4 baskets of condiments (garlic, peppers, fresh tomatoes, etc)

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en: Melodina O. is from the town of Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Melodina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Melodina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy necessary materials for agriculture

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes H. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Lourdes owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Susan Day

texts.es:
Susan tiene 21 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo en casa de una tía, ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

En Abril de este año ella y su esposo compraron un auto usado con el cual vienen trabajando en la compra y distribución de ropa; ellos viajan a Ecuador o a Lima dos a tres veces por mes para comprar su mercandería y distribuirla en los principales establecimientos de la ciudad; adicionalmente su esposo trabaja como taxista en el auto cuando no están fuera de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso y la antigüedad del vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir desperfectos mecánicos en el motor por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Su más grande anhelo es llegar a ahorrar el dinero suficiente para comprarse un lote de terreno y contruir en él su casa propia, ellos no perciben otro tipo de ingresos económicos por lo que la reparación de su vehículo es muy importante para el logro de sus objetivos.

Susan es muy estimada por sus clientes y vecinos, ellos la consideran una mujer responsable y entregada a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Susan is 21, and she lives with her husband in her aunt’s house, which is located in the José Leonardo Ortiz district. This is five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. In April of this year she and her husband bought a used car. They use it working in the sale and distribution of clothes. They travel to Ecuador or to Lima two or three times a month to buy their merchandise and distribute it to the main establishments in the city. Also, her husband works as a taxi driver in the car when they are not away from Chiclayo. The continual use and the age of the vehicle have made it start to have mechanical problems with the motor. That is why she has seen the need to ask our institution, for the first time, for a loan for 2,000 PEN. She plans to use it for the repair and maintenance of their car. Her biggest goal is to save enough money to buy some land and build her own house. They do not have another type of income, so the repair of their vehicle is very important to achieve their goals. Susan is held in high esteem by her customers and neighbors. They consider her to be a responsible woman and very involved in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of their vehicle

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly B. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 34 years old and single. To make a living, Rosaly owns & operates a retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Rosaly has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosaly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and be able to engage in expanded business activities. Rosaly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosaly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her business’s product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosaly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her business’s product offering.

loans.name: Naomi Cheptarus

texts.en:
Naomi is 47 years old, married and is blessed with six children. Her clothing business is located at Chembulet in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan Naomi is expecting from KADET she intends to add more clothes for sale for both adults and children and for both genders. 

Her future dreams are to open a food kiosk so that she can have financial sustainability.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more readymade clothes for both adults and children.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
“Sacrifice and humility are necessary in achieving success in life,” says Janet B.. Janet is married to Eric, a tricycle driver. This couple is blessed with three children: Erica-ten years old,grade-V pupil;Angelica-eight,grade-II pupil and Linette-four years old. 

Janet is selling snacks and frozen foods in their village.  Her husband sometimes helps her in her business. She would like to purchase additional snacks and frozen foods for her to generate bigger income for her family needs. In this regard, she would like to apply a loan amounting PHP5,000 for her business improvement. She hopes that she could avail this amount so that she could be able to budget it wisely.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending activity

loans.name: Bernarda Lucila

texts.es: La Señora Bernarda Lucia tiene la edad de 41 años, tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo, sus propósitos son de seguir con su negocio adelante para sacar adelante a su familia. Sus deseos son de seguir luchando para darle mejoras a su vivienda. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta ropa nueva. Hace más de  5 años, ella inicia este negocio porque necesitaba un medio que le generara ingresos para su familia y acude a la venta de estos productos, por lo que logra ver los resultados de sus sacrificios. Es el destino del  financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de los productos como pantalones, faldas, camisolas, shorts y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Sra. Bernarda Lucia is 41 years old and has one dependent child. She intends to move her business forward so that she can support her family. In addition, she hopes to continue working hard so that she can make improvements to her home.

Bernarda sells new clothing. She started her business 5 years ago as a means of generating income for her family. Everything she has achieved has been a result of many sacrifices. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase trousers, skirts, camisoles, shorts, and undergarments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 42 years old and married with two children. His wife is a hairstylist. He makes and sells cellophane bags at retail prices to his customers within his community in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more materials to make more cellophane bags to sell. With this business he hopes to meet the basic needs of his family. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Heidi D. is from the village of Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Heidi is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Heidi owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Heidi has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Heidi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Heidi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Heidi is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Heidi from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar A. is married. He has one child. Yashar was born in 1974. A.'s family lives in Baku city. He has had a taxi business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Abduzoir

texts.ru: Холиков Абдузоир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Холиков Абдузоир имеет высшее образование. В области животноводства работает 4 года. Холиков Абдузоир откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Abduzoir H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. Abduzoir H. has a higher education. He has been working in the animal husbandry field for 4 years. Abduzoir H. raises and sells livestock. He is obtaining this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Soraida is the coordinator of her group 'Minerva Mirabal' (named after one of the famed trio of sisters who stood up to Dictator Rafael Trujillo and paid the ultimate price for doing so), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital Santo Domingo where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her 5 children.

Soraida is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bacon and sausage by purchasing 180 lbs of meat. She will use the profits to invest in her business with the goal of one day owning a corner store that will meet all the needs of the people in her neighborhood. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Meat with which to make bacon and sausage

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is a 49-year-old, married woman from the village of Malaubang in Ozamiz City. Veronica has 4 school-age children. To earn a living, Veronica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells snacks, including a local delicacy known as "puto maya," and coffee to her community members. Veronica has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. In turn, she is hoping to improve her standard of living as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Veronica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 42-year-old married man and father of 5 children of whom three are unemployed. He has owned a vegetable shop since 2006 with a previous 8 years of experience in this occupation. He offers all types of vegetables according to the season and he's making a good income. 

Today, Mohsen is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy more vegetables from some farmer in addition to vegetable boxes to present his products to his customers.

loans.use: buy more vegetables from a farmer in addition oto vegetable boxes

loans.name: Ramona Del Socorro

texts.es: Ramona Del Socorro tiene 65 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que su medio de vida es lo que le proporciona a su familia el pan de cada día. Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante por lo que obtiene mucho más clientes de esta Manera sus clientes la tratan con mucho cariño es conocida por Monchita pues ellos se sienten muy contentos. Anteriormente laboraba en la alcaldía pero debido a la necesidad de llevar más ingresos a su hogar. Su deseo es tener otra fuente de ingreso necesaria. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de talcos, cremas, colonias, perfumes y pinturas.
texts.en:
Ramona Del Socorro is 65 years old and makes a living selling cosmetics. She has worked in this business for more than 11 years, and her work is how she provides for her family each day. She sells her products as a street vendor and has managed to obtain many customers in this way. Her customers treat her with much affection—they call her Monchita, since she always makes them feel happy. She used to work in the mayor’s office, but left that job because she needed to bring in more income for her household. Her wish is to have another source of income. The loan is for working capital, which Ramona will use to purchase talcum powder, creams, colognes, perfumes, and makeup.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing cosmetics

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma S. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Vilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business by buying more bananas to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel Antonio F. H. de  55 años de edad,  es padre soltero tienen 2  hijos independientes. Tiene casa propia ubicada en Santiago. Labora como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para realizar unas mejoras en su domicilio. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel Antonio F. H. is 55 years old. He is a single father of two independent children. He has his own house located in Santíago. He works as a farmer at an agricultural factory. He is a hard worker, and thanks to his effort he has saved enough to live well. He requests this loan in order to make improvements to his house. His dream is to manage to build the whole dwelling in order to achieve a better quality of life. He is very appreciative for the support that we can offer through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his house

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh T. N. was born in 1976. She lives in Luong Quy village. She is married with a son. She is a tailor. Besides that, she breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8.066.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and poultry

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margret is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her sisters' children. She owns a store in Kisaasi selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people.  both  Margaret is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister's children.  She owns a store in Kisaasi selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal.  Margaret doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for five years. Besides this charcoal business, she also sells second hand clothes. Her major customers are her neighbors. She works seven days a week. Margaret's biggest challenges are seasonality and debtors. She aspires to educate her children up to university and to start going directly to villages for charcoal. She joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mohammad Hanef

texts.en: M. Hanef is the son of M. R.. He lives in district of 8, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children who are in school. He wants to take a loan for his fruit and vegetable shop. He would like to expand his business and buy more items for his shop that he does not stock but are in high demand in the market. He would like to say that Kiva is an effective process.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios T. lives in the village of Lugait in Misamis  Oriental. She is 71 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. She makes a living running a retail shop where she sells seafood products such as fish and shrimp to people who live in her community. She has been in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el sector Monteverde del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Ofelia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo Carmen se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Adicionalmente trabaja vendiendo comida en su domicilio, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades apoya a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Ella trabaja incansablemente por mantenerse en estas actividades.

Ofelia desea adquirir mas productos de belleza para empezar a contar con un stock permanente que permita a sus clientes agenciarse de los productos cuando los necesitan si tener que esperar hasta el fin de mes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y honrada, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband in the Monteverde sector of the district of Tambogrande, which is in the province and region of Piura. The area is known for its residents who primarily grow fruit.

Ofelia sells beauty products by catalog. She has a group of customers who buy her products on a frequent basis. The more orders she obtains, the more points she earns from the company to buy merchandise and generate higher profits. For this reason, Ofelia strives to attract more customers.

In addition, she sells food out of her home. The earnings she receives from this business help support her husband, a farmer, with stabilizing the family finances. She works tirelessly to maintain her business activities.

Ofelia wants to acquire more beauty products so that she can establish a permanent inventory that will allow her to supply her customers with products immediately without having to wait until the end of the month. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN.

Ofelia is a hardworking and honorable woman. Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can improve the quality of life for her family. In the area where she lives, Ofelia is well-known and respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: D. Emilienne est née le 19 Mars 1972 et est mariée à GBETINDE Sébastien, un matelassier. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a quatre ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Yagbé à Cotonou, capitale économique du  Bénin. Emilienne et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Emilienne  prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs) à Cotonou. Emilienne achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu six prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de jour en jour nombreuse de sa clientèle, Emilienne sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Emilienne D. was born on the 19th March 1972 and is married to Sebastien Gbetinde, a quilter. The couple have four children in their care, of which 3 are their own children. It's been four years since the family settled in the Yabe district of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Emilienne and her husband together cover all the household expenses. To achieve this, Emilienne prepares and sells food (corn paste) in Cotonou. Emilienne buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is a longterm client of ALIDe, having taken out 6 loans, all of which have been diligently repaid. In order to strengthen her business, and to better face the growing demands of her clientele, Emilienne is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et des condiments de sauce.

loans.name: Margaret  Naanyu

texts.en:
Margaret Naanyu K. is 33 years old. She is single and the mother of two children, 2 and 6 years old. Margaret has been farming on her own piece of land for the last ten years.
  
Margaret learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend 20,000 KES to buy chemicals and fertilizers for sukumawiki (green leafy vegetables) which she has already planted and 30,000 KES to prepare land to plant more vegetables. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to reinvest in the farm and plant different varieties of vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, and spinach. Her hope and dream is to become a large scale vegetable farmer and to start fruit farming. Margaret is a hardworking woman and, with the right resources, she can do great.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizers for sukumawiki which she has already planted and to prepare land to plant more vegetables

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: K. Martine est née en 1968 à Avrankou dans le département de l’Ouémé. Martine est mariée à TIKO Alfred et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Martine vit ensemble avec sa famille au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis trois ans environs.  C’est ensemble avec son mari que Martine fait face aux différentes charges de son foyer. Martine n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Martine vend des friperies à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. C’est la deuxième fois que Martine sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle. Martine a bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Martine K. was born in 1968 in Avrankou, in the Department of Ouémé. Martine is married to Alfred Tiko and is the mother of 3 children, all of whom have been educated. Martine and her family have lived in the Agbodjèdo neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about 3 years. Together with her husband, Martine faces the varied challenges of managing the household. Martine has not been to school. For the past ten years, Martine has sold used clothes in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, which has allowed her to meet her needs and those of her family. This is the second time Martine has sought a loan from ALIDé, with the goal of building her business and her client base. Martine repaid her first loan on time.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es: María Jesús M. G. 48 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilobasco ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas, vive junto a sus dos sobrinos de 18 y 12 años de edad, los cuales no solo se dedican a estudiar sino también a ayudarle a María con los quehaceres del hogar como también a atender el negocio. María es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, que ha pesar que desempeña tanto el rol de madre como el de padre, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus dos sobrinos cuentan con todo lo necesario y así mismo se dedican a estudiar gracias a los enormes esfuerzos de María. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, y también comercializa verduras a las afueras de su casa. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y verduras, de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
María Jesús M. G. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Ilobasco, located in the Cabañas department. She lives with her two nephews, ages 18 and 12. Both of them attend school and also help María with the household chores and help tend the business. María is a very responsible and hard working mother who fills the role of both mother and father and who has managed to move her family ahead. Her nephews have all they need and are able to attend school, thanks to María’s enormous efforts. She has a store where she sells food items, such as bread, sweets, and other things such as ham, and shampoo. She also sells vegetables right outside her home. María is asking for this loan so that she can stock her store a bit more by buying large quantities of corn, and vegetables so that she can better tend to her customers’ needs and increase her sales. Getting ahead with her family is a priority for her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Tiene 1 hijo de 9 años a su cargo, el se encarga de ser una padre responsable, para que su hijo obtenga lo necesario. El ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma   ya que el siempre está pendiente de sus pagos. Este crédito es para realizar mejoras a su camión que lo ocupan en diferentes tareas.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis has been a client of Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time, so this is not the first time he has received financing. He has been providing transportation services for more than thirteen years. Jorge has a nine year old son who is a dependent. Being a responsible father, Jorge wants to provide everything his son needs.

He has demonstrated that he completes his payments in a timely manner and always handles them with care. This loan will be used to make repairs to his truck, which is used for different tasks.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Banche  Mireille  Aimée

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 40ans mère célibataire de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie de 22ans à 9 ans et ayant 1e  personne en charge tous scolarisés. En 1999 elle se lance dans la vente des produits pharmaceutiques avec un capital de 150000frs. Ses ventes sont de 15000 à 60000 frs par jours.

Sa stratégie est d’épargner pour aller de l’avant. Elle aimerait être fournisseur et bien scolariser ses enfants afin qu’ils deviennent l'une des grand cadre de ce pays.

Réputée dans lla pharmacie, avec ce prêt elle va acheter des quinines,des seringues,de l'alcool, du paracetamol, de la nivaquine,des sirop. 
Elle à une bonne réputation dans son entourage elle on l'appel maman docteur.
texts.en: This shopkeeper is a single 40 year-old mother of four, whose children and one ward are aged 9 to 22 years old and all attend school. In 1999 she started her own business selling pharmaceutical products, with base funds of 150,000 FRS. She generates between 15,000 and 60,000 FRS of sales every day.  Her strategy is to save money going forward; she would like to be a supplier and pay for her children's education so that they will be successful in life. She has an excellent reputation in her field, and aims to use this loan in order to purchase quinine, syringes, alcohol, paracetamol, nivaquine and syrups. She is held in such high esteem that those around her call her 'Mother Doctor'.

loans.use: Achat nivaquine, aspirine,paracetamol,seringue

loans.name: Yurima Patricia

texts.es:
Yurima Patricia O. A. es una joven mujer que vive en el barrio Villa San Carlos en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge  dedicado a la compra y venta de madera  y  con sus tres hijos en las edades de 4, 8 y 12 años.  
En el año 2006 Yurima y su esposo iniciaron un negocio de tienda para aumentar sus ingreso familiares , pero Yurima empezó a darle un cambio gradual al esquema de su negocio y fue poco a poco cambiando su actividad por la venta y oferta de productos de mayor rentabilidad, como papelería,  bebidas frías, cervezas y gaseosas , a las que adicionó otros servicios como el de internet y también de fotocopiaje  e impresión,  haciendo su actividad mas coherente con lo que ella le gusta y adicionó también que con ello puede atender a sus hijos  menores de edad.   Finalmente el  gran sueño de Yurima es convertir su negocio en una inmensa papelería con   oferta multifuncional de servicios avanzados de comunicaciones, donde también ofrezca  meriendas, dulces y mecatos para que sus clientes estén cómodos y se deleiten con el servicio. En la actualidad está muy contenta con lo que tiene, su papelería le genera una  utilidad bruta  de un 25%, los refrescos y bebidas  entre el  49%  y 50% y últimamente adicionó un computador y una impresora con las que espera, que le ofrezcan estos dos servicios, un margen de contribución de un 90%.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el anterior logró aumentar sus ingresos, porque contó con un nuevo capital de trabajo para responder a sus clientes. Con su credikiva comprará cervezas, refrescos y confitería alistándose para la temporada del final de año que se avecina. Su sueño y gran felicidad  es estudiar belleza y que sus hijos logren tener una profesión que les permita ser exitosos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Yurima Patricia O. A. is a young woman living in the Villa San Carlos neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla with her spouse, who is a lumber merchant, and their three children who are 4, 8 and 12 years old.

In 2006 Yurima and her husband opened a grocery store to increase family income.  However, Yurima gradually modified its nature stocking more profitable items like paper goods, cold beverages, beer and soft drinks as well as services like Internet access, photocopying and printing thereby making her business more in tune with her likes while at the same time making it possible for her to care for her minor children.

Yurima’s ultimate dream is to turn her business into a huge stationery store offering a multitude of advanced communication services as well as meals, candy and snacks so that her customers will be more comfortable and enjoy the services.

She is currently quite happy with what she has.  Her stationery store generates a gross profit of 25%, the beverages and soft drinks around 49%-50% and she recently added a computer and printer that she expects will generate 90% profits.

This is her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Her previous loan made it possible for her to increase income because she had new working capital with which to react to customer needs.

She will use this Kiva loan to buy beer, beverages and snacks to prepare for the approaching end of year season.

Her dream and great happiness is to study to be a Beautician and that her children attain professions that will permit them to be successful in the future.

loans.use: She will buy beer, soft drinks and snacks to stock up for the end of year season.

loans.name: Barbara Obdulia

texts.es:
Barbara Obdulia S. F. tiene 50 anos. Es soletera  vive con la hija, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hija que se llama Jessica de 17 años.

Los miembros de la V:R:C: Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Barbara trabaja en la bananera realizando labores como la limpieza de los riego en la hacienda desde hace un año, hacen compras en Comercial Murillo en Ventanas.  

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta lavar cocinar y bailar.
texts.en:
Barbara Obdulia S. F. is 50 years old, single, and lives with her 17 year old daughter Jessica in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  

The members of the V:R:C Dole 2 work as farmers on the Dole banana plantation, which is located in the center of the canton.  All of the group members live in the canton of Ventanas, and the majority have worked at the plantation for more than a year.  There are about 13 members in the group.

For more than a year, Barbara's job on the banana plantation has been to clean the irrigation systems and shop at the Murillo store in Ventanas.

She is asking for this loan in order to set up a business in her home and purchase merchandise for the business.  The support of this loan will help her financially be able to meet her needs.  Her dream is to improve her home and achieve her goal of opening a business.  

She likes to clean, cook, and dance.

loans.use: Improve her home to include a store and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro Antonio M. de 51 años de edad, es una persona la cual debe trabajar muy duro para sostener a su extensa familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa y seis hijos, todos menores de edad. Pedro posee una panadería en la cual se encarga de elaborar el pan y así mismo repartirlo con los diferentes clientes. Este negocio es muy importante para Pedro como para su familia, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual obtenga el dinero necesario para invertir en la panadería, comprando harina, azúcar, sal, levadura y otros productos más, todo esto con el deseo de aumentar su producción y así mismo de mejorar sus ventas, el mayor deseo de Pedro es de poder solventar todas las necesidades de sus hijos, por lo cual lucha día con día por salir adelante y darles todo lo mejor a ellos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio Marroquin is 51 years old and works hard to support his large family which is comprised of a wife and six minor children.

He owns a bakery and makes bread which he delivers to his customers.  This business is very important for Pedro and his family since it is the only source of income they have.  

He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast and other products for the bakery.  He wants to increase production and improve sales so he can meet his childrens' needs.  He works hard every day to develop his business and provide the best he can for his wife and children.

loans.use: To buy bakery ingredients.

loans.name: Margaret Ene

texts.en:
Margaret has been raising livestock in Naivasha town for the last 12 years. She is a 42-year-old lady married to M. Ole Katieny. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in Naivasha. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy 25 sheep to raise and sell later, in oder to meet the high demand during the festive season.

In the future she hopes to be a major supplier of livestock to slaughter houses in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 25 sheep

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Tong C., 33, is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. C. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being well-supplied with freshwater from major rivers. 

C. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 1.7 per day. The family has to spend USD 23 on food, USD 3 on electricity, and USD 14 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for her husband to operate his business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia  al lado de su esposo y sus dos  hijos; juntos luchan cada día por salir adelante.Desde hace 7 años, esta emprendedora mujer comercializa ropa y calzado que ofrece de casa en casa a sus vecinos y amistades. La mercadería la brinda al crédito  y de acuerdo al plazo que ha convenido con sus clientes, regresa para cobrarles, es por esta razón que siempre  tiene un control detallado de sus ventas para  evitar perdidas. Por el buen manejo del dinero de su negocio ha logrado  establecerse con cantidad de clientes que le realizan regulares compras con frecuencia, y en el futuro tiene planeado dedicarse a esta actividad con miras a establecer un lugar fijo de ventas.Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y esta muy comprometida en  pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos los  integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el dinero que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Lourdes tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería  y espera aprovechar esta época de intensas lluvias que existen por su zona y comercializar cantidad de  casacas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 38 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and two children.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.

For the past 7 years, this enterprising woman has been selling clothes and shoes which she offers from door to door, to her neighbors and friends.  She provides her merchandise on credit and, in accordance with the repayment terms that she has agreed with her customers, she returns to collect payment later.  This is why she always has detailed control of her sales, so that she doesn't make any losses.  Through her good management of her business money, she has managed to set herself up with a number of customers who make regular purchases from her.  In the future, she plans to carry out this business activity with a view to setting up a permanent sales location.

This is Lourdes' ninth loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She likes being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people and very supportive of each other.  She would also like to thank the people who will make this loan possible as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.

Lourdes plans to invest her money in buying a larger quantity of merchandise and she hopes to take advantage of the rainy season in her area to sell a large number of jackets.

loans.use: To buy jackets to stock her business

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 40, is a widowed farmer who lives with her young child in the Takeo province. She is also makes and sells brooms, and typically makes US$5 of profit every day.  Bun would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profit, she is asking for US$400 to raise cows and purchase rice to resell.

loans.use: Raise cows and sell rice.

loans.name: James Gathii

texts.en:
James has been selling diesel in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is 35 years old, married to Hannah Wanja, and they have two children.  

James was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this new loan amount to buy more fuel to sell.

In the future, James hopes to grow his diesel shop to a petrol station offering different types of services.

loans.use: To buy more fuel to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa B. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Elsa is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting vegetables for sell like stringbeans & mongo beans. She also plants and harvests corn. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 23 years old and is still single. She is the only one in her family who works. For that reason, Clarisse works hard in order to provide everything necessary for her family. She owns a small business selling various products such as body lotion, water and soap. Clarisse has 3 years of experience in this business and her business is well-organized. The hours of her shop are from 6am until 10pm every day.

Clarisse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods to sell. Clarisse hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to save money for her future. Clarisse will build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
As a single parent of four children, Leni is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leni is 56 years old. Leni has one kid who is in school.

Leni has a general store business in the Philippines. Leni requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Leni has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Leni would like to send her kids to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Pascali M. is 55 years old.  He is married to Mary. They live in Kituluni, Kenya.  Pascall runs a  retail shop located at Kituluni market. He was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Pascali has been running his business for 10 years.  His business gives him a monthly profit of 10,000 Kshs.  This loan of 50,000 Kshs is his second loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use it to increase his stocks of sugar, cooking oil, soap, detergents and flour. If the loan boosts his business, he wishes to expand his business.

Pascali describes himself as an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: restock his store with sugar, cooking oil, soap, detergents and flour

loans.name: Avag

texts.en:
Avag G. lives in Ejmiatsin with his brother and pensioner parents. Avag is a student. His brother is a driver. Avag is engaged in sales. He sells food and household goods. The income he gets is not enough to pay for education. 

Avag wants to increase his food and household goods variety and develop his business. With the requested loan he plans to purchase more goods and expand the business. With the loan’s help Avag will get more income and will be able to pay for his education.

loans.use: to pay for goods for resale.

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela J. is from the village of Gata Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Stela is single. To make a living, Stela operates a family member's rice farm. Stela has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Stela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Stela is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Stela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth nació en la ciudad de Cusco departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 35 años y está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. 

Ruth es profesional y en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ella y su esposo Efraín tiene un negocio de venta de Computadoras.  

Ha solicitado Ruth a la Asociación Arariwa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para hacer una maestría y para pagar la mercadería de los cosméticos. Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Ruth es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. Ruth tiene como sueño tener su propia casa y terminar una maestría.
texts.en:
Ruth was born in the city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children.

Ruth is a professional and sells beauty products in her free time. She and her husband Efraín have a business selling computers.

Ruth is requesting a loan from Asociación Araiwa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can pursue a Master’s degree and pay for a shipment of cosmetics. The income she earns from selling her products enables her to cover her loan payments.

Ruth is well-known for being a hardworking and responsible woman, as well as a good mother who wants to provide a better future for her children and an improved quality of life for her family. Her dreams are to have a house of her own and to finish her Master’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and pay for an advanced degree.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and farming equipment for her rice farming business. 

Leonila has been in this business for five years. Leonila earns additional income from rice retailing. 

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to buy additional farmland in the future.

loans.use: To purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and farming equipment.

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont tous des femmes mariées  qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Âgées d’au moins  30 et ayant  5  enfants en moyenne, elles résident dans le village de NIARADOUGOU  situé à environ 23 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du maïs, du gombo et du poivron, ces produits sont vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso comme leur collègue il y’a plus de 5 ans. Le groupe est à son sixième cycle de prêt de campagne. Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
ASSETOU, est la présidente de ce groupe, elle se tient debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo, compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée et le reste comme frais de labours. L’intrant sera acheté au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
ASSETOU envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 12.000 à 17 500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Les cinq membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont tous des femmes mariées  qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Âgées d’au moins  30 et ayant  5  enfants en moyenne, elles résident dans le village de NIARADOUGOU  situé à environ 23 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du maïs, du gombo et du poivron, ces produits sont vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso comme leur collègue il y’a plus de 5 ans. Le groupe est à son sixième cycle de prêt de campagne. Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
ASSETOU, est la présidente de ce groupe, elle se tient debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo, compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée et le reste comme frais de labours. L’intrant sera acheté au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
ASSETOU envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 12.000 à 17 500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.

loans.use: Pour l’achat d’intrant agricole et frais de labours

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell. Helen has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Agé de 39 ans, Kokou est revendeur de charbon de bois  et d’igname à domicile. Il a commencé son activité en  1992 et s’approvisionne aussi bien à Atakpamé  qu’à  Danyi dans le KLOTO. Kodjo est marié à une revendeuse  et est père de 02 enfants. Ce deuxième crédit va lui permettre de stocker plus d’ignames et de sacs de charbon de bois pour la revente.
texts.en:
Kokou is 39 years old. He sells charcoal and yams from his home, an activity started in 1992. He gets his stock both in Atakpamé and in Danyi, in the Kloto region. 

Kokou is married to a reseller and he is the father of two children. This second loan will allow him to stock up on yams and sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy yams and sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling shoes for four years. She started her business with 1,500,000 UGX of capital earned from farm products. Now her working capital is 4,000,000 UGX. Her vision is to diversify her business by also selling clothes and educating children. Jolly intends to use this loan to buy shoes to resell.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a hospitable business lady. She is married and blessed with 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. For the last two years, she has been running a beauty salon to make a living. She supplements income from this venture with the salary she earns from her employment.  In the next 5 years she wants to have progressed and expanded her business so she can cater to a greater clientele. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a blow dryer and hair shampoo. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to budget.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair shampoo

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is engaged in an agricultural business. She has a glasshouse. Besides agriculture, Armine also runs a grocery shop. Armine needs some financial investments to develop her agricultural business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Armine will increase her income and insure better living conditions for her family. Armine lives together with her parents.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 33 years. She is 63 years old, married to Erastus and they have six school-going children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. Esther repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In future, Esther hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Ibaldo

texts.es:
Jose está muy contento porque ha mejorado sus ingresos, ya que ha podido comprar electrodomésticos como planchas, ventiladores, televisores, licuadoras etc. Con la ayuda de su esposa ha vendido los electrodomésticos y ha podido tener más tiempo con su familia. 

El quiere seguir generando ingresos para su familia por eso quiere un nuevo préstamo para seguir trabajando con su esposa. Quiere comprar mercadería para fin de año ya que es cuando más se vende los electrodomésticos  como televisores, ventiladores, licuadoras etc.  Esta haciendo todo lo posible por mejorar poco a poco la infraestructura de su casa, para darle un buen lugar donde vivir a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is very happy.   He has increased his income because he was able to buy appliances such as irons, fans, televisions, blenders, etc.  With the help of his wife, he sold the appliances and has been able to spend more time with his family.  

He wants to continue generating income for his family, so he would like a new loan so he can continue working with his wife.  He wants to buy merchandise for the end of the year as this is when more appliances such as televisions, fans, blenders, etc., are sold.  Little by little, he is doing all that he can to make improvements to the infrastructure of his house so that he can give his family a nice place to live.

loans.use: purchase appliances such as televisions, blenders, fans, etc.

loans.name: Czarina Marie Joyce

texts.en:
Czarina Marie Joyce is from the town of Centro 1, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 22 years old. At her young age she is now already works hard to provide her children's needs. She owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products near a school. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day from it.

Czarina Marie Joyce joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Now, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mana'

texts.en:
Mana' is a young man who is 24 years old and lives at the borders of the capital, Sana'a. He is still single and living with his parent. He is a university student studying at the Faculty of Education, Sana'a University.

Mana' bought his taxi two years ago with the support of his father so that the young man could start his life and cover his own personal and educational expenses as well as save for marriage. Mana' faced a challenge of whether to be free for his taxi or to study but eventually could do both. He is free to do the taxi business after university hours.

Mana' faced a financial challenge as the income of his taxi is used to support his study when his taxi broke down and he became unable to cover the cost of maintenance. Then he took a loan of 100,000 Rials from AMB to repair his taxi. The taxi has been broken down for a couple of months. 

Mana' hopes to save money in order to replace the current taxi that is usually broken down due to mechanical problems, with a new taxi. He is also planning to save for marriage.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: Karimzhon

texts.ru: Каримжон добросовестный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у него четверо детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он начинал свой бизнес 7 лет назад с арендования 50 соток земли и начал выращивать сельхозпродукты. В данный момент имеет дехканское хозяйство 12 гектар земли, где посеяно 2 гектар пшеницы, 70 соток лука, 20 соток чеснок и на 1 гектар имеет готовую продукцию моркови. Каримжон собирает урожай и на его место хочет посеять лук. Для переработки земли ему нужны минеральные удобрения и ГСМ.  С этой он запрашивает займ и заранее благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Karimzhon is an honest and goal-oriented man. He is married and has four children. He cultivates various crops. He started his business seven years ago, renting a 0.5 hectare plot of land and starting to grow crops. At the moment, he has a farm of 12 hectares, where he had sown 2 hectares of wheat, 0.7 hectares of onions and 0.2 hectares of garlic. He also has 1 hectare of carrots, ready to harvest. Karimzhon is harvesting his crops and would like to plant onions. To prepare the land, he needs mineral fertilizers and fuel. With this intention, he is asking for a loan and thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura de 43 años de edad, convive hace 25 años con Agustín de 49 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos de los cuales sólo viven con 2 de 20 y 18 años. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en el distrito de la Unión. Maura se dedica a la agricultura con la siembra de verduras como: ruda, orégano y manzanilla plantas que no necesitan mucha asistencia, inversión y tiempo. “El negocio es constante cada vez que mis plantaciones están grandes, las corto, las amarro en pequeños paquetes y las que vendo a 0.50 céntimos cada uno”, explica. Además detalla que sembrar este tipo de vegetales es más sencillo por que crecen, se cortan, vuelven a crecer y se siguen cortando, evitándose gastar en abonos, fertilizantes, mano de obra para remover y limpiar la tierra, etc., situaciones que años anteriores fueron una preocupación persistente. Por otra parte, los ingresos que obtiene le son rentables por que ya cuenta con clientes en la ciudad de Lima, donde viaja constantemente. Ahí vende 3 paquetes de ruda o manzanilla a 2 soles, el doble de precio que en la ciudad de Tarma. La ventaja es que crecen rápidamente y que cosecha en grandes cantidades.  Unos años más adelante, espera comprar o construir una casa en la ciudad de Tarma, para vivir ella y su marido, ya que sus hijos tendrán sus propias familias. Mediante su ayuda, Maura accederá a su segundo préstamo de MFP, entidad a la que agradece por confiar en ella, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Ángeles de la Unión 2”, grupo del que se siente contenta y cómoda. Con el dinero del crédito, Maura comprará sacos de abonos de 118 soles cada uno para esparcirlos en sus terrenos de espinacas, arvejas, y orégano; cultivos para la temporada de diciembre y enero.
texts.en: Maura, 43, has lived with Agustín, 49, for 25 years.  They have four children, of which only two (their 20 and 18 year old) live with them.  This family lives in their own home in the district of Unión.  Maura is a crop farmer and grows vegetables such as rue, oregano and camomille which are plants that do not require much care, investment or time.  She explains, "My business is constant when my crops are fully grown, I have to cut them, bind them in small packets and sell them for 0.50 cents each."  She says that raising this type of vegetable is easier because it grows, is cut, and grows again without having to spend money on fertilizer or workers to plough and clear the land, etc.  Previously these were issues that one constantly had to worry about.  Also, the income she earns makes it profitable since she has customers in the city of Lima where she travels constantly.  There she sells three packages of rue or camomille for 2 PEN, twice the price that she gets in Tarma.  The advantage is that the plants grow quickly and are harvested in large quantities.  In the future she hopes to buy or build a house in the city of Tarma where she and her husband can live since her children will have their own families.  Through your help Maura will have access to her second loan through the MFP.  She is grateful for the confidence shown in her and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "Los Ángles de la Unión 2", where she is happy to be a member and feels comfortable.  Maura plans to use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for 118 PEN each to treat the land where she grows spinach, peas and oregano for the December and January season.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal “Consuelo”, del  Distrito de San Pablo, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene 03 hijos, los dos mayores son independientes, el menor tiene 5 años.
Cuando era joven se dedicaba a trabajar como empleada del hogar. Una de sus cuñadas le dejó un negocio el cual ya no podía administrar, desde entonces Olga se encarga de vender jugos. Se inicia con un capital de 300.00 nuevos soles que le brindó el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Actualmente no solo vende jugos de frutas, también kekes, sandwich's, arroz chaufa y refrescos de fruta. 
Su esposo  trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transportes.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará insumos como: variedad de frutas, azúcar por sacos, pollos por kilos, mayonesa, panes, huevos en casilleros, tarros de leche, arroz por sacos y otros. Tiene una vasta clientela que la prefiere por su buena sazón y su amabilidad.
Olga es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es tener su casa propia e incursionar en la venta de abarrotes, está muy satisfecha  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad a mujeres como ella de crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Olga belongs to the “Consuelo” communal bank in the San Pablo district, Bellavista province, department of San Martin. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. The two oldest are independent and the youngest is 5.  

When she was young, she worked as a domestic employee. One of her sisters in law left her a business she couldn't run anymore, and since then, Olga has sold juice. She started with 300.00 nuevos soles in capital she obtained from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. At present, she sells cakes, sandwiches, stir fried rice and fruit snacks in addition to juice. 

Her husband works as a driver in a transportation business.

With this new loan of S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, she will buy ingredients such as: a variety of fruit, sacks of sugar, kilos of chicken, cartons of eggs, jugs of milk, and more. She has a lot of customers who prefer her good cooking and friendliness. 

Olga is a fighter and and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have her own home and to begin selling groceries. She is very satisfied with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering opportunities to woman like her to grow financially.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as: a variety of fruit, sacks of sugar, kilos of chicken, mayonnaise, bread, cartons of eggs, jugs of milk, etc.

loans.name: Corner Nzuri Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Corner Nzuri Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Corner Nzuri group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Pamela will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Corner Nzuri group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Pamela with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza se formo por medio de que algunas integrantes que ya estaban dentro del programa de comité, decidieron formar uno dentro de su comunidad. De esa manera comienza el comité que actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
Fatima es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo hace ya un buen tiempo, gracias a su sacrificio y a su buen toque para las ventas ha podido crecer y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Ella desea seguir creciendo y es por ello que solicita el crédito, el cual invertirá en la compra de prendas, las cuales volverá a vender. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
"La Esperanza" communal bank was formed by a few members who were already in the communal bank program. They decided to form one within their community. That's how the communal bank was formed, that is currently in its first loan cycle with the program. They came together with the aim of working together, and through that work, helping their families. 

Fatima is one of the members. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She tells us that she has been selling clothing of all kinds for some time now. Thanks to her sacrifice and her good sales touch, she has been able to grow, and that way help her family. 

She wishes to continue growing, and that's why she is applying for the loan. She will use it to buy articles of clothing, that she will then sell.

She is thankful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they are providing her.

loans.use: To buy clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Veronica Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 34 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la distrito de  Yucay de la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, fideos, tarros de leche y otras cosas que faltan en el negocio. 

Yanet es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
Yanet is 34 years old and is married with three children. She was born in the Yucay district of Urubamba Province and lives in the same city where she was born. She has a small grocery store in her home. She's had this business for several years already and it's going very well. At the moment, Yanet needs this loan to buy merchandise like sacks of sugar, rice, noodles, jars of milk, and other items that her store is missing. 

Yanet is a member of the Nueva Vision de Rumichaca communal bank, a group of 19 members who live in Urubamba Province, located north of the city of Cusco on the banks of the Vilcanota River. The area is known as the Sacred Valley for its mild climate, fertile soil, and abundant streams that make this valley one of the most beautiful on the planet.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sacks of sugar, rice, noodles, jars of milk, and other items that her store is missing.

loans.name: Mutale

texts.en:
Mutale is a 21-year-old entrepreneur who owns his own mobile money shop in Lusaka. He comes from a family of ten and recently completed his senior high school education. At his shop, Mutale offers money transfers and transaction account opening (a small scale banking system). All these transactions are done using mobile phones and are faster and easier to access. 

The main challenge Mutale faces is the availability of shop space and this is what he sees as the biggest hindrance to his business expansion. Previously he catered to 700 customers, but now this number has increased to 1,000. When he gets the Kiva loan, he intends to open three more shops to cater for the ever expanding customer base.
