His biggest dream is to reach out to the rural areas of the country because mobile telecommunication is now available country-wide, and since all his transactions are done using the mobile phone, he wants to take advantage of the prevailing situation to reach out to a bigger and more varied customer base. He also intends to use the proceeds from the expansion to pay for his way through college and also help his siblings complete their education. Currently he's the only breadwinner in the family. (His whole family depends on him to provide financially.) 

In the video, Mutale is being interviewed by a representative from Mobile Transactions (MTZL).

loans.use: To increase his shop space and pay for his college tuition

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single mother of one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and house rent. 

Rehema has operated a vegetable grocery for the past six months. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are low harvests in the dry seasons. She dreams of becoming a vegetable supplier.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of cabbage, potatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it has fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cabbage, potatoes,and onions for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married to a farmer. She has four children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses and to save for a rainy day. As a primary grade 6 graduate, Elizabeth currently sells porridge in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). With over 14 years of experience in this trade, Elizabeth sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy bags of maize, millet, bread, doughnuts, groundnuts and sugar, indirectly helping her to boost her overall sales. Elizabeth wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her porridge business

loans.use: to buy maize, millet, bread, doughnuts, groundnuts and sugar

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.en: Yulduz was born in 1969 year. She is married and has 3 children. She has been busy with growing potatoes and crops more than 15 years. Yulduz has additional income from animal husbandry. Her husband helps her with managing business. Yulduz always tries for well being of her children. One of her children is a student. He studies well. Yulduz dreams her child as the best specialist in future. She must to pay for her child tuition but she has not money. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to pay for tuition of her child. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition of her child

loans.name: Shilliakah

texts.en:
Shilliakah is 52 years of age and married with 6 children. Five of her children are self reliant and married. Her last child is in primary school. She is among the oldest member of her group, very active in church and in the community, being in the council of elders.

She practices mixed farming where she has two dairy cows and grows vegetables in her farm. From the dairy cows, she gets 16 litres of dairy milk which is supplied to the community. Vegetables are a bit of a challenge because of the shortage of water in the area of which demand for them is a bit high. She needs the tank to enable her to do irrigation in times of dry seasons.

On average, she is able to get USD160 from milk sales and vegetables monthly. She is ready to repay the loan with installments and she will be grateful should you choose to help fund her business. She will face no more weather limitations after she gets the tank.

loans.use: Shilliakah wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman S. owns a small shoe repair shop in the town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of the Azerbaijan. Teleman is looking for funding so that he can invest in newer and better tools as well as general supplies for his shop. He feels that newer tools will increase his efficiency and therefore his pocket book.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and supplies for shoe repair shop.

loans.name: Isabel Salomão

texts.en:
Isabel is 31 years old. She was born in the city of Maputo. She was raised by her mother in the neighborhood of Aeroporto where she studied until the 6th grade. Later she lived with an aunt in Manjacaze – a Gaza province, where she worked in agriculture in order to help her family. In 1993, Isabel married and had 4 children. She first had contact with aviculture in Maxixe – Province of Inhambane, in her aunt’s house. She was impressed by the way her aunts’ income was able to help her family. From the allowance she received from the husband, Isabel set aside money to start making blocks which served to build a chicken coup. With the installations ready she decided to request a loan to start her business. Isabel’s first experience with micro-credit was really good, she was able to repay her loan, and generate extra income for the family. With the loan of 10,000.00MTN, Isabel will expand the number of chickens from 100 to 200, aiming to expand not only the quantity but also the quality of her product. With the profits she will assist her husband in generating enough income to sustain her family, school her children, and save a small amount for a rainy day. Isabel’s business will also brings her chicken at an accessible price to her community. In the future she hopes to increase the size of her installations.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chamissava - Catembe Cliente: Isabel salomão Chemane Actividade: Avicultura Valor empréstimo: 10.000,00MT (400.00US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de pintos e rações Início: 12/04/2007 Fim: 31/03/2008 Isabel, tem 31 anos, nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, cresceu e viveu com a mãe e irmãos no Bairro do Aeroporto onde estudou e concluiu a 6ª classe. Anos mais tarde foi viver com a tia em Manjacaze – Província de Gaza, onde dedicava-se a agricultura como forma de ajudar a família. Em 1993 casou-se maritalmente e teve 4 filhos. Teve o primeiro contacto com o ramo da avicultura em Maxixe – Província de Inhambane em casa de sua tia, tendo ficado impressionada pela forma como a tia contribuía para aumentar a renda na família. Da mesada que o marido dava, repartiu algum dinheiro para iniciar a fabricar blocos que serviram mais tarde para construir a capoeira. Com as instalações prontas decide pedir empréstimo para iniciar com actividade e a experiência foi positiva, póis conseguiu pagar as letras satisfatoriamente e teve uma margem suficiente para a cobertura das despesas incluindo o sustento familiar. Com o crédito de 10.000,00MTN pretende aumentar o número de pintos de 100 para 200 e conseguir colocar seu produto com maior quantidade e qualidade apreciável. Com os lucros do negócio consegue ajudar o marido na renda familiar, pôr as crianças a estudar, poupar algum dinheiro para os momentos de crise. Também coloca perto da comunidade a proteína animal que é vital para a saúde. A perspectiva futura é aumentar o tamanho das instalações.

loans.use: To produce chickens

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en: Fatumata C. is thirty-four years of age and is married with four children.  Fish is one of the main foods in Sierra Leone.  The majority of the population eats fish everyday and therefore there is high demand for fish.  Fatumata sells fish in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  Her previous loan expanded her business and she had been assisting her husband in taking care of the family needs.  Fatumata will use the new loan funds for similar purposes.  She and her husband are determined to provide for their family’s future.

loans.use: Increase rotating stock of fish

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Chay is a widow aged 55 years old and lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She doesn’t have any children. Since her husband passed away many years ago, Sok Chay has worked very hard to survive. In the morning, she works selling rice and noodles in front of a primary school, where a number of students pass by and in the evening, she starts selling different kind of desserts to the people in her community. Together, she can generally make up to $10 dollar each day. Little by little, her business is getting better to meet growing customer demand. Mrs. Sok Chay is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
A divorced mother who lives alone, Tamara depends on her shoe sales business to make ends meet for herself. She retired from her previous work and receives a pension, but it is not enough for her to live on. Ten years ago, she decided to start her own business in order to supplement her income. Tamara has gained much valuable experience over the years and has established a good reputation as a business owner. She understands her product very well and is always fair to her customers and co-vendors in the market.

Tamara has also been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine, having repaid ten different loans. She has requested an additional loan of $1000 to help purchase new shoe inventory for her business. In the future she hopes to make enough extra income so that she can make some repairs to the roof of her home. We are happy for this opportunity to further assist Tamara as she works to support herself.

loans.use: Tamara would like to purchase inventory for her shoe sales business.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng P., age 43, is a widow and works raising pigs, earning around $1.50 each day.  She has 3 children, one who is a garment factory worker, earning around $2 each day, one who is a construction worker, and one who is a student.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase additional pigs to increase her livestock and build a small grocery store near her home to sell foodstuffs.  She is pictured with her daughter in their home.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and build a grocery store.

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Fahriddin Ibodulloevich H. rears cattle in his house. He works as a mechanic in a state farm and receives a tiny salary. Sometimes, he does not receive salary for months. He is the only provider for his family and his salary is not sufficient. Since 2003, Fahriddin has been rearing cattle. In the beginning of 2006 he found out about a microcredit program called MicroInvest. With his first loan he purchased 2 bulls.

Fahriddin needs a new loan to expand his business in order to increase his profits. He lives in a village and has no problem feeding additional animals. In the future, Fahriddin plans to expand into milk processing business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Худойбердиев Фахриддин Ибодуллоевич занимается откормом скота дома. Он работает механиком в колхозе и получает мизерную сумму а иногда месяцами не получает заработную плату. Он является единственным кормильцем семьи. Его заработная плата не хватает на семью. Откормом скота он занялся начиная с 2003 года. В начале 2006 года он узнал о программе микрокредитования Микроинвест. На первый полученный кредит он купил 2-х бычков. Он нуждается в финансировании так как он живет в сельской местности и с кормом для скота у него нет проблем и он хочет увеличить количество скота чем он увеличить прибыль. В дальнейшем он планирует заняться переработкой молока. .

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo is a 23 year old man who is a graduate of technical training school where he specialized in electricity. He currently works in a car shop where he fixes both cars and electronic appliances.

He began this line of work in his family’s auto shop. The capital he made working in his family’s auto shop allowed him to venture out on his own and purchase a piece of land, a shop the tools he needed to begin his business. He works to support his wife and their first child which is on the way.

The loan that he is asking for is to invest in paints, fiberglass, windshields, and other car parts needed in the shop.

loans.use: To buy paints, windshields, fiberglass, and other car supplies.

loans.name: Muatar

texts.en: S. Muatar is 48 years old. Muatar is a market vendor. She sells kids clothing in the local market. The elder daughter helps her in her business. After eight years of entrepreneurship, Muatar has obtained a reliable clientele. Now the business is successful and generates enough stable income improve the family's living conditions. Now Muatar woud like to purchase kids clothing for the spring season. She requests $500.00 US dollars for the term of 5 months. Muatar thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase kids clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Barohat

texts.en:
R. Barohat is 42 years old. She is married with two children. Barohat is a market vendor. She and her husband sell clothing for teenagers in the local market. Barohat travels to the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan to purchase goods to sell. In the meantime, her husband helps with the sales in the market. 
In general the business is stable and has a strong trend for further development. However, Barohat stresses that after loans provided by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON she managed to accelerate the development of her business considerably. With one of the loans, Barohat purchased one more trading place in the market. 
Today she is planning to increase the working capital to expand her business. She requests $950.00 for the term of 6 months. Barohat promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she did all the previous ones, and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To increase the turnover capital with the purpose of developing the business.

loans.name: Auxiliadora Del Carm

texts.es:
For the past 12 years, Auxiliadora L. has been running a grocery store, where she serves her clients with great kindness. The store is located at her home in the San Rafael del Sur borough in Managua. She is a single mother, in charge of her little child. She makes great efforts to provide her son with adequate living conditions.

Her present need is to buy merchandise to sell, such as grains and food products. For this reason she turns to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to continue improving her business and supporting her child, for whom she acts as mother and father at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Auxiliadora L. desde hace doce años se dedica a la labor de la pulpería, teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación y atendiendo muy amablemente a todos sus clientes, en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. Es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeña hijo. Por este motivo es que sus esfuerzos son muy grandes para lograr brindarle a su hijo todas las condiciones necesarias para vivir

La necesidad de la señora Auxiliadora hoy en día es la compra de los productos tales como granos básicos y comestibles para comercializarlos. Para ello acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de estos productos con el propósito de continuar con el desarrollo de su negocio para así brindarle las mejores condiciones a su hijo ya que ella realiza el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru:
Rafoat T. is a 45-year-old woman with two children, a son and a daughter, both of whom are married. For twenty years Rafoat has worked as a doctor in a pediatric health clinic. As government-paid employees, clinic staff receive an extremely meager salary, so Rafoat would like to take out a loan in order to make repairs to her apartment. Rafoat wishes to receive credit from KIVA and spend it for buying paint , wallpaper and other belongings.Because her son works as a driver and her husband has left to work in Russia, she is sure that she will be able to pay back the loan on time from money which they send her .She needs in extra loan as she want to start her repairs as soon as posible; as the limit of electricity will start in autumn and repairs can be stop about it.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Тураходжаева Рафоат, женщина возраст 45 лет мать двоих детей, дочь и сын.Обоих детей она уже выдала замуж и женила сына.Сама работает врачем в детской поликлинике уже 20 лет.По причине, что бюджетным работникам зарплата составляет у нас очень мизерный размер, а она хочет провести ремонт квартиры.Рафоат планирует получить займ с КИВЫ и потратить деньги на покупку красок,oбоев и других принадлежностей для ремонта,а так же на оплату работы мастерам..Ее сын работает водителем , муж в данный момент отутствует, т.к. уехал в Россию на заработки. Они присылают деньги ежемесячно и она планирует вносить ежемесячные погашения с этих денег.Она очень нуждаеться в срочном займе, так как летом планирует полностью закончить ремонт.(проблемы лимта электоэнергии,которые начинаються осенью,могут задержать ремонт) .

loans.use: Apartment Repairs

loans.name: Grover Gerardo

texts.es:
Mr. Grover Gerado A. C. has a neighborhood store as his principal activity and he sells artisan products made of knit macrame as his secondary activity. The gentleman travels to Potosí and Sucre to sell his merchandise. He lives with his sister, he has worked for almost two years with the institution and he has never been overdue.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

EL SEÑOR GROVER GERARDO A. C. TIENE COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL TIENDA DE BARRIO Y COMO ACTIVIDAD SECUNDARIA LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS ARTESANALES FABRICADOS EN TEJIDO MACRAMÉ, EL SEÑOR VIAJA A POTOSÍ Y SUCRE A VENDER SU MERCADERIA VIVE CON SU HERMANA, TRABAJA CASI DOS AÑOS CON LA INSTITUCIÓN Y NO TUVO DÍAS DE ATRASO.

loans.use: Half will be invested in the store and the other half in his second activity of making macrame

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old. She is a married woman with 1 child, age 4. She became a battery seller in 2000. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Martha now hopes for a loan to buy more batteries for her business.

loans.use: To buy more batteries for her business

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba D., 67 ans est mariée et mère de 07 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son petit commerce en détail de produits alimentaires locaux. Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>voici son premier prêt qu’elle compte rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Coumba D., age 67, is married and the mother of seven children, plus two others, in her care. She would like to bolster her small retail business involving local food products. She wants to improve her children's living conditions and to ensure the right schooling for them. This is her first loan that she intends to repay all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various local food products

loans.name: Ni Made Wiratna

texts.id: Sudah menjadi tradisi, setiap masyarakat Bali, khususnya ibu rumah tangga memelihara babi di rumahnya. Kebanyakan dari mereka memelihara babi hanya sebagai pekerjaan sampingan karena masih sedikit yang mengerti tentang beternak babi yang baik dan benar. Ni Made Wiratna bergabung dengan program ternak babi dari Yayasan Dinari yang masa pinjamannya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. Ni Made Wiratna ingin menjadi peternak babi yang sukses dengan mendapat pendampingan dari Yayasan Dinari. Dengan modal sendiri yang dimilikinya, Ni Made Wiratna membangun kandang yang terdiri dari 3 kamar. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, Ni Made Wiratna berencana membeli anak babi yang akan dipeliharanya selam 3 bulan dan akan dijual kembali untuk babi guling. Hal itu dipilihnya karena perputaran modalnya lebih cepat. Suaminya sangat mendukung usaha yang ditekuninya ini dan siap membantu setiap saat. Ni Made Wiratna sangat bahagia karena selain mendapat pendampingan dan dana, keluarganya pun sangat mendukungnya. Ia berharap usahanya akan sukses dan tetap meminta pendampingan dari Dinari.
texts.en:
Pig farming is a traditional side occupation for many Balinese housewives. However, only few of these farmers understand proper farming techniques. Ni Made Wiratna joined DINARI's pig farming program and also obtained a 6 month loan from the foundation. Ni Made Wiratna is hoping to increase the success of her farm, therefore, she sought technical help from DINARI foundation. With her own funding, she built 3 chamber pig pens. She plans to use the loan to purchase 3 piglets that will be kept and grown for 3 months then sold as slaughter pigs. She picked this segment due to the relatively quick cash cycle. Her husband is very supportive to her business and ready to help. Ni Made Wiratna is very happy because in addition to technical and funding help from DINARI, she also gets her family's support. She is hoping her success will continue with DINARi's help.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Piglets

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina H. Y. is married with three children over the age of eighteen. Marina is a member of the community bank Emprendedoras, which means "enterprisers" in Spanish. Marina sells groceries every day from her home.

She will use her loan of 400 soles (~$150 USD) to invest in her business by purchasing vegetables, fruits, various meats and cheeses, refreshments, cookies, and candies. With her savings, Marina's goal is to continue improving her grocery sales. She is also helping her children pay for their education at the University. She dreams that they will continue with their education and become professionals. .

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruits, various meats and cheeses, refreshments, cookies, and candies for her grocery business.

loans.name: Gameli

texts.fr: Mr D. Gameli est marié et père de quatre enfants. Il arrive à subvenir aux besoins  de sa famille grâce à sa boutique d’alimentation générale qui constitue sa principale source de revenu. Malgré ses efforts, il n’arrive pas à faire évoluer son chiffre et par conséquent son bénéfice. Il sollicite un crédit pour approvisionner sa boutique en divers produits pour la satisfaction d’un plus grand nombre de clients et améliorer ainsi son revenu.
texts.en:
Mr. Gameli D. is married and the father of one child. He manages to provide for his family thanks to his general grocery store, which constitutes his main source of income. In spite of his efforts, he does not succeed in increasing his revenue and, therefore, it profits. He's seeking a loan to supply his shop with various products to meet a larger customer demand and, therefore, increase his revenue.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his grocery store with various products

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo González ya había tenido crédito al ver nosotros que fue un buen cliente y pago puntualmente pensamos en ofrecerle otro. El recurrió a nosotros con la mayor confianza de que si se lo podíamos otorgar el comento que lo deseaba para tener mas amplia su casa. Anteriormente su crédito lo utilizo para hacer este cuarto que se ve en la imagen ahora el quiere hacer un cuarto en la parte de arriba. Para esto el necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra la cantidad que el solicita es la cantidad de $14,000 pesos. El señor José Alfredo se dedica a vender automóviles y su esposa es maestra de primaria con estos ingresos pagaran el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
José Alfredo González has already had a loan. Upon seeing that he was a good client and he paid punctually, we though to offer him another one. He came to us with the utmost faith that if we granted him a loan he would be able to achieve his goal of expanding his house. Previously he used his loan to construct this room, which you see in the picture. Now he wants to construct another room in the area above. For this he needs to buy materials and pay for the manpower. The amount that he requests is the amount of $14,000 pesos. José Alfredo sells automobiles and his wife is an elementary school teacher. With this income they will repay the loan given to them.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and labor for construction

loans.name: Mama Sokou

texts.fr: Mme M. S. est née en 1976. Elle est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de légumes et poissons fumés, une activité très rentable qui lui permet d’aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. C’est une femme qui aime énormément son activité. Elle veut renforcer son commerce et sollicite pour cela un financement qui lui permettra d’accroître considérablement ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. S. was born in 1976. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a reseller of vegetables and smoked fish, a profitable business that enables her to assist her husband with meeting the financial needs of the family. This lady greatly enjoys her business. M. S. is requesting a loan to strengthen her business which would allow her to increase her income.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies of vegetables and smoked fish

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mr. Phon Y. lives in Knol village in Kampong Cham province. He is a beef seller in the local market. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Therefore he decided to request a loan to buy a cow and sell its meat. His wife, Mrs. Chanthy Sin, is a fruit seller in the local market. Mr. Phon Y. is 50 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a beef seller who helps in the father's business. The others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and sell its meat.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam has been a clothes seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Mombasa Two group loan (Group code 2052). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 7 hours. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Maryam is 37 years old, married, and has five children: ages 20, 16, 12, 9 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Chama

texts.en:
Chama is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Chama has owned a bakery for 13 years. She makes “mankoucheh”. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza; most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Chama requested a loan of $500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase raw materials for her business like cheese, flour, and oil. Chama has been a micro credit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her bakery and increase her income. Chama is special in her work because she does it well and her mankoucheh are known for their good taste. Her clients can be anybody. Chama decided on this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mr. Yen Y. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Soung Thorn, sells Pro Hok in the local market. She is also a duck breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it, so Mr. Yen Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks to expand his wife’s business. He hopes to increase income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 55 years old and the father of four children, one of whom stays at home to do housework while the others are attending the local school. His wife is present in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to expand his wife’s business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther H. is single with 2 children and received an education through elementary school. Since 2004, Esther has worked as a trader in Horkar, near Elmina, selling such goods as clothes, sauce pans and sandals. Esther uses her income to care for her family and also pay bills. She will use the loan to purchase additional goods like clothes, sauce pans and sandals for selling, and with her newly gained profits Esther plans to continue working on the house she has started building for her family.

She was out of stock as at the time this picture was taken.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods like clothes, sauce pans and sandals for selling.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’adidoadin, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine et d’eau minérale « FIFA ». Elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des ustensiles de cuisine et 10 cartons d’eau minérale FIFA.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the Adidoadin area. She is married and has 5 children. As a revenue-generating activity, she runs a business selling kitchenware and "FIFA" mineral water. She hopes to resupply herself and is seeking (through WAGES) her first loan to buy kitchenware and 10 boxes of FIFA mineral water.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell kitchenware and "FIFA" mineral water

loans.name: Lusaka Upper A Mbabazi Teddy Group

texts.en:
Teddy M., 25 years old, is a bean seller. She is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of one additional dependent, also attending school.

She has been selling beans since 2008. She wishes to use her loan to purchase bags of beans for sale. She plans to expand her business to include rice as well.

Her dream is someday to purchase a plot of land and construct a residential house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans for sale.

loans.name: Gloria Amanda

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of Banco Comunal Juanito. She is single, 32 years old, and has two children.

Gloria travels to different fairs in the region where she buys grain, cheese, and products that she takes to the Ayacuchan forest. Also, Gloria has a grocery store that is rented and, in the evenings, she sells chicken sausage at the entrance of her store.

Gloria needs a loan of 2,600 soles which she will use to buy grain, rice, and sugar. Her dreams are to buy land to construct her home and buy a car to transport her products.

loans.use: To buy grain, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Kotognontala (Soyons Unies) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 4 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage au lieu de travail.
Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente  de pagnes, d’habits  et de cosmétiques. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Kotognontala a décidé d’intégrer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son onzième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des pagnes de wax en gros et une quantité importante de produits  cosmétiques à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Les pagnes  sont vendus en détail, au comptant où à crédit au marché de Koutiala et au niveau des entreprises (privées et étatiques), quant aux produits cosmétiques, ils sont vendus en ambulant dans la ville de Koutiala . 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The 4 women of the “Kotognontala” (Let us be united) group are all married with an average age of 31, and on average 4 children. They live in big extended traditional families in the Koulikoro neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They met in their workplaces because of being from the same neighborhood.

They have almost the same businesses buying and selling “pagnes” (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), clothing, and cosmetics. They are much in demand in these areas. So as to satisfy the needs of their growing clientele, the Kotognontala group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their 11th solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy high quality “pagnes” wholesale, as well as a considerable quantity of cosmetics, in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The “pagnes” are sold retail, for cash or credit in the market of Koutiala and in private companies or government offices. As for the cosmetics, they are sold on foot around the town of Koutiala.

They each expect to make an average profit of 110,000 F CFA over the course of this loan cycle. That money will be used to pay the interest on the loan and cover some needs of their extended families, investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is married with four children. Her family of five lives in the city of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Dilorom sells kid’s clothing in the local market “Ganjina”. She started this venture about 10 years ago. Dilorom has a perfect credit history with IMON International. She has requested a loan of $800 for one main purpose; she would like to use the loan as working capital to buy necessary inventory in order to further develop her business. With her history thus far as an entrepreneur, it will be exciting to watch how her business grow and prosper in the future. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for kids in order to increase her range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Yeim Muth Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeim M., the village bank president, has been selected by the eleven members who all live I. Tuol Trea village I. Takeo province. Mrs. Yeim M. is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Seang Sary, is a fisherman and he also helps his wife with the rice farming. Since these businesses have obstacles, Mrs. Yeim M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field and buy a boat and fishnets for her husband's business.  Mrs. Yeim M. is 44 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. 

Nine members I. this group have loans that are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a boat and fishnets

loans.name: Dafrosa

texts.en:
Dafroza is a member of the Msufini borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is married and a mother of 4 children,Her children are aged 20,23,29,26 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Dafroza started her own business selling banana 15 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 |Tanzania shillings.

This is Dafrosa first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more banana for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Dafrosa hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more banana

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Mrs. Sina M. is a villager in Svay Thom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is also a chicken breeder. Now she needs a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field and she would use the rest of money to chickens, chicken food, and build chicken store. Her husband, Mr. Touy Chan, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sina M. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: S. is 48 years old and a resident of Kampong, Chhnang Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of nine children. Four are single and five are married and live away from home. She is married to Mr. Ourt, age 46, who is also a rice farmer and a fisherman. To help meet with her family's expenses, one of her sons is driving a motor taxi. S. will be using her first loan to buy more fishing tools for her husband's fishing operations.

loans.use: To buy more fish tools for her husband's fishing operations.

loans.name: Phạm's Group

texts.en:
"H. Phạm Thị (20213010064) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Ninh 2 (12).


H. is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.186.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20213010065) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing waste management services.


2.  Đào Thị T. (20213010066) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  Nghiêm Thị L. (20213010067) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


4.  Vũ Thị H. (20213010068) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  Dương Thị

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku R. is currently in the business of designing and selling bedsheets. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bedsheets to design and sell.  Kaku is 18 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs in terms of the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bedsheets to design and sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is 23 years old and happily married to Joselito, a local farmer. The couple are blessed with one child, Jay Gabriel, who is a year old. They live in the peaceful village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan.

For the past four years, Grace has run a sari-sari store (community-based store) business in their village. She wants her business to grow as the income from the store is a great help to her husband in providing for their daily needs.

Grace now wants to borrow additional capital for her business since she needs more merchandise to improve her store. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock to meet customer demand. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will approve her loan.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is a young Palestinian man raised in a big family with three brothers and two sisters. Now he is married with one baby girl.

Rashad started his business five years ago and, with continuous improvements in his equipment, his business is developing. He is a DJ and conducts parties in Bethlehem city, wedding and big events.

Rashad has requested 3,000 USD in order to buy big speakers and other equipment necessary for his business. He appears in the photo at the FATEN office.

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Nasher

texts.en:
Nasher L. is from the village of Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Nasher owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling mobile phone credits in the local community. Nasher has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Nasher joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nasher has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. Nasher is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nasher from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kossigan

texts.en:
Mr. A. is a trained nurse who runs a clinic in Adidogomé, Togo. He has been running this business since 2007. He is married and has one child. 

This will be his first loan with WAGES, which will be used to restock his pharmaceuticals and purchase any other supplies needed for the clinic.  This loan will help Mr. A. help others in need.

loans.use: Pharmaceuticals and medical supplies

loans.name: Reta

texts.en:
Reta L. is currently in the business of selling bread in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and vegetables to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

Reta is 24 years old and is married to a teacher. She has three children and her children go to school.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and vegetables  to sell.

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Cleotilde tiene un negocio que es ofrecer el servicio de costura. Ella vende sus productos en sus comarcas  de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación, con la ayuda de su hija, realiza las compras de materia prima del negocio en el mercado de Managua ya que en este lugar los precios son más favorables y  le generan mayores ingresos.  Es madre soltera de 59 años pero siempre ha batallado por salir adelante, es por ello que solicita un nuevo financiamiento para mejorar su negocio ya que es lo más importante que tiene. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cleotilde, 59, is a seamstress. She sells her articles of clothing going from district to district and in her home; her daughter helps her. She buys raw materials in Managua's market, where the prices are the most favorable for her to generate higher earnings. She is a single mother who has always struggled to get ahead. For this reason, she is asking for new funding to improve her business because this is the most important thing she has. Her wish is to do some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Mrs. Reth K. is 63 years old. She is a mother of two children, who are employed in a garment factory. She and her husband, Mr. Nguon Hieng Se (pictured left), live in Kandal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal province. They are farmers who own 1.5-hectares of land that they cultivate in order to support their family. However hard Mrs. Reth K. and her husband work on their farm, they do not earn sufficient income because the amount of land they own is too small. Therefore, in order to improve their crop yield, Mrs. Reth K. decided to apply for a loan to buy more land for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more land to grow vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane G. is 38 years old, married to Julius Kinyua, and they have a nine-month-old baby girl.  Jane runs a private primary school in Ndunyu Njeru, a rural town in Kenya.  The school opened its doors in 2004 and has seen tremendous growth with student numbers rising to over 60 in just four years.  Considering it’s a private school in a rural town, that’s a great achievement.  Due to the increase in the number of students, she wants to build another classroom to accommodate the ever-increasing number of students.

While seeking for a financier, she was introduced to KADET by her friend and she applied for this loan, which is her first with the organization.

Through more funding from KADET, she hopes to grow her school by building new classes and she has a target of getting over 500 students within the next five years.

loans.use: To build another classroom

loans.name: Vicente Ramon

texts.es: Vicente Ramón tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 15 años, que se dedica a este negocio pues el ofrece diferentes productos como granos, golosinas, detergentes, pan, ropa y cosméticos. Pues a  le gusta ofrecer de todo un poco para llevar a cabo sus metas. Este negocio ha sido el sustento necesario para mantener a sus 2 hijos, anteriormente la ubicación de su pulpería era en un lugar donde no tenía muchos clientes, actualmente se encuentra en otro lugar en donde vive. Su deseo es incrementar su inventario para convertir su pulpería en un mini súper. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Vicente Ramón, age 41, has had a mini market for over 15 years. He sells different products like grains, sweets, detergents, bread, clothes, and cosmetics. He likes to offer a little of everything to reach his goals. This business has been the needed livelihood to support his two children. The mini market was previously located in a place where he did not have many customers. It is currently in another place where he lives. He wishes to increase his inventory in order to change his mini market into a super mini. The loan he is requesting is to buy raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: With strong determination, Celerina M. believes that through the profits of her hog fattening business, she and the rest of her family will be led to a way out of poverty. That is why she works hard, with the support of her husband, to grow their business. For the financial support that her business needs in order to be enhanced, she is requesting a much larger loan from ASHI. In the hog fattening business, the more piglets being raised and sold either alive or slaughtered after four months, means the profit is as much as double the capital. This will enable Celerina to support the education of her child who is in college, by paying her tuition fees every trimester. Celerina’s basis for selling her hogs is the schedule of her child’s payment to school. With their daily family expenses and her payment to ASHI, she gets help from her eldest 26-year-old child who works as a cashier in one of the town’s stores and her husband, who gets sporadic income being a hired laborer.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for her fattening business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 4 ciclos de funcionamiento. 

Irma, tiene 20 años, es conviviente y vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es criar animales y después venderlos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Su esposo se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes en su mototaxi (El término mototaxi o mototaxismo es definido como “motocicleta de tres ruedas y con techo que se usa como medio de transporte popular para trechos cortos” a cambio de dinero de la misma forma que un taxi.) 

Irma es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para hacer el mantenimiento del mototaxi y manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación que brinda la Asociación.  

Irma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the "Virgin Mary of Inquilpata" community bank of the Arariwa Association. The community bank has functioned for four cycles.

Irma is 20 years old and lives in the community of Inquilpata in the Anta district of the Cusco region. Her main economic activity is raising animals and them selling them at the Country Fair of the Rural Community of Inquilpata-Anta on Thursdays. Her husband offers transportation services in his motortaxi (a motortaxi is defined as a "a motorcycle with three wheels and a roof that is used as a popular means of transport for short trips" in exchange for money, in the same form as a taxi).

Irma is a hard-working and entrepreneurial young woman who always looks for opportunities to advance and aid her family with her daily effort. She needs the loan to do maintenance on the motortaxi. She says that she is happy and satisfied with the credit, savings, and training services that the Association offers.

Irma is grateful for the opportunity offered through the loan and promises to make the payments on schedule. The community of Inquilpata is an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Do maintenance on the motortaxi

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan B. sells soft drinks like water, soda, and juice and is requesting a loan to stock a create of beer to sell. Juan is 23 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock a create of beer to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
A. is a 49-year-old woman who describes herself as trustworthy.  She has three adult children.  For the past 15 years, A. has sold pastries. She bakes bread and sells cake, meat pies, spin rolls and donuts.  She plans to use the loan to buy flour, margarine, vegetable cooking oil and other food ingredients in bulk to make her pastries. 

A. is on her 2nd loan, and she has proven to be a good client. She would like to continue to expand her pastry business for the benefit of her family.  She hopes that her children will eventually take over the family business.

loans.use: To purchase  food ingredients like flour, margerine, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his supply of raw materials

loans.name: Mrs. Siphan Um Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of seventeen people who live in Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Siphan U. is the group leader, selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. Mrs. Siphan U. is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She has a problem because her field is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Siphan U. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers. Her husband, Mr. Rortha Segn, is a security guard at a private company. Mrs. Siphan U. is the mother of two children: one is employed at MFI in Cambodia while the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu J. sells house decorating items at Bojon. Kadiatu is married to a driver and they have two children: one is in secondary school and the other is in primary school. Kadiatu assists her husband greatly in taking care of the home. She is applying for a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to help her buy more stock, in order to satisfy her customer’s demands. Kadiatu has been a client in one of our solidarity groups and was proven to be a very good client from her repayment history and her promise to continue her good record for individual loan product. The proceeds from this loan will help her earn her livelihood and to educate her children.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy inventory.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina “Medalla Milagrosa”  están  en el Segundo Ciclo   con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes donde cada una trabaja para ayudar a sus familias. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Barcilisa quien es ama de casa y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde casa.
En la atención del negocio le ayudan sus hijos y de esa forma ella obtiene ingresos que ayudan con  los gastos diarios de la familia.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora con una familia muy humilde pero con muchos deseos de superarse  y sacar adelante a su familia de la mejor manera posible.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group called “Medalla Milagrosa” ("Miraculous Medal") is in its second loan cycle with 17 members. This is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for its solidarity and being very united and responsible. The women make a living in different activities in which each one works to help out her family. One of the members is Barcilisa, who is a housewife and makes a living selling fruits and vegetables from her home. Her children help her tend to the business and in this way she earns an income to help with daily family expenses. She is a very hard-working woman with a very humble family and has a strong desire to move up in life and make headway for her family in the best way possible. She is requesting the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables, and other items for the member's respective businesses

loans.name: Patrick Ndungu

texts.en:
Patrick Ndungu G. is 41 years old and he supports a family of four. His spouse is Jane Muthoni, who is a businesswoman contributing an income of 24,000 shillings per month.

Patrick is a businessman running a spare-part shop in Narok town. He sells spare parts of different vehicle models, and his regular customers are motor vehicle mechanics from the Narok Motor garage, which is located next to his shop. He has been in this business for the last four years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member in KADET. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy more spare parts to increase his stock.

He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open up another spare-part shop.

Patrick’s dream is to become a wholesaler and be the spare-part distributor in Narok town.

He is a hardworking man with a great vision.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle spare parts, especilly for Toyota saloon cars.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridas hijas Angie de 8 y Gimena de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda que posee es una de las más concurridas del poblado de Casacoto (Pueblo de la provincia de Tarma), el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera en abrirse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 1 año en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer gran parte del día en su tienda, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para cultivar sus tierras. Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para tener más productos que vender en stock. Este el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para su tienda y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 37, is a very modest and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her two beloved daughters. Angie is 8, and Gimena is 5. They are the motivation for all of her efforts. The store that Gloria has is one of the busiest in the town of Casacoto (a town in the Tarma province). Her great charisma and her friendly service have made her neighbors prefer her store. They do not hesitate to make their purchases there starting very early. They know that her store is the first to open. What she likes most about her work is talking with her neighbors about the things that happen in her town. She has had the business for one year. She considers the most difficult part to be staying most of the day in her store. This does not give her much time to cultivate her fields. In the future she hopes to expand the store’s facilities in order to have more products in stock to sell. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to able to access another loan in a more stress free manner without causing problems for her communal bank. She is held in high esteem by the other members. She will use the 2,000 soles that she is requesting to buy more products for her store and increase her stock of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products to stock her store

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha Q. is married with five dependents and her husband is a mason. She has been through junior high school.

Agatha is a fishmonger at Elmina and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Rosa es casada, tiene 4 hijos estudiantes, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, también brinda el servicio de fotocopias. Además Rosa trabaja preparando desayunos escolares.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Rosa sueña con que sus hijos estudien y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Cocharcas” (Virgin of Cocharcas). She is married and has four children in school. Rosa has a store in her home where she sells groceries and provides photocopy services. In addition, she prepares breakfasts to sell to the school children.

Rosa needs a loan of 1050 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Her dreams include seeing her children continue their studies and opening another business.

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
To accomplish her retail business plans, 35-year-old M. Safina has gone to extreme lengths to give a good, hard work account of herself in a highly competitive business genre for the last sixteen years in Central market –Jinja. Diligently and with time, she has gotten half way to the point where she envisaged she would be at the threshold of this business. She says she wanted to be self reliant, and at present, in many respects, she can bank on this business to solve most, if not all of her family’s needs. 

Safina is a married woman with four kids. She also has a rental business. Approximately $45 is what she makes in a week. She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase more general merchandise retail stock such as sugar, soap, maize flour, etc. to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more general merchandise retail items such as sugar, soap, etc. for resale

loans.name: Sara Soraya

texts.es:
Sara de 35 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (rodeada de un estero). 

Hace años se dedica a la costura y confección pero su especialidad son trajes formales y ternos. Trabaja en conjunto de su hija y mama, según como sea el tamaño de la persona cobrar el trabajo. Tiene un aproximado de 300 trajes mensual que entrega a diferentes clientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y accesorios para el taller de confección y costura.  

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener un espacio mas grande para el taller de costura y confección.
texts.en:
Sara, age 35, has a sewing and tailoring shop. She lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil, which is surrounded by a marsh.

Sara has been sewing and producing clothes for several years, with her specialty being formal gowns and suits. She works with her daughter and mother. The clothes she produces are designed according to the size of the person requesting the work. Sara makes approximately 300 deliveries each month to different customers. This loan will be used to buy fabrics and accessories for her business.

In the future, Sara wants to build a better house and have a larger space for her workshop.

loans.use: Purchase fabric & accessories

loans.name: Moises Edwin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin a pesar de ser una persona joven durante su anterior crédito demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad,  la actividad en la que se desempeña diariamente es la costura, el confecciona chalecos de tela polar, por esta época se dedica a cumplir contratos con diferentes instituciones.  El cliente vive en casa de sus señores padres, es en la misma donde desempeña su actividad. El destino del crédito es para la compra de una maquina de cocer recta, ya que esta maquina le ayudara a realizar mas rápido y de mejor manera su trabajo, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Edwin is a young person, but he demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his last loan.  

He works every day sewing.  He makes polar fleece vests because he has contracts to complete with different institutions.  

He lives with his parents and works at home.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase a serger, which will allow him to work more quickly and create a better product.  

He is very thankful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: Purchase a serger (sewing machine)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira J. is 35 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.  She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, the family breeds livestock animals, which Damira and her husband have been doing since 1996.  Reselling livestock animals after fattening, they earn 3,600 soms a month. Damira applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase coal for winter. In the future she wants to improve the family’s living conditions and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase coal for winter

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel P. is from the village of Santa Isabel. She is 44 years old. Isabel is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Isabel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isabel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Isabel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Rok

texts.en:
Rok is a 53-year-old mother of eight who opened her business in 2007. She began by selling clothes from her home. In 2009, she set up a separate area in her home to display and sell. Over time, she has gained wise business experience, knows which suppliers to trust and what fashions are most popular with her current and potential customers. Now Rok is ready to open a store outside of her home in the open market – souk. The Souk store will widen her clientele and increase her monthly income.

Rok needs this loan to pay for the initial rental of the store location and additional stock.

Rok has seen a gradual but steady development to her business and she continues to apply lessons she learns from our training. Her dream is to open an additional branch in the city center and continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: To pay for the initial rent and additional stock.

loans.name: Sari Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh K. is chairman of the group Sari Pertiwi. With this new loan, she plans to buy 3 pigs and food for the pigs. Currently, the price of pig food is quite expensive, therefore she mixes feed with traditional food made from leaves.
Pig farming businesses are a reliable means to support the income of families in Indonesia. The advantage of this effort can cover the needs in the kitchen, school fees and needs of children during the holiday.

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Honest Debt Must Be Paid Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariatu was born in Makeni city 31 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children who are attending primary schools. For 5 years now, Mariatu has been selling used clothes.

This is not the first loan that Mariatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mariatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business, she will buy a bale of used clothes to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy a bale of used clothes to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Dul P., 35, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. P. is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 5 on the other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is currently taking care of 4 children. Having acquired a senior high education, Grace is into the sale of provisions and salted fish at Nkroful near Takoradi, which she has been doing for twenty years. Her husband is unemployed so taking care of the family has not been easy. Grace is requesting the loan to buy more goods to expand her business. Her future plan is to be able to supply her customers with whatever they request in her shop so she can make more money for her home.

loans.use: to expand grocery store inventory

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
48-year-old Ma. Fe is a married woman living in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She has 3 children aged 25, 15 and 8.

Ma. Fe is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 11 years and she rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest. She works hard to help provide for and improve the living conditions of her family

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kiprotich

texts.en:
Kiprotich B. is 35 and married with four children aged between four and twelve. He is a dairy farmer in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the dairy business for fifteen years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market. His major challenges have been a lack of enough animal feed and diseases that affect his cows’ milk production.

Kiprotich has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva’s partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help to pay the school fees for his children. He would like to have a zero grazing unit (stall feeding) within the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kavule Effort Development Group A

texts.en: 38-year-old Florence N. operates a pharmacy in Nabuti-Mukono. The happily married mother of 5 has been operating the pharmacy for the past 7 years and she says she was inspired by her husband to try her hand at this business. Florence is a trained nurse and her training helps her a lot as she goes about her rounds. She says this business generates 130,000 shillings of profit per week. With the requested loan Florence plans to purchase more drugs to resell at her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to sell at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child.

In 2009 Firas opened a workshop for manufacturing water tanks. He has more than five years' experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known.

He is requesting $1500 to buy a generator for his shop. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his shop.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres de 28 años de edad, es soltero, tiene casa propia que  cuenta con los servicio sólo de agua en  el caserío Yencala Leon, zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo (festividades religiosas que forma parte de las costumbres de los pobladores).

Andres  labora manejando su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito, pero también tiene unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra alfalfa y vende, altenre su mototaxi puede ir a ver sus tierras más seguido y también le sive para llevar su alfalfa a los diferentes mercados para venderlo, ya que lo utilizan como alimento para el ganado ovino,vacuno, cuyes, etc.  Ambas actividades le permite tener más ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales. 

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y de sus cultivos de alfalfa, esto ayudará a que ambas actividades  estén en buen estado y pueda brindar un mejor servicioy tener un mejor producto (alfalfa), todo es con la finalidad de tener un mejor nivel de vida.  Andres es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es salir adelante  y tener un poco más de comodidades para vivir.
texts.en:
Andrés, 28, is single.  He has a house of his own that only has water located in the hamlet of Yencala León, a rural part of Lambayeque Department.  Residents of this area are farmers, raise livestock and are in tourism (religious festivals that are part of the residents’ customs).

Andrés has worked driving his mototaxi (mode of transportation used for short distances; can carry a maximum of 3 passengers) for the last two years approximately.
