He carries out this activity in his own district but he also has farmland where he grows alfalfa to sell.  Having a mototaxi makes it possible for him to go inspect his fields more frequently and to also be able to transport his alfalfa to the various markets to sell since it’s used as feed for cattle, sheep, guinea pigs, etc.  Both activities make it possible for him to earn more income to cover his personal expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to service his mototaxi and to provide care for his alfalfa crops.  This will help to have both activities in good condition so that he can offer improved service and have a better product (alfalfa).  All of this is aimed at having a better standard of living.

Andrés is a very hard working, responsible person who only wants to get ahead and have a bit more comfort in life.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi and to provide maintenance to his farmland.

loans.name: Jiydekan's Group

texts.en:
Jiydekan, 52, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and resides in a town of Toktogul. She lives with her oldest son, while her two other children live separately. 

It was her daughter’s idea to try running this business, and she helped with the initial investment of 10,000 soms. It’s been ten years since the start-up, and the business is flourishing thanks to Jiydekan’s efforts. Jiydekan believes in the responsibility, ambition and hard work of her group members. She believes the loan from Kiva lenders will be a significant help for each of them.  Jiydekan plans to spend her own part on the purchase of additional head of livestock.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Bozorboy

texts.en:
Bozorboy is a hard-working man. He is married and has three children. Bozorboy sells daily products as a juices, tea, sweets and chocolates. He wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions. He would like to get a loan of 4500 TJS to purchase new goods in order to increase the assortment of goods in his store. 

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new goods for resale.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Marlene works hard to support her family. She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Marlene is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman who lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase one bundle of green vegetables, sacks of ground nuts and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of green vegetables, sacks of ground nuts and potatoes.

loans.name: Irma Belem

texts.es:
La señora Irma Belem tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar ropa y calzado de hombre, mujer y niño, también quiere comprar accesorios de bebes pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión que le esta haciendo falta a su negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias, ya que es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Su hijo Felipe es el mayor le ayudara con una parte de los gastos de la casa con el sueldo que recibe como ayudante de una taqueria.
Desea tener más mercancía para la venta y así poder tener ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma Belem has been selling new and used clothing for ten years.  She is requesting a loan to buy men's, women's and children's clothing and shoes.  She also wants to buy baby accessories but does not have enough money to purchase what she needs for the business.

She plans to pay back the loan with part of her earnings.  She is a single mother with four children in her care.  Her son, Felipe, is the oldest and will help her cover part of the household expenses from the salary he receives as an assistant at a taco stand.

Increasing the merchandise she has on hand will generate more family income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rwashamaire Bakyara Twimukye Group A

texts.en:
Hope, who is 65 years old, sells agricultural products such as beans, peas, and coffee in Ntungamo food market in western Uganda. She earns a profit of 350,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) per month.

Hope is a married mother of 5 kids. She has spent 26 years in the business and plans to expand it to earn more profits. Her dreams are to construct a good residential house and to pay the necessary fees for her children up to university. With a Kiva loan, she intends to buy more products such as beans, peas, and coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy more products such as beans, peas, and coffee for resale.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is from Al Baqa'a, Amman. She is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.

Basma is manufacturing school bags and sewing clothes from home.

Basma is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase a new technological machine to print pictures on the bags she makes.

Through her business Basma is creating job opportunities for her family members, such as her sister and her sister's husband.

Basma is looking to improve her family life conditions and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that prints pictures for her bagmaking buisness

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 46 years old and married to Grace.  They have three children who attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: commercante au marché central de thiès une ville qui se trouve a proximité de la capital du Sénégal. Elle s'active depuis plus de 2 ans dans l'achat et la revente des tissus et basins riches .Ce prêt lui permettra de rendre sa porte feuille plus active dans ce domaine ou elle tend a faire des efforts pour l'achat de marchandises dans le bon fonctionnement de son commerce. Avec une appuie purement financiere cette commercante peut mener a bien ses activités et d'avoir des profits pour la réalisation de l'ouverture de sa cantine afin de ne plus louer pour stocker ses marchandises.
texts.en: This woman is a merchant at the central market in Thiès, a city close to the capital of Senegal. For over two years, she has been involved in buying and re-selling fabric and damask of the "riche" type. This loan will allow her to diversify her portfolio in this field, in which she has made efforts to extend her purchase of goods in order to run her business well. With financial support alone, this merchant will be able to run her business well and earn a profit in order to realize her ambition of opening her own store and thus avoiding the need to rent a place to stock her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fabric and damask for resale.

loans.name: Piedad De La Cruz

texts.es:
A sus 59 años de edad y como madre de 1 hija Piedad es una mujer emprendedora que se despierta día a día con la ilusión de sacar a su hija adelante, ella trabaja desde su casa brindándoles a sus clientes el servicio de cepillado y corte de cabello, esta labor la realiza desde hace 15 años, cuando hizo un curso capacitándose en esta actividad y al ver que era un negocio rentable decidió montar su propio negocio, una sala de belleza donde procura siempre prestar un servicio satisfactorio. 

Sueña con ver progresar su negocio, logrando una estabilidad económica, y es por esto que hoy solicita un préstamo para comprar mas herramientas de trabajo, como una silla adecuada para sus clientes, un lava cabezas, shampoo, laca, gomina y algunos insumos necesarios para el buen cuidado del cabello, ya que ella no cuenta con el capital para hacer esas compras, así espera aumentar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida mejorará notablemente.
texts.en:
Piedad is 59 years old and has one daughter.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who gets up every day with the desire to get her daughter ahead in life.  Piedad works from home, providing her customers with a hair brushing and hair cutting service.  She started out in this line of work 15 years ago when she took a course and trained in this business. Noting that it was a profitable trade, she decided to set up her own business: a beauty salon where she always tries to provide a satisfactory service.

Piedad dreams of seeing her business make progress and achieve financial stability.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more work tools such as a suitable chair for her customers, a sink for hair washing, shampoo, hairspray, hair gel and some supplies that are necessary for good hair care, as she doesn't have the capital she needs to make these purchases.  She thereby hopes to increase her income and her quality of life will notably improve.

loans.use: to buy supplies and work tools for her business

loans.name: Yurdusev

texts.en:
Yurdusev is married with two children.  The elder is studying at university and the other is still in high school.  She has been a real estate agent for two years.  Since starting her business she has become more active in social and business life.  She is happy to have increased her self-confidence, become successful at work, and with this work found a way to contribute to her family.  It is important to her to be known as a woman who is able to stand on her own two feet.

She will use this loan to improve the physical appearance of her office  and buy a computer to improve efficiency.   Being able to afford necessary items for her office is a relief for her.  Also she is very happy to be a part of this organization that helps improve the direction of women’s lives. Her plan is to complete the things her office is missing.  Since most people think the work environment is very important, and that one’s office is actually a reflection of one’s business, her plan to equip her office properly  is important in order for her to develop her customer base.   

With Maya support, she wants to add a remodeling  referral   service to her real  estate business for clients who need to make changes to the properties they have rented or purchased. Being able to receive this loan allows her to meet her own needs without burdening her family.  This makes her happy and in turn her family as well. Yurdusev is industrious and principled.  It is these qualities that guide her business decisions.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff.


Yurdusev evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Büyük olan üniversitede okuyor diğeri liseye devam ediyor.  İki yıldır Emlakçılık yapıyor.  Çalışmaya başlaması ile sosyal ve iş hayatında daha aktif biri oldu.  Kendine özgüveni nin arttığı için ,işte başarılı olduğu ve ailesine katkıda bulunduğu için çok mutlu.  Bir kadın olarak kendi ayaklarının üstünde durabileceğini bilmek ona yetiyor.
Bu kredi le Yurdusev Hanım,dükkanın görünümünü değiştirecek ve bilgisayar alacak.  Ofisinin yeni ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak onu rahatlatacak.  Ayrıca kadınlara yönelik böyle güzel bir projenin içinde olmak onu mutlu ediyor. 
Yurdusev Hanım’ın planı ofisin eksiklerini tamamlamak.  İnsanlar için çalışma ortamları çok önemli,aslında çalıştığınız ofis sizin işinizi yansıtır,planı ,ofisin eksiklerini tamamalayarak,müşteri potansiyelini arttırmak.
Maya’dan alacağı destek ile,inşaat sektörüne de başlamak istiyor. 
Bu kredi  ile ailesine yük olmadan, kendi ihtiyaçlarını karşılayabiliyor.  Bu onu mutlu ediyor ve ailesini de mutlu ediyor.Yurtsev Hanım çalışkan ve prensip sahibi.  Bu özellikler onun işi ile ilgili karaların arkasında durmasını sağlıyor.

loans.use: to improve the physical appearance of her office and buy a computer.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 41 years old. She is a married woman with three children between ages 2 and 17. Benedicta’s husband is a farmer.

Benedicta has had a sari-sari store business for four years. She sells items like oil, vinegar, soft drinks and shampoo. Benedicta also sells dried fish to the people in her community. She earns about 3000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as soap, soft drinks, oil and dried fish. Benedicta hopes that her store will grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soap, soft drinks, oil and dried fish.

loans.name: Gulguncha

texts.ru: Гулгунсо разведена, и у неё 4 детей. Она любит своих детей и старается обеспечить во всем. Боле 6 лет она занимается пошивом национальной одежды дома. Её клиенты приходят к ней домой, и заказывают платья, а также вышивку тамбурным швом. Она также учит своих дочерей этому ремеслу. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и желает закупить другую швейную машинку. С этой целью она запрашивает займ и заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Gulguncha is divorced and has four children. She loves her kids and tries her best to take care of them. For more then six years she has been sewing Tajik national dresses. Her clients visit her at her home and purchase both sewing services as well as chain stitch embroidery that decorate these dresses. Gulguncha has also taught sewing and embroidery to her daughters. She would like to expand her business and wants to purchase a second sewing machine. With this goal Gulguncha is requesting the loan from Kiva and would like to thank you for your kindness and support.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flowers for resale.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 53 years old, married and has 6 children.  She earns a living by leasing farming equipment in the Philippines.  Amelita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for farming equipment maintenance.

Amelita has been leasing farming equipment for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy spare parts to maintain farm equipment

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras de la ciudad de San Lorenzo se han unido con el objetivo de salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de cada una de ellas. Ven en el programa de la fundación una gran ayuda que en otros lugares no han podido encontrar. Desean llegar al máximo nivel del programa por lo que diariamente se esfuerzan.
Una de esas mujeres trabajadoras es Alejandra, quien se dedica a la venta de leche. Comenta que todos los dias empieza a trabajar a muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene que dejarle a sus clientes muy temprano la leche en sus respectivas casas. Dice que su trabajo es muy agotador, pero le gusta mucho. Gracias a su sacrificio ha podido ayudar a su familia y salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, lo cual la ayudara a abastecerse para no quedarse sin stock, para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sixteen hard-working and strong women from the city of San Lorenzo has united with the objective of using their jobs to move them ahead.  They see that the foundation's program offers them a great help that they would not be able to find elsewhere.  They work hard every day so that they can try to reach the highest level of the program.  

One of these hard-working women is Alejandra, who sells milk for a living.  She comments that every day she goes to work very early since she needs to deliver milk to her clients' houses in the early hours of the morning.  She says that her job is very stressful but she enjoys it.  Thanks to her sacrifice, she has been able to provide for her family and get them ahead.  She is asking for this credit so that she may purchase a greater quantity of milk which would keep help her inventory well-stocked.  This will allow her to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.use: purchase milk for future sales.

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo "La Fe" es de la ciudad de Encarnación, son 18 mujeres que tienen un gran animo de progreso, es por ello que se unieron al programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, ven en este una gran oportunidad y ayuda a la vez, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza. Su objetivo principal es poder ayudar a sus familias y sus hijos para que tengan una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Zunilda nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y demás tipos de bebidas. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, lo cual la ayuda a poder tener los ingresos que necesita para ayudar en la casa y cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Zumilda solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, pues se acerca la época de navidad y de año nuevo y quiere surtirse, por que es el tiempo en que más ventas tiene.
texts.en: The group La Fe (The Faith) is from the city of Encarnación.  There are 18 women who have a great encouragement for progress, which is why they joined the program for women entrepreneurs of the foundation.  They see in this a great opportunity and help at the same time, which is why they always strive. Their main objective is to help their families and their children to have a decent life without hardship.  Zunilda tells us that she sells drinks in general, such as beer, wine, soda and other types of drinks.  She says that she has very good customers, which helps to be able to have the income she needs to help around the house and cover the day to day expenses. Zumilda requested a loan for the purchase of beer, wine, soft drinks, as the Christmas and New Year season approaches she wants to stock up, because it is the time that she has more sales.

loans.use: to purchase beer, wine, sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a comal (flat earthenware pan) to make tortillas

loans.name: Sitahiti

texts.en: "Sitahiti is 56 years old single mother. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing clothes. She has 10 years of experience in this line of business. Sitahiti needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, threads, and oil.She hopes to use her profits to support her family and to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2011."

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, threads, and an oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of the business in order to meet his family and customers demand.

loans.name: Ugurlu

texts.en: Ugurlu is an IDP from occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993 and started his business in 2000. Married, has a child. To develop the busines he plans to borrow $1000 from Normicro Baku branch, with funding from KIVA.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
Olga Lidia is married with four children ages 6, 11, 13 and 16. Her husband Lorenzo works as an operator in a construction firm, but Olga saw the need to earn an extra income to improve their living conditions and offer her children a quality education. For this reason, for the past eight years she has been selling chemical products, a business which she runs out of her garage.

Olga now needs a loan of $375 to buy merchandise to stock her business and allow it to grow. The growth of this business and the wellbeing of this family are in your hands. Don't hesitate any longer and offer your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Olga Lidia es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 6, 11, 13 y 16 años de edad. Lorenzo, su esposo, trabaja como operador en una empresa constructora, pero Olga veía la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para poder mejorar las condiciones en las que vivían y otorgarles una educación de calidad a sus hijos, por esta razón desde hace ocho años se dedica a la venta de productos químicos, su negocio lo tiene en la cochera de su casa.

Ahora Olga necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio y poder hacerlo creer. El crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de esta familia está en tus manos, no lo pienses más y apóyala.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise stocks

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Business Description

Robert has a workshop where he repairs vehicle motors. Since the location of his workshop is excellent, he receives plenty of customers. He started his business after separating from the mechanic that taught his his craft. Robert and a friend began the business together, and today he only works with one employee.

Loan Usage

Robert needs this loan to buy better tools, because there are cars coming into his workshop that are very new and require them. He will also buy other mechanic's instruments and use the loan to remodel the shop's exterior.

Personal Information

Robert is 37 years old and has a one year old son. His house is made of cane. His objective is to have his locale in his own home and achieve a better quality of life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Maite Barragán

Descripción del Negocio

Robert tiene un taller donde repara motores de vehiculos y por tener una excelente ubicación sus clientes son bastantes. Empezo su taller luego de separarse de quien le enseño el oficio y comun compañero emprendieron el negoico, Actuamente trabaja solo con un oficial.

Uso del Préstamo

Robert necestia el credito para comprar herramientas mas sofisticadas pues llegan automoviles de nueva generacion y otros articulos de uso mecanico. Otra parte lo usara para mejorar la fachada de su taller.

Información Personal

El tiene 37 años y un hijo de un año su casa es de caña y. Su objetivo es de tener un local en su propio casa para atender bien al público y con ello poder mejorar sus calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing tools

loans.name: Fuzuli

texts.en: Fuzuli is a father of 2 children. He lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. This 42-year old man has his own orchard. He started his business 10 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy pesticides  and fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy pesticides  and fertilizer

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, 39 years old, owns a hardware store in Borj El Barajneh, in the Beirut suburbs with his wife and his 3 children. With school starting the tuition feesl, books, stationary, etc. must all be provided. Mohamad needs 1200$ to buy enough merchandise to sustain his business and to pay his children's education expenses.
Mohamad and his wife are aware of the importance of a good education. His family is therefore striving to provide the best education possible for their 3 children.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and pay the school tuition fees of his children

loans.name: Lik

texts.en:
Mrs. Lik M., age 50, is employed at a private company earning around $3 per day. Her husband works the land surrounding their home to grow bananas, earning about $3 per day. They have no children. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to build a fence to protect the bananas produced on their land, as well as to purchase additional banana trees.

Mrs. Lik M. is the approved borrower and has requested this loan to expand her husbands’ crops, as they share the profit in this family run business.

loans.use: To purchase more banana trees and build a fence to protect the crop.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Mr. Teodoro González Yegros resides in San Antonio city, San Ignacio state, and is owner of a animal clinic called Santa Rosa, located in the center of San Antonio. 

He sells supplies for cattle as San Antonio is a city where the main activity is agriculture and beef.  Among the supplies he sells are vaccinations and mineral sals for beef, he also provides animal health services. 

The income he receives from this activity helps maintain his family, which consists of 3 daughters ages 25, 20 and 16, who with their mother have a vegetable selling business in their home. They also cover the education expenses that the oldest daughter has as she is finishing her studies in Encarnación city.

He is asking for a loan to purchase mineral salts as the demand during this time of year is particularly high.


Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción:	 El Sr. Teodoro González Yegros, reside en la ciudad de San Antonio distrito de San Ignacio, es propietario de una veterinaria llamada Santa Rosa, ubicado en el centro mismo de la mencionada ciudad.

 Se dedica principalmente a la venta de insumos para ganados ya que se encuentra en una ciudad donde la actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería. Entre los insumos que vende podemos citar vacunas y sales minerales para ganado vacuno, también realiza servicios de sanitación animal.

 El ingreso que percibe por esta actividad ayuda a la mantención de su familia, que lo constituyen sus 3 hijas, de 25 20 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, quienes con su madre en su domicilio particular poseen venta de verduras. También cubre los gastos de estudio que posee la mayor de sus hijas que se encuentra culminando sus estudios en la ciudad de Encarnación.

 Solicita de este préstamo para compra de  sales minerales debido a la demanda que posee en esta época del año es bastante alta.

loans.use: Purchase mineral salts for animals

loans.name: Yolanda Del Rio Group

texts.es:
The association, Yolanda del Rio del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, owes its name to the deep respect and admiration that its 18 members have for the director of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela.

Most of the association's members are street vendors who, because they can't afford to set up shops, sell their wares in the principal markets of their town. They sell new and used clothing, domestic appliances and baked goods, among other things, and their businesses represent major sources of income for their families, most of which are married couples as only 10% of the association's members are single.

They now need funds to invest in their businesses, their common goal to generate enough money to pay for expenses related to the upcoming school year, for school supplies and for other expenses that they face year in and year out.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La asociación Yolanda del Río del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, debe su nombre al cariño respeto y admiración que las 18 socias que componen la misma, le tienen a la responsable de dicho Centro.

En su mayoría, las socias se ven obligadas a deambular ofertando sus productos, por las principales ferias y mercados de sus zonas a raíz de la carencia de puestos de venta fijos. Ropa nueva y usada, electrodomésticos, repostería y otros, son pequeños negocios que les representa el sustento para sus familias, principalmente aquellas que son casadas, ya que de todo el grupo solo un 10% son solteras.

Actualmente ellas precisan de capital para invertir en sus negocios, con el objetivo de generar los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la temporada de inicio de clases, listas de útiles e inscripciones que deben afrontar año tras año.

loans.use: Funds to invest in their businesses, their common goal to generate enough money to pay for expenses related to the upcoming school year, for school supplies and for other expenses that they face year in and year out.

loans.name: Khusein

texts.en:
K. Khusein is 19 years old. In spite of his youth, he supports his parents and younger brothers and sisters.

Khusein provides taxi services on his vehicle. He has been in this business for one year. Being a rather smart and diligent guy Khusein is trying to make his business stable. At the same time, Khusein runs a trading place in the local market. He is selling the soft drinks and juices. These businesses generate the income allowing Khusein to support his large family.  Because Khusein wants to provide taxi services of high quality, now he is going to fix his car. In order to do this he needs to purchase spare parts. He requests $600.00 US dollars for the term of 9 months. Khusein has already proved himself as a reliable client and he promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repair of the car.

loans.name: Nea

texts.en: Mrs. Nea S., age 26, is married with two children and works on her field as a farmer. On average, she makes about $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kon Saroeun, 31, has business milling rice for the local farmers with his rice grinding mill to take the husks off the rice. In revenue, he earns $10 a day. Children, one is a student and one other is too young to attend school. This couple has applies for a loan from Kiva to purchase a small tractor to assist on their field. They also hire it to the local villagers to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor to assist on the farmland.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S. is 40 years of age. She is something of a middleman between vegetable farmers and the market vendors that sell off the crops. She purchases the vegetables in bulk from the best farmers to sell to whichever vendors offer the highest price for her high quality goods. This has the capability of being a lucrative business.

She currently earns about 38 US$ per month. Her husband shares her business and brings in another 38 US$ per month on his part. On this income, they support a family of four including their young child and her younger sister.

Seng S. wants to expand her business by adding both eggs and dried fish to the list of food items she can resell to the markets. These items are more expensive, but with her extensive experience dealing with market resale she should be able turn a large profit through this expansion.

loans.use: To buy dried fish and eggs.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en: Kosar is 30 years old, just eight years younger than her husband whose name is Mr. H.. Her husband is a driver by profession. He can easily drive any vehicle. They are planning on buying a new rickshaw, and therefore Kosar has applied for a loan of $725.  She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Fozia wants loans to buy sanitary items for resale; Geo wants a loan to buy a horse cart; and Karshid wants a loan to expand her milk business.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
In the zone of Huayna Potosí in the city of El Alto one finds, located in the center of Germán Buch, the "Kantutas" association which is made up of 10 members. It is a very nice group that gets together with its credit advisor, working very enthusiastically with Pro-Mujer to improve their businesses. The majority of the women have small children who do not have basic medical attention, that is to say, indispensable vaccines and medical checkups because of their lack of economic resources. This situation is very concerning for their parents and has brought them to look for greater income in their small businesses.

The activities that the Kantutas association does are informal, that is to say, the mobile sale of different products. For example, doña Carmen sells scarves and wool gloves, Señora Mari sells candies and chocolates. What is particular about this business are the sales that they make using little, special carts that they take along the distinct city streets. Now they would like to buy or rent fixed stands in the main markets to ensure sales. For this, they require more capital for their work. This way they will be able to generate greater income. This is all for the good of their families, principally to insure the health and well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

En la zona Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Germán Buch, a este pertenece la asociación “Kantutas” integrado por 10 socias. Un grupo muy simpático que junto a su asesora de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucho entusiasmo de mejorar en sus negocios. La mayoría de ellas tienen niños pequeños y estos no cuentan con atenciones médicas básicas, vale decir vacunas y valoraciones indispensables, esto por falta de recursos económicos. Esta situación es muy preocupante para sus padres lo que les lleva a buscar mayores ingresos en sus pequeños negocios.

Las actividades que realiza la asociación “Kantutas” están dentro el comercio informal, es decir venta de diferentes productos de manera ambulante, .por ejemplo doña Carmen vende bufandas y guantes de lana, la Señora Mari, vende golosinas y chocolates. Lo particular de este negocio es que la venta, la realizan en pequeños y particulares carritos con lo que recorren las distintas calles de la ciudad. Ahora quieren comprar o alquilar puestos fijos en los principales mercados para asegurar sus ventas por eso requieren mayor capital de trabajo.de esta forma poder generar mayores recursos, todo esto para el bien de sus familias, principalmente para asegurar la salud y bienestar de sus hijos.

loans.use: Capital to buy or rent fixed stands to make sales

loans.name: Towanou Mathieu

texts.fr:
Born on July 16, 1966 in the village of Kpékplémé in the prefecture of Haho, Mr. Towanou Mathieu D. is married and the father of three children. He is a salesman and lives in the Agbalépédo neighborhood of Lomé. He sells curtains, fabrics, bed sheets and towels. Generally this type of business is operated by women, but for him it is a passion. He has benefited from one loan and fully reimbursed it. He is requesting this second loan to buy 14 rolls of fabric, one box of sheets and some towels. He gets his supplies at the large market in Lomé and sells them in his own neighborhood in order to make a profit and earn a living.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 16 juillet 1966 dans le village de Kpékplémé dans la préfecture de Haho, monsieur D. Towanou Mathieu est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il est revendeur et réside dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à Lomé. Il vend des rideaux, des tissus, des draps et des serviettes. Généralement ce commerce est exercé par les femmes mais constitue pour lui une passion. Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Il sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 14 rouleaux de tissus, 1 carton de draps et des serviettes. Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans son quartier de provenance afin de tirer des bénéfices et de pouvoir gagner sa vie.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and sheets.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela started this business because she enjoys sales and presenting merchandise to her clients. Thanks to her work she knows many people. She was looking for an productive activity that would help here achieve economic solvency. It started about 2 years ago in a presentation of perfume sales, she found it interesting and so decided to start her business.

She needs a loan of US $250, that will be repaid in 6 months, in order to acquire perfumes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Maricela qué inició el negocio porque le gustan a las ventas y las demostraciones con sus clientes ya que en este trabajo conoce a muchas personas. Ella buscaba tener una actividad productiva que le ayudara a tener solvencia económica, comenzó hace aproximadamente 2 años en una demostración de venta de perfumes entonces le intereso esta actividad y decidido dedicarse a esto.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir perfumes y así subir sus ventas.

loans.use: To acquire perfumes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali Q. is a 44-year-old farmer, and is married with 2 children. He is proactive and a very ambitious person. He is working hard in the sheep and livestock business, and he has an education in agronomy. This education helped him when he decided to engage in this business in 1989.

Ali has applied for a loan of $1200 USD. He will use this money to purchase an additional cow for $600 and 10 sheep for $60 each. He wants to earn more income so he can provide his children with a good education and improve their lives. This loan would help him accomplish his goals in a short time.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and one cow

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome A. L. is a member of community bank Obreras, which means "worker" in Spanish. With the help of her three children, she works as a distributor and supervisor at a local gas station in Ayacucho called Repsol. Frequently, Salome makes requests to a distributor in Lima to refill her pumps, and a truck comes to her store the following day to fill her order.

The loan of 2000 soles (~$675 USD) will be invested in her business by purchasing more gas to attend to her customers' needs. Salome is currently saving her money to be able to pay the bills she has acquired from her recent diagnosis of osteoporosis. She does not want to leave these bills for her children and wants to take care of them while she still can.

loans.use: To purchase more gas to attend to her customers' needs.

loans.name: Loko

texts.fr: Z. Loko  est né en 1975 à Ahoulogoè où il fait la culture maraichère depuis 16 ans. C'est une activité dans laquelle il excelle et qui lui procure des revenus. Par manque de moyens financiers et pour augmenter sa surface cultivable, il sollicite ce crédit pour mener à bien son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Loko Z. was born in 1975 in Ahoulogoè, where he has been doing market gardening for sixteen years. This is a business in which he excels and which brings in an income. Due to a lack of financial means and to increase his arable land, he is requesting this loan to do his work well.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his cultivable area for market gardening

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is happily married to his wife, Marichou. Their marriage has been blessed with three lovely children: Welmar, who is 10 years old and in grade 4; Romanae, who is seven years old, and in grade 2; and Meljo, who is five years old and in pre-school.

Romel has decided that he wants to live the rest of this life in Barangay San Isidro Quirino, Isabela. He not only loves the peaceful environment, but it also houses their major source of income - farming.

He has been involved in farm activities since childhood; he is used to the heat of the sun. Romel has worked as a farmer for the past 20 years. However, life has been difficult and progress slow. Because he lacks financial resources, Romel would like to borrow at least PHP 15,000 so that he can buy liters of crude oil for his hand tractor. He uses the tractor to cultivate his farm. He will use the remaining money to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds so he can start planting rice and corn.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Fagaee

texts.en: Fagaee S. F., 22, is married with no children.  She has two years of experience selling vegetables and fruit. She sells to the villagers and and to the general public 3 days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about US$180).  SPBD loans are Fagaee’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used primarily to buy chemicals and pesticides as well as fertilizers and vegetable seeds to maintain the growth of the business. The rest of the loan will be used to buy timber, cement, bricks, and nails for home improvement. Her husband is working and also helps run the business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and pesticides as well as fertilizers and vegetable seeds to maintain the growth of the business

loans.name: Izatmo

texts.en:
Izatmo N. is a happily married mother of two adult children. She has a small kiosk where for three years she has been selling office supplies. Her little kiosk is filled with attractive, reasonably priced items that appeal to many customers. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. Currently Izatmo has requested a loan in the amount of 400 USD to help her purchase a new supply of items to sell. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. sells cooked rice and beans at the Abura Police site. Hawa has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Hawa has been selling rice and beans for about 13 years. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family's other financial needs. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of rice and beans to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her little cooked food business.

loans.use: additional capital for the sale of rice and beans

loans.name: So

texts.en:
V. is 56 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. He is the father of three children: all of them are single and under his care. He is married to Nai, 55, who earns a living planting vegetables behind her house.

V. owns the bass speakers for ceremonies and party service with only his non-roofed truck. The villagers know him a lot for his service and his responsibility in his obligations. V. recently wants to increase his income because he wants to have a big house. So V. is taking a loan of US$ 550 to buy a number of bass speakers for his service. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a number of bass speakers for his service

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr:
Madame Penda  D. est une femme divorcée de quarante trois  ans, mère de trois enfants, qui réside à Sanankoroba village situé à 20  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) où elle est assistante sociale au village d’enfants SOS (VSOS). Sanankoroba est situé dans la deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Penda fait le commerce de pagnes, de draps de lit, de tissus etc. Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle est à son premier prêt individuel après avoir correctement remboursés ses trois prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) et compte avoir avec ce nouveau prêt  pour acheter, 35 pagnes et 15 draps de lit.
 Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de Bamako pour revendre à Sanankoroba au comptant et à crédit.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 55. 000  F CFA pour pouvoir non seulement rembourser l’échéance du prêt mais aussi investir dans son commerce et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Penda D. is a divorcee aged 40, mother of three children, who lives in Sanankoroba, a village situated 20 km from Bamako (the capital of Mali) where she is a social worker in the SOS children's village. Sanankoroba is situated in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Penda sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), bedsheets, fabrics, etc. In her search for complementary financial resources, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

She is on her first individual loan after having correctly reimbursed three group loans (solidarity loans) and with this loan she intends to buy 35 "pagnes" and 15 sheets.

She does her buying at the market in Bamako, then sells for cash and credit in Sanankoroba. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 55,000 F CFA so that she can not only reimburse the loan but also invest in her business and contribute to family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and bedsheets for re-sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys S. is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She sells electrical materials like extension boxes, sockets, torches, wall switches, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dembagnouman est composé d’une veuve et de sept femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 26ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et social (entraide dans les évènements sociaux (mariage, baptême et funérailles). 
Elles font exclusivement l’achat et la vente de poisson sous toutes ses formes (frais, frit, fumé et séché) depuis leurs bas âges. 
Afin d’augmenter le volume de leur activité génératrice de revenus, elles  ont  intégrer le programme de crédit  de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire après avoir remboursé sans difficulté les précédents.
Elles comptent acheter, 88 corbeilles correspondant à 1,320 tonnes de poisson frais auprès des pêcheurs de Markala et en période de crise à Macina ou à Teninkou. Une partie du poisson est vendue frais en ambulant dans le quartier administrative (service kin) de Kirango et l’autre moitié est d’abord séchée dans un coin de la maison à l’aide d’un séchoir traditionnel conçu pour la circonstance. Le poisson ainsi obtenu est revendu au comptant et en détail à Ségou,  dans les foires de Bousssin et Siribala à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent  réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 53.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour épargne et pour la prise en charge des frais médicaux des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’élever des animaux (bovins) afin de construire une maison à usage d’habitation petit à petit.
texts.en:
The group Dembagnouman is composed of a widow and seven married women, mostly in polygamous families, who average 26 years of age and 3 children. They all live in the Djaka Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of community, marriage, and social groups (mutual aid for societal events: marriage, baptisms, and funerals). The group members have exclusively been buying and selling fish in all forms (fresh, fried, smoked, and dried) since they were young. In order to increase the volume of their income-earning business, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth solidarity loan, after having repaid the preceding ones without a problem. They intend to buy 88 baskets of fish, equal to 1.32 tonnes, from fishermen in Markala, and in Macina or in Teninkou in times of crisis. A portion of the fish is sold fresh door-to-door in the administrative district (service Kin) of the Kirango area, and the other portion is first dried in a corner of the house using a traditional dryer designed for this purpose. The fish thus obtained is resold retail, cash or credit accepted, in Ségou, at the fairs of Bousssin and Siribala, to customers composed of men and women. The group members each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 53,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings and used to cover the medical costs for the children. Their ambition is to raise animals (cattle) in order to build a house, little by little, in which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Aydee Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 46 años de edad, con 4 hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 13 años e inicio su negocio de venta de especerías y abarrotes con un préstamo inicial de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará mercadería variada (arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, conservas, aceites, leche, etc.).

Manifiesta que le gusta las reuniones de pago y las capacitaciones que recibe.
texts.en:
Lucila belongs to the Rio Desaguadero Community Bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 46, and she has four children. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for thirteen years. She started her business selling spices and groceries. She did this with an initial loan for 300 PEN. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy various merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, oil, milk, etc. She likes the payment meetings and the trainings she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Marlene

texts.es: Claudia Marlene H. D. C. D. 31 años, resiD. en Cojutepeque junto a su esposo, el cual se dedica a trabajar como panadero y sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales estudian. Claudia se dedica a vender ropa para niños y adultos, Claudia comercializa su producto D. manera ambulante en diferentes pueblos del departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ella desea obtener un préstamo D. manera que pueda comprar ropa al mayoreo y D. esta forma poder aumentar su inventario y brindar más variedad D. productos a sus clientes. Ella desea poder mejorar su negocio con el fin D. aumentar sus ventas y poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, los cuales son mayor incentivo para trabajar día con día.
texts.en:
Claudia Marlene H. D. C. is 31 years old and lives in Cojutepeque with her husband, who is a baker, and with their three young children who are in school. Claudia works selling clothing for children and adults. She markets her products on foot in various towns in the Department of Cuscatlán. She wants to obtain a loan so that she can buy clothing at wholesale and in this way she would be able to increase her inventory and proviD. a greater variety of products for her customers. She wants to be able to improve her business with the goal of increasing her sales and being able to proviD. her three children with all that they need. They are what motivates her to work day after day.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing at wholesale.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Luz Cerito Group

texts.en:
To call Carmen R. anything less than an artist would be a misnomer as she is a talented craftsman of jewelry. The bracelets, necklaces and earring sets that she makes are both unique and beautiful. While she has occasionally sold her products in the past, this is the first time that she is trying to truly scale up her efforts. She is moving her sporadically lucrative hobby to a developed business venture.

Carmen R. (far left) is a bright and engaging 50-year-old woman. She is both passionate and a true leader as evidenced by the fact that she is one of the coordinators of group Luz Cerito. Resting at the base of the tropical hills of the Los Alcarrizos barrio (community), La Pared, Carmen lives with her husband and two grown sons.

One of the main barriers that prevented Carmen from previously scaling up her work was lack of capital. She simply did not have the means to purchase the supplies she needed to make her jewelry. With this loan, she will be able to purchase these materials from a supplier in Santo Domingo, the capital, which is about an hour away from her home. Carmen plans to sell her jewelry from her house and her sister’s salon as she figures women who have just had their hair done will be feeling beautiful and will be more willing to purchase jewelry to complement their new style.

Carmen is excited about the opportunities that this loan will provide. She thinks it is wonderful that her hobby is becoming her profession and looks forward to a life that is more stable, tranquil, and peaceful. On behalf of Carmen Ramirez, the bank Luz Cerito, and the microfinance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need them most.

This profile was written by Anne Cherniss, Esperanza International Summer Fellow ´09

loans.use: To buy supplies to make jewelry: cord, clasps, beads

loans.name: Khalida Rajab Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Khalida and I have been a citizen of a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 18 years. I am married to R. A. who is a very nice person. He keeps me motivated to move forward. I operate a milk-selling business and my husband helps me by selling it. I buy milk from the milk shops and sell to the community and earn income. I have been doing this work for the past 6 years. People have trust in my business and they give me orders for milk. I am applying for a loan to buy milk to grow the income of my milk-selling business. 

This loan group is consists of five additional people: 

Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 

Mairaj baji and Khursheed begum baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. 

Ramzana baji and Ghulam Fatima baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their animal-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Khalida baji is standing third to the right among the baji’s.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell

loans.name: Chap

texts.en:
Seventy-five per cent of Cambodian people have a farming business and Mrs. S. is one of them. She is a married woman with nine children, two of whom are married and the other seven are single and work in different jobs. Her husband is a mobile building worker.

S. is taking out a loan to purchase fertilizer to enrich her rice crop and to pay for plowing fees. She and her husband appear in the photo at their farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Nkosuo Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a trader who sells cutlasses. He gets his stock of cutlasses from Accra, sharpens them, and retails them to the farming communities to weed their farms. He is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. All his children are currently in school in the community where they live. He has been in this business for 20 years now and has lots of experience. He requests this loan to buy a bulk supply of cutlasses to meet the demand of the farming communities.

Stephen is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nkosuo’ which literally means ‘Progress’. He is the one seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, so there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cutlasses and a sharpening machine

loans.name: Susita

texts.en:
54-year old Susita M. started her pig business in 2007. She loves pigs and she earns a larger profit by raising three to four pigs at one time in her barn. She has nine children and all of them are married. Her business is doing great, but she admits that she needs additional capital to expand.

She requested a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase feed and piglets. This loan will help her raise more pigs so she can earn more income in her business.

In 2008 she joined the CEVI credit program. She still retains her membership because, according to her, she likes the services, especially the interest rate, which is 2% a month, and very low and easy to repay.

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel De Jesus M. R., tiene 46 años de edad vive en Mejicanos municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Vive solo con sus dos hijas Verónica de 11 años y Ana de 8 años, Manuel es un hombre de familia con mucha responsabilidad, ya que es él, el único proveedor para la familia. Posee su propio negocio una venta de relojes de brazalete, calculadoras, gorras, cinchos y otros. El crédito que solicta Manuel es para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en: Artyom K. is 33 years old. He lives in the village of Urtsadzor, in the Ararat region. He is married and has two children. Artyom and his wife are engaged in farm work, and at the same time they manage their own shop, where they sell food, household goods and toys. Artyom is asking for a $2300 loan to buy candy, non-alcoholic drinks, toys and saucepans for his shop, and to buy fodder for his sheep and cows.

loans.use: To buy goods for his shop and to buy fodder for his livestock

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn K. is 39 years old and lives in Ank Prasat village in Takeo province. She raises ducks. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing 1000 more ducklings for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Dorn, is farmer who owns 2.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy 1000 more ducklings

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Francisco João D. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província com o mesmo nome, capital de Moçambique, tem 24 anos de idade, solteiro e sem filhos. Fez 10ª classe apenas não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa da Irmã e não sustenta ninguém.

Saiu do bairro Hulene em casa dos pais para o bairro Patrice Lumumba (outro bairro da cidade Matola) em casa da sua irmã. Trabalha no Hospital Central de Maputo (maior hospital do pais) ha 4 anos, faz 8h por dia e tem um rendimento mensal de 2.093.00mt que aplica no seu sustento particular e poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho e este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, blocos e areia) para poder cobrir uma parte da sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo, para poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro para concluir sua obra e comprar mobiliário.
texts.en:
Francisco João D. was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name, which is the capital of Mozambique. He is 24, single, and doesn't have children. He studied through the 10th grade and didn't continue because of the lack of financial resources. He lives in his sister's house and doesn't support anybody financially. He left the Hulene neighborhood where his parents live for the Patrice Lumumba neighborhood (another neighborhood in the city of Matola) where his sister lives. He has worked in the Central Hospital of Maputo (the biggest hospital in the country) for 4 years. He works 8 hours a day and makes a monthly income of 2,093 meticais, which he applies to his expenses and saves some in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his neighbor, and this is his first loan for 10,000 meticais. He will use it to buy construction materials (metal sheets, bricks, and sand) to be able to put a roof on part of his house. He promises to pay back his loan on time to be able to request more loans so he can finish his house and buy furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (metal sheets, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 44 years old. Leonora is married and has 12 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Leonora joined HSPFI earlier this year in an effort to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Leonora is requesting a new loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her general-store business

loans.name: Joebert

texts.en:
Joebert is a 28-year-old married man. His wife, Rosalie, is pregnant with their first baby. Joebert farms for a living. He plants rice crops. Now that they are anticipating a baby, he works extra hard to secure their finances. He makes sure his farm will be productive so he will have a good income.

He also sought the help of one of Kiva's field partners, CEVI, which is a micro-finance institution in the Philippines, to assist his farm financially. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers and other needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 33-year-old married man with 3 young children. He has been working as a home decorator and specialized in Gypsum board since 2002. He has been involved for the past 13 years in this occupation. Today, Fadi is requesting to borrow $800 to buy a special machine for the Gypsum board.

loans.use: buy a special machine for the Gypsum board

loans.name: Franklin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Franklin Antonio S. H. tiene 42 años, y con su esposa vive en el Reparto Roberto Juan Padilla, ellos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales todos sobreviven del sustento diario que el señor S. les provee. El señor Franklin desde hace 6 años tiene una refresquería y dentro de las principales dificultades están la falta de financiamiento que ha recibido de parte de las micro financieras, para esto el señor ha trabajado duro para poder reconstruir la infraestructura de su hogar.

Ahora que el negocio cuenta con un capital más amplio, es que él opto por este préstamo, con el crédito comprará los materiales de construcción y dentro de las remodelaciones que hará serán dos cuartos para los hijos mayores esto les brindara mayor comodidad, seguridad y sobre todo independencia debido a que están en una etapa de adolescencia en donde reclaman un espacio personal. Ellos son una familia unida que ha salido adelante gracias al trabajo de todos los días esto es del reconocimiento de los habitantes del lugar donde moran y es digno de reconocer.
texts.en:
Mr. Franklin Antonio S. H. is 42 years old, and lives with his wife in the Roberto Juan Padilla district. They have 3 children, all of whom live on the income that Mr. S. provides for them. Franklin has had a soda shop for 6 years, and amongst the main challenges has been the lack of financing he has received from micro finance organizations. Because of this, he has worked very hard to be able to rebuild his home. Now that the business is doing well, he has chosen to apply for this loan. With the funds he will buy construction materials. Part of the remodeling he plans are two rooms for his eldest children, which will offer them more comfort, security, and above all, independence. They are at a stage of their adolescence where they need personal space of their own. This is a very close family that has gotten ahead thanks to daily hard work. It's worth noting that this is something that is recognized by the people in their neighbourhood.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita C. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and by selling vegetables. She lives in Bucrus Daku La Carlota City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their child, who is 18 years old and currently goes to school.

Marianita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her general store and vegetable vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000.

Marianita is now borrowing PHP 29,000 so that she can buy additional products for the general store, as well as vegetables to sell. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marianita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her general store and vegetable vending businesses

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr:
Madame Sadio S. est une femme mariée, née vers 1959 à Sibiraso, un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Sadio est  mère de 4 enfants et vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec son époux et leurs enfants à Gongebougou. 
Madame Sadio S.  n’a pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales et s’est très vite intéressée au commerce auprès de sa mère. Aguerrie par de nombreuses années passées dans cette activité, elle est  très expérimentée et jouit d’une notoriété sans égale.  
Après  4  prêts tous correctement remboursés, elle est  à son 5eme prêt solidaire. Madame Sadio S.  compte acheter avec son prêt, 20 sacs de maïs et 17 sacs de sorgho. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants  Loulouni et  à Nimbougou. Elle les revend au comptant aux marchés de Dallen, Nimbougou et Loulouni à une clientèle composée généralement d’hommes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter le fonds de commerce. 
Elle ambitionne avoir un magasin et véhicule de transport de marchandises.
texts.en:
Ms. Sadio S. is a married woman who was born around 1959 in Sibiraso, a village in the prefecture of Kadiolo (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She is the mother of four children and lives in a traditional extended family with her husband and their children in Gongebougou. Ms. S. did not attend school for societal reasons and very quickly became interested in commerce from her mother. Hardened by numerous years in this business, she is very experienced and enjoys unparalleled fame. After four loans, all properly repaid, she is now on her fifth solidarity loan. She intends to use her loan to buy twenty sacks of corn and seventeen sacks of sorghum. She stocks up in the villages surrounding Loulouni and in Nimbougou. She makes her sales for cash at the markets of Dallen, Nimbougou, and Loulouni to customers compose generally of men. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used for the most part for increasing her working capital. Her ambition is to have a store and a vehicle for transporting merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grain

loans.name: Keyla Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Keyla del Carmen S. V., se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria, es de estado civil casada, sin hijos, tiene mas de once años de desempeñar esta ardua labor que es la de educar a niños y niñas para prepararlos para el futuro, este crédito lo solicito para gastos personales aunque en créditos anteriores los ha solicitado para mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Keyla del Carmen S. V. works as a teacher in a secondary school. She is married, without children, and has more than 11 years of experience carrying out the hard work of educating boys and girls to prepare them for the future. This loan she requests is for personal expenses, although she has used previous loans to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to the registration of her professional/academic degree

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna C. is 44 years old and president of an eight-member loan group in Akreiksat village, Kandal province. Each member uses the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Vanna C. is a mango seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand and is asking for a loan to buy more mangoes. Her husband, Mr. Savorn Heng, is a security guard in a private company and earns a small salary. The couple has no children and live in a multi-family household.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Jimmy Gererdo

texts.es:
Jimmy tiene 29 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito cuya actividad principal es la siembra de caña de azúcar, se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a brindar servicio de transporte público de carga y pasajeros en un automóvil que cubre las rutas Zaña – Chiclayo y viceversa. Empezó en este negocio como chofer de una unidad y poco a poco pudo avanzar en el rubro, actualmente cuenta con un vehículo propio que le sirve como herramienta de trabajo, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son los unicos con los que cuenta, por lo que dia a dia se esfuerza al maximo para salir adelante con su trabajo.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para que el vehículo siga trabajando sin problemas, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación de su vehículo.

Jimmy es bastante trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es adquirir otra unidad e ir expandiendo su negocio poco a poco, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 29 years old and lives with his family in the district of Cayalti, a district whose main line of work is in the planting of sugar cane. It is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. Jimmy has been providing a public transportation service for over 10 years to both people and goods. His route covers the Zaña-Chiclayo areas and vice versa. He started this business whilst working as a driver of a bus and little by little moved up in the field. He currently has his own vehicle, which he uses for this work. This job provides him with his only income, and he, therefore, tries as hard as he can to get ahead and to make ends meet. The continual use of his vehicle means that it is in need of some urgent repairs. Jimmy is therefore requesting his first loan of 2000 Peruvian New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can put this money towards the repairing of his vehicle. Jimmy is very hard working and responsible. His greatest wish is to be in charge of another route and expand his business bit-by-bit. His neighbours and friends consider him to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance costs for the vehicle he uses to provide a public transportation service.

loans.name: Ezeem

texts.en:
OluwaF. lives in Lagos and she is a business woman. She buys and sells groceries like tomatoes paste, gallons of groundnut oil, wine and more. This serve as her means of livelihood. She has been in the business for over 15 years and she has been able to retain and attracts more customers to her shop. She wants to stock up her shop with more goods to sell in order to make more profit for the business and her family. She needs the loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

OluwaF. is married with a 15 years old child and is doing well in school. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Ruperto

texts.en:
Carlos, 60, is married, has 2 children, Luis (10 years) and Miguel (8 years) and lives with his wife in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra). He is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops.

Carlos is a farmer. He purchases and sells his goods in Bucay every 3 months. He requests this loan so that he can plant more crops. His goal is to continue to labor land. Carlos works 7 days a week to help his family.

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mr. Ra O. is 43 years old and lives in Prambei Mom village in Takeo province. He is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small profit to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Soy Chann, is a farmer who owns 1.30 hectares of land to cultivate rice.
