In order to support her farming, Mrs. Soy Chann decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to support her farming crop. This couple has three children. Two of the children are students in the local school and  support their mother's farming.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie A. is from the village of Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling wood products like plywood, "dosdos," in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials to use in expanding the business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim T. is a 48 year old cattle breeder who has been selling cattle and milk in the small village of Saatli for his entire life. Ibrahim is married and has three children. His monthly income is 200 AZN and he would like to increase it to 300 AZN. He sells milk and milk products to the local people and to the milk factory of Saatli city. He applied for 600 AZN in order to rebuild the shed and to improve livestock-keeping conditions.

loans.use: To rebuild the shed and to improve livestock conditions.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar C. V., tiene la edad de 38 años vive en el Barrio de la Borgoña es casado, y con su mujer tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que estudian el colegio y el mayor la universidad, ellos son agricultores tienen 12 años y fue gracias al apoyo de su padre que le cedió un lote de terreno para que lo trabajara y comenzara a encaminar su vida y la de su familia.

Ahora él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a los cultivos de la piña, este capital le beneficiara a su economía familiar y personal para futuros proyectos que tengan en mente que favorezcan a su vida profesional, y/o  familiar.
texts.en:
Mr Julio Cesar C. V., age 38, lives in the neighbourhood of la Borgona. He is married, and he and his wife have three grown children who study in high school- the oldest is in university. They have been farmers for 12 years, thanks to the help of his father who gave him a plot of land so that he could work and start his life and that of his family. He is now requesting a loan for the purchase of inputs and fertilizers which will provide a better maintenance to his pineapple crops. This capital will benefit his family's finances and his personal finances for future projects which he has in mind for his professional and/or family life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty O. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut phase (peanut paste) and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal to sell at home. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

Betty is 21 years old and is married to a security guard. She has two children and her children go to school.

loans.use: To stock bags of charcoal to sell at home

loans.name: Noemi Del Rocio

texts.es:
Noemi de 33 años, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposo es taxista con el tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años. 

Inicio con su negocio hace 10 años atrás para ayudar con los gastos familiares, comenzó a trabajar con unas tijeras y esmaltes, poco a poco según los ingresos que tenia fue comprando todos los implementos que necesitaba. Ahora tiene una ayudante que trabajan desde las 16h00 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días.

Ella quiere comprar para su salón de belleza maquinas como planchas de cabello y accesorios para su negocio. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Noemi is 33 years old and has a small beauty salon. She lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil, and her husband is a taxi driver. Together they have two children, aged 12 and 8. She began her business 10 years ago, to help with the family's expenses. She began working with a few haircuts and manicures, and little by little, with the income she obtained, she bought all of the tools she needed. Now she has an assistant who works from 4 p.m. until 11 p.m. every day. She would like to buy equipment for her beauty salon business, such as hair straightening irons and other accessories. In the future, she would like to expand her business and buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equipment for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 54 años, es una mujer muy sencilla, que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio de 60 años, quien es el compañero de toda su vida y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Las chacras que con tanto esfuerzo ha cultivado Julia, siempre le han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, ella cultiva zanahoria, papa, gladiolos, que con la ayuda de su esposo lo lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios le dan por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos. En adelante, espera poder ampliar sus tierras, para poder sembrar más. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, y afirma que siempre ha sido muy puntual y desea serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más semillas de arveja, asimismo  comprará abono.
texts.en:
Julia is 54 years old. She is a simple woman who during her whole life has always worked to get ahead. She lives in her own home with her husband, Antonio, who is 60. He has been her life's companion for her whole life. What she wants the most is to have a calm old age. The fields that Julia has cultivated with so much work have always offered enough income to support her family. She grows carrots, potatoes, and gladiolas. With her husband's help she takes them to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where the best prices are gotten for her products. What she likes the most about her work is sowing her land which she does with much patience. She has been doing this for 30 and considers the most difficult part of tending to her crops are the pests that can disturb them. In the future, she hopes to be able to enlarge her land to be able to plant more. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She affirms that she has always made her payments on time and she will this time as well. In her communal bank she is a member who is very committed to the group's development. With the five hundred nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will buy more pea seed, and in addition she will buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vinicio Ruperto

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días, el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

El señor Vinicio tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos,  dos mayores de edad y dos menores,  sus tres hijas estudian,  el varón trabaja y es independiente, su esposa es Abogada.

Es chofer y comerciante,  vende muchas veces con su esposa ropa por catalogo, zapatos y carteras, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 17h00,  sale a recorrer con  sus productos en su carro,  entrega en Portoviejo y otros lugares cercanos. Sus productos los deja a crédito a clientes que son confiables y si no al contado, compra sus productos en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja dos veces por mes para surtirse de mercadería.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear en comprar mercadería. Este es su segundo ciclo con el Banco Comunal y está muy a gusto por los beneficios que ha recibido.
 
Su meta es comprar un carro nuevo ya que el que tiene esta un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
In the La California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Su Bankito" meets every 15 days.

Vinicio is 46 years old.  He is married and has 4 children: 2 of them are grown and the other 2 are minors; his 3 daughters are in school while his son works and is independent, and he is married to a lawyer.

Vinicio is a driver and a merchant, and he often works with his wife, selling clothing through a catalog as well as shoes and handbags.  He works every day from 8am until 5pm.  He goes out around the city with his products in his car, delivering them in Portoviejo and other areas nearby.  He extends credit to the customers whom he deems reliable, and sells on a cash basis to others.  He buys his products in Guayaquil; he travels to this city twice a month to stock his business with merchandise.

He will use this loan to buy merchandise.  This is his second loan cycle with the communal bank, and he is very pleased with the benefits he has received. 

Vinicio's goal is to buy a new car, since the one he has is not in good condition.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and handbags

loans.name: Pensseur Du Christ Group

texts.en:
Edile is the coordinator of the group Pensseur Du Christ (Thinking about Christ). She is a single mother who makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She has a three-year-old daughter and her son is nine years old. She says that her most difficult challenges are consistently finding all the merchandise for her clients and keeping her shop properly stocked. This is in part financial, but also has to do with available supply.

Edile is excited to be getting her 3rd loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small grocery store where she sells cold drinks, food, and cosmetics. She hopes to use the profits in the building of a better home.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying time with her children and occupying her house. 

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients generally. Her group is located in Trou du Nord. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of Haiti, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bottled juices, soda, peanuts, oil. salt, lotions, perfumes, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Luz, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene 42 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive junto a su madre y hermanos, ella es soltera y su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene para solventar sus necesidades.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa, peluches, sandalias  y recuerdos, lo atiende de 8:00 am hasta las 5:00pm, este negocio fue un esfuerzo emprendedor que ella inicio desde hace 4 años y que poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando. Actualmente quiere comprar mercadería alusiva a la época de navidad y también una vitrina para exhibir los artículos, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a salir de esta situación, lo que ella pretende es proporcionar a todos los clientes una variedad de artículos y prendas de vestir para este periodo y así darle al negocio una mejor atracción.
Crecer como comerciante es su principal objetivo pero para obtenerlo debe realizar inversiones que estabilicen sus ventas, progresando no solo como persona sino como microempresaria y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luz lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazán department.  She is 42 years old, and she sells clothes.  She lives with her mother and her siblings.  She is single.

Her business is the only source of income that she has to pay for her necessities.  Her business consists of selling clothes, stuffed animals, sandals, and souvenirs.  She works at her business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  Her business was an enterprising effort that she started four years ago.  Little by little she has been increasing it.

She currently wants to buy merchandise for the Christmas season.  She also wants to buy a showcase to display the items she sells.  However, she does not have the money to do so.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will help her overcome this situation.  She intends to provide her customers with a variety of goods and articles of clothing for this period of time.  That way she will make her business more appealing.

Her main objective is to grow as a businesswoman.  In order to do so she needs to make investments that will stabilize her sales.  She is making progress, not only as a person, but also as a small businesswoman.  She is improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a showcase to display her goods

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en:
Khafiz S. is married with three children. He is from Agsu, in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He sells foodstuff in his grocery store. His merchandise is varied and of very good quality. He has been in this trade for almost 6 years. 

Khafiz is very disciplined and responsible.  The first loan he took from AqroInvest helped him to increase his income and improve his life conditions.  The benefits from the loan have helped him to overcome many challenges that came his way and allowed him to achieve success in business. 

Khafiz has always sought to achieve economic freedom and independence. He is hoping this loan will help his venture to continue growing and to continue bringing him profit.

loans.use: To purchase stock for grocery store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz, de 23 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de sus padres y sus hermanos menores. Esta trabajadora joven se dedica a su negocio por completo y así  ayuda a sus progenitores. Cada mañana Beatriz se despierta con los primeros rayos de luz para ir a su negocio de venta de comida que esta instalado en un mercado de su zona. Ella es la administradora y atiende con la ayuda de tres jóvenes, además dice que esta muy satisfecha con el negocio pues le genera buenas ganancias ya que esta muy bien ubicado. Atiende desde las 8 de la mañana con la venta de desayunos, a partir del mediodía comercializa  diversidad de comidas y en las tardes se prepara para atender el lonche. Aunque muchas veces no se abastece en la atención, por la cantidad de comensales que visitan su negocio en busca de la deliciosa comida y los bajos precios que ofrece, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio e instalar otro cerca de la zona. Es el sexto  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Beatriz tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mesas y sillas que necesita para implementar mejor el negocio que esta por abrir, y así  espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Beatriz is 23 years old and lives in her own home with her parents and  her younger sisters. The hardworking young woman works full time at her business and this is how she helps her parents. Every morning Beatriz wakes up at the first ray of sun to go to her food selling business that is set up in a market in her area. She is the manager and she serves with the help of three young people. She is very satisfied with the business because it generates good earnings for her since it is well located. She serves from 8 in the morning selling breakfasts. Starting at midday she sells different meals and in the afternoons she prepares to serve lunch.  Although she often doesn't have enough to serve due to the number of guests who seek her delicious food and the low prices that she offers, she is planning on growing her business and opening another one in the area. This is the sixth loan she has had with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time since she doesn't want to look bad to the people who made this contribution possible that will keep her working in search of progress.  Beatriz is planning on investing the loan she is asking for in the purchase of tables and chairs she needs to better outfit the business she is going to open. She hopes to improve her earnings in this way.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs to outfit her locale.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice is a thirty-three-year-old married female with six children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She started with a small stall in the market but now has had a shop for clothes for the last fifteen years, however, her challenge is lack of enough capital. Her vision is to buy more clothes and educate her children up to university level. Loice needs the loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: Buying clothes for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria T. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Victoria is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Victoria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mauricia; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otro tipo de productos, la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, golosinas entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mauricia is a member of the “Mama Simona” communal bank, located in the Poroy district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is 42 years old, married, has three children, and runs a small grocery store.  She sells primary need products, such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things.  She’s had this business for five years and works together with her husband.  In this way she moves her family ahead.

She is asking for this loan so that she can supply her business with sugar, rice, milk, noodles, and snacks, among other things.  She is happy about this loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, golosinas entre otros más.

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
Suhbaatar is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and a child in Arhangai, a central province in Mongolia. His wife is a dressmaker and his baby infant stays at home. He started operating a taxi service in his town using his car, in 2007. He transports local residents to and from various points in his province and has his regular customers. At first, he started his business with a starting capital of 80,000 MNT and today his working capital exceeds 400,000 MNT. He continues to work as a taxi driver and wants to upgrade his car and make more money.  With increased income he could help his wife to open her own comfortable workshop and buy a sewing machine. They would like to provide the opportunity for their child to get a good education in the future.
Suhbaatar is a calm and sociable person who gets along with others easily. His wife fully supports his business and agrees with the idea to get a loan to improve their living and fulfill their dreams. Therefore, he is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to buy necessary spare parts for his current car and a sewing machine for his wife.  



"

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Go Try” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each one in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salamatu K..  Salamatu was born in Makeni city.  She is 35 years old. Salamatu is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman, and 2 of her children are attending primary school.  One is in secondary school.  Salamatu has been selling biscuits, soaps, mints, chewing gum, and gara clothes (locally dyed clothes) for 5 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to expand the size and quality of her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity.

loans.use: Buys biscuits, soaps, mints, chewing gum, and gara clothes in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Khourn

texts.en:
Khourn M., age 30, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its Pre-Angkorean temples. Khourn M. is employed at a factory, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 40 USD on food and 60 USD on other necessary expenses.

M. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush A. lives in a faraway small city called Agarak. There are six people in her family, two of whom are children. For 5 years Anush has been running a beauty salon. She is the only breadwinner in the family, because of the high unemployment rate in the region. It took many years for Anush to build up this salon business. Lots of hard work, long working hours and hard earned savings were put into it. 

To finally end the construction work in the salon, Anush has applied to SEF International for a loan to achieve this in a short time and create suitable conditions for her clients, to give them comfort and good service.

loans.use: to finish constructing a salon.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe T. is from the village of Suarez, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Fe is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Fe owns and operates a  food stall, making and selling a variety of viands like pork and chicken adobo in the local community. She also makes and sells sausage or longganisa. Fe has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients like meats, vegetables and spices. This will be the second loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meats, vegetables and spices

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie, a 31-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 7 and 12 years old, is widely known for her business of selling a variety of goods such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc. In business for about five years now, she employs four people, and her hours of operation are 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. daily.

Eugenie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding such foods as rice and beans and acquiring more sugar, cooking oil, etc. She will reinvest the increased profits to ensure long-term financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en:
Odiljon A., a married father of one child, is a hardworking man who operates a bakery in a rented facility near the market of Shohmansur, where he sells his breads. Odiljon, who is helped by both his brother and sister in this business, is requesting a loan of USD1500 to purchase more flour for his enterprise. Prior to starting the bakery, he grew vegetables at home to sell at the market.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy flour for his bakery.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 33 years old and married, with three children.  For thirteen years, he has been selling second-hand clothes.   He was previously employed in a quarry.  Moses testifies that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to own rental houses which earn him extra income.  He hopes to open other business outlets in other areas.  Currently, Moses has identified another premises where he intends to relocate his business.  Moses has requested 50,000 Kes to renovate his new business premises.

loans.use: to renovate his new business premises

loans.name: María Germania

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 21 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de dos años. El marido es electricista. Actualmente ella se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro De la ciudad de Manta, estudia para licenciada en Ciencias De la Educación.

Trabaja de maestra por contrato o reemplazo en una institución de la localidad, pero además de eso se dedica al comercio, vende carteras y zapatillas de damas. Trabaja todos los días, en las mañanas en la  escuela cuando tiene sus contratos y por las tardes o noches recorrer la ciudad para ofrecer sus productos, también les vende a sus compañeras de clase las mismas que son sus clientes más confiables comenta, vende a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, le envían desde Otavalo. Tiene dos  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar carteras, zapatillas y zapatos. Este es el segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la forma de pago que es muy conveniente.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
The 21 De Noviembre community bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal crafts, known nationally and internationally. It is famous for its hats made from paja toquilla.

Here we meet María. She is 21 years old and in a common law marriage. She has a two year old son. Her husband is an electrician. At this time, she is studying at the Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta. She is getting her degree in Education Science. 

She works as a contract or substitute teacher in a local institution. She is also a merchant. She sells purses and women's slippers. She works every day. Mornings she works in the school when she has a contract, and afternoons or nights she offers her products throughout the city. She also sells to her classmates, who she says are her most trustworthy customers. She sells on credit and collects every week. She recieves the products at her house, sent from Otavalo. She has been doing this activity got two years and it has gone very well for her. 

This loan is to buy purses, slippers and shoes. This is her second cycle in the community bank and she likes it because the payments are convenient. 
 
Her dream is to finish her studies and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy purses, slippers and shoes.

loans.name: Marin

texts.en:
Marin is a 38-year-old married man and father of four children.  He works in agriculture and is a farmer known by most of his villagers.  He is a man with a good reputation, a hardworker who does his best to provide his family with the best living. 

Marin is requesting a loan for the first time from A. Majmoua (a Kiva Partner) in order to buy fertilizer and do maintenance on his tractor, which are necessary means to support his main source of earning a living.

Marin had financiA. problems when he first started his business, but ambition and hard work has helped a lot in overcoming such obstacles.  What helped him most is that he owns the land which he's farming. Marin hopes to improve his business through expanding his crop production's variety, quality and quantity.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and service his tractor

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
nasceu no Distrito de Namacha, Provincia de Maputo tem 42 anos de idade é mãe de 3 filhos de 7 aos 20 anos , todos vão a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe não concluiu devido a distância que a separava da Escola a casa. Vive com sua familia na casa propria e reponsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe 1.000.00mt por mês.

é proprietaria de um tractor que faz trabalhos de lavoura e colheita local, consegue colectar um fundo e da inicio do seu próprio negócio. Hoje é dona também de um estabelecimento comercial  na zona fronteiriça, conta com ajuda de 2 empregados que auferem 1.500.00mt cada consegue de lucro um valor de 6.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Conta com ajuda do seu marido que e proprietária e criador de 32 cabeças de gado bovino.

Este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção para reabilitação da sua capoeira pois pretende iniciar com a criação de pintos aumentando assim a renda familiar. Os anteriores de (10.000.00, 20.000.00, 20.000.00)mt foram para o comércio

Esta confiante que ira pagar antes do tempo e pedir novos créditos para compra de pintos de criação.
texts.en:
Marta was born in the district of Namaacha in Maputo province. She is 42 years old and the mother of three children between 7 and 20 years of age. All of her children attend school. She went to school through the sixth grade but couldn't finish because her school was too far away. She and her family live in their own home, and she also supports her mother, sending her 1000 meticals a month.
She owns a tractor that she uses to do plowing and harvesting locally, which has allowed her to save up enough money to open her own business. Today she is also the owner of a retail establishment with two employees who earn 1500 meticals. The business provides profits of 6000 meticals a month, which she uses to cover household expenses. Her husband also contributes financially; he raises cows and currently owns 32 head of cattle.
This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals. She will use it to purchase construction materials to refurbish her chicken coop, since she plans to start raising chickens for a little extra income. Her previous loans (in the amounts of 10,000, 20,000, and 20,000 meticals) were also invested in the business.
She is confident that she will be able to pay off this loan early and request additional loans to purchase chickens.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her chicken coop.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has three children. He lives with eight family members, of whom three work. Mohamad has had a wholesale grain shop since 2000. He has long experience in this field and has a good reputation. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and is loyal to his clients.

Mohamad is requesting a $2700 loan to rebuild the walls of his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to rebuild the walls of his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Leolisa

texts.en:
Leliosa, 35, is a resident of GMA,Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Daniel, and mother of her five children. With her husband, Leliosa manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leliosa operates a buy and sell business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells them piecemeal, with a little profit. Products can range from tools to household wares and other products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options that are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP1500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP23, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leolisa dreams to be able to give her all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Margoth

texts.es:
María Margoth  tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	NUEVA INSPIRACION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz y arroz.

María se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Agripac y los vende en el Comercial Carlos Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente a suplir sus necesidades y a mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y comprarse una casa.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo y realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
María Margoth, 25, is single living with her parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Nueva Inspiración” (New Inspiration) communal bank are located in Achoveta that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

María is a corn and rice farmer.  She purchases her supplies in Agripac and her sales take place at the Carlos Castillo supply center.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn seeds.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs and improve the farming activities.  Her dream is to finish her schooling and buy herself a house.

She enjoys working in the countryside and doing household chores.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a determined businessman who was born in 1970. He is married and blessed with three children who are going to school. Since the year 2000, he has been operating a welding shop to make a living. He wants in the next five years to open up several outlets of his business and to invest in other businesses. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metal.

loans.use: To buy metal

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a beauty salon; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another beauty shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair pieces, hair dryers and perfumes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair pieces, hair dryers and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cement to sell in his shop

loans.name: Aleida

texts.es: Aleida tiene 33 años, es una mujer alegre, dinámica y emprendedora, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, acompañada también de su suegro, motivo por el cual ella y su esposo se esfuerzan cada día para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Aleida consiste en la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos para el hogar por medio de catálogo. Aleida posee un loca en la casa de su madre, ahí comparte el local junto a su hermana que se dedica a otro negocio, es así que lleva trabajando por más de seis años y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disponibilidad para muchas otras actividades además de tener contacto directo con la gente, pues ella es muy sociable, y le encanta ofrecer los artículos y accesorios de moda, así como la prendas de vestir de temporada, logrando captar más clientela. Su mayor anhleo es tener una boutique, pero para ello necesitará invertir y crecer su negocio. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ropa, zapatos y algunos accesorios para abastecer su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Aleida is 33 years old. She is a cheerful, dynamic and enterprising woman. She is married and has two childrem aged 10 and 7. Together they live in their own home with her father in law. Her husband and her work hard every day to offer them a good quality of life. Aleida's job consists of selling clothes, shoes and products for the home via catalogue. She has a locale in her mother's house. She shares the locale with her sister who has another business. She has been doing this work for more than six years and she works alone. What she likes the most about her job is she is available to do many other activities and she has direct contact with people. She is very sociable and she likes to offer fashion items and accessories as well as seasonal clothing, in order to gain more customers. Her greatest wish is to have a boutique store, but she will need to invest and make her business grow. This will be her third loan with MFP and she hopes to have your support to keep on working. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy clothes, shoes and some accessories for inventory for her small business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana Del Carmen tiene 52 años tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 16, 32 y 22 años, actualmente solo uno está bajo su cargo. Juana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio este negocio con pequeños productos de manera ambulante fue con el paso del tiempo que logro obtener sus clientes y además crecer con su negocio. Su horario para empezar este trabajo es de las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche luego de su jornada laboral, llega a su casa e inicia su labor como ama de casa. Este crédito es para la compra bolsos, cremas, calzado, perfumes y ropa en general.
texts.en: Juana Del Carmen is 52 years old and she has three children, aged 16, 32, and 22 years old. Currently only one of them is in her care. Juana sells general merchandise. She started out this business selling small products itinerantly. With the passage of time she acquired a clientele and she also expanded her business. Her schedule to start work is at 8 in the morning until 8 at night. When her work duties are complete she arrives at home to do her household work as a housewife. This loan will be used to purchase handbags, skin lotions, shoes, perfumes, and clothing in general.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, skin lotions, shoes, perfumes, and clothing in general.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is 26 years old and married with two children between 3 and 5 years old. Anitha owns a business selling mobile phones. This is her third successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Anitha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her mobile phone business. This will allow her to purchase new mobile phones. With the profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family and she will be able to reinvest in her mobile phone business.

loans.use: To purchase new mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 25 years old and married with four children aged 10-5 years old. She has been running a produce and fresh foods business for seven years. She started with a working capital of 100,000 UGX but now has 600,000 UGX as capital.  She has no challenges in the business and hopes it will grow bigger in the future. She is requesting  a loan to buy maize and rice.

loans.use: To buy maize and rice for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 57 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is married and has eight children. 

Juana has a rental-house business and she is a church caretaker who earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase materials for her boarding house repairs. 

Juana has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Juana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her boarding house repairs.

loans.name: Mashanga Water Group

texts.en:
George takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, George had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. With income from maize sales, George will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

George is the facilitator of the Mashanga Water Group. In the photograph above, George is pictured with his group members.
George and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mashanga Water Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortencia, tiene 50 años D. edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos ya son mayores D. edad,su negocio lo inicio hace 5 años el cual lo nombro Micelanea Divino Salvador,con el credito anterior que kiva le brindo pudo adicionar a sus ventas productos comestibles D. primera nececidad,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito,ya que ella quiere invertir en calzado D. todos los estilos para dama y caballeros,ya que se hacercan fechas festivas y es cuando sus cliente buscan calzado, ella dice que es una oportunidad muy bonita para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Hortencia is 50, married and has 3 children who are all adults.  She started a business 5 years ago called "Micelanea Divino Salvador", and with a prior loan bought an inventory of food items.  She now seeks to buy a stock of various styles of men's and women's shoes, which are popular during local festivals and holidays.  She hopes this will be an excellent opportunity and will allow her to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tumaini Group in Western Kenya! Roseline is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Roseline takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Roseline had a good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roseline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Roseline will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Tumaini group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre La Alegría se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, donde todas las integrantes trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa, para que de esa forma puedan alcanzar sus objetivos. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo.
La Sra.Silvia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, comenta que siempre tiene muchos clientes pues sus comidas son muy apreciadas por sus clientes. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que no tiene miedo al trabajo, dice que su meta principal es seguir creciendo cada día más y más.
Ella solicita el crédito para invertir en los ingredientes que utiliza para elaborar sus comidas y así surtir más variedades de alimentos y de esta manera también mejorar su nivel de vida e ingreso económico. Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía en su hogar esta mejorando bastante.
texts.en:
The Alegría Women’s Committee is in its first loan cycle with the Foundation’s women entrepreneurs program. In this program all the members work together collectively so they can reach their objectives. Each woman works independently but also helps develop activities with the other members to collect funds as working capital for the group.

Sra. Silvia is a member of the group. She earns her living selling food. She always has a lot of customers because her food is much appreciated. Silvia is known as a hardworking enterprising woman who is not afraid of work. Her principal goal is to continue growing her business as each day passes. 

Silvia is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for the food she makes and as well to add to her supplies so she can make a greater variety of dishes. As a result she will increase her income and improve her standard of living. Silvia says that her household is greatly benefitting from the income from her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food such as meat, vegetables, condiments etc.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy, aged 36 years old, is a mother of two children who are still in school. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer on her two-hectare farm for 15 years in her village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia.

Sophy and the two other members of her borrower group, Kimheng and Sim, have taken loans out before from Kiva field partner VisionFund. The previous loans have helped Sophy afford sufficient food and have helped her to send her children to school.

Sophy is the leader her borrower group, which has applied for another loan. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to buy fertilizer for her rice crop. Sophy hopes she can increase her crop yield so as to earn more income to set aside for her business and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana, es una humilde agricultora de la zona de San Ignacio, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al cultivo de café , la mayor afectación que se le presento fue las fuertes lluvia combinadas con las cenizas del volcán , lo que provoco que los granos de café y las flor que venia naciendo se callera , por ende se perdido en su totalidad el cultivo ;  Ella con mucho esfuerzo logro pagar su primer financiamiento , ahora no tiene dinero con que comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para inducir la plantación y prevenir futuras perdidas .Lo cual solicita apoyo de Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva para ser beneficiada y seguir trabajando ; ya que es el único recurso con el que cuenta para el pan de cada día . Los sueños de doña Ana es poder diversificar cultivos y construir su humilde vivienda para vivir dignamente .
texts.en:
Ana is a humble farmer in the San Ignacio zone.  She’s been growing coffee for a long time.  The greatest challenge she faced was the strong rains combined with ash from the volcano which caused the coffee beans and the flowers that were budding to fall off thus losing her entire crop.  

With much effort she was able to repay her first loan and now does not have any money to buy fertilizer and supplies needed to start a new crop and avoid future losses.  

She is asking Afodenic for help through Kiva funds so that she can be benefitted and can continue working since this is the only resource she has for daily bread.  Ana’s dreams are to diversify her crops and to build a humble abode to live in with dignity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насибе 47 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей. Два сына живут со своей семьёй отдельно, дочь также замужем живёт с мужем отдельно, поэтому на иждивении Насибы с мужем одна дочь 18-ти лет. Муж уже два года как уехал на заработки в Алма-ату, и каждый месяц присылает деньги на расходы семьи. Сама Насиба несмотря на доход с Алма-аты от мужа, занимается откормом и получением домашнего молока, а также и продажи его в своём посёлке. Она решила на получаемый кредит купить большую дойную  корову, для увеличения дохода с продажи её молока, чтобы улучшить свое семейное положение. Она благодарна всем инвесторам за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Nasiba is 47 years old, married, and has four children.  She has two sons who now have their own homes and families, a daughter who has also left home to live with her husband, so the couple's only dependent child is an 18-year-old daughter.  Nasiba's husband left two years ago to start working in Almaty.  Each month he sends in some money to help with family expenses.  Regardless of the income she receives from her husband in Almaty, Nasiba has been involved in cattle fattening and milk production at home.  She sells milk in her village.  She decided to request a loan in order to buy a large-size dairy cow, which will allow her to increase the income she gets from the sale of milk and to improve her family's living conditions.  She is thankful to all lenders for their understanding and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as humble. He operates a motorcycle repair business. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for repairing motorcycles. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing motorcycles.

loans.name: Lesly Judith

texts.en:
My name is Lesly M., I repair watches, sell batteries, bracelets, glass, repair glasses and sell enchape-red ceramic jewlery. My business is located in the city of Danli and I have had it for 5 years. This business was run by my husband, but he has passed away. I have a variety of loyal customers, which enable me to earn enought to support my family and to support my son's studies.

Loan Use: Purchase clocks, batteries, bracelets, glass, screws, pigment and enchape-red ceramic jewlery.

Mi nombre es Lesly M., me dedico a la reparacion de relojes, venta de baterias, brazaletes, vidrios, pines, reparacion de anteojos y venta de enchape de joyeria. mi negocio esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli y tengo 5 años de tenerlo. Este negocio era administrado por mi esposo pero lamentablemente el murio. Tengo una variedad de clientes fijos, esto me genera ingresos para sustentar a mi familia y al estudio de mis hijos. Mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder tener mi propio local.

loans.use: Compra de relojes, baterias, brazaletes, pines, vidrios, tornillos, pegamento y joyeria de enchape

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying inventory

loans.name: Shahsta

texts.en:
Shahsta is 30 years old. She lives with three members of her family in District 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She has rented a shop to start a bakery.  She works hard to expand the business because her husband is jobless. Sometimes he helps her bring wood and performs other tasks.

The responsibility to work lies with her. She wants to take a loan to improve her life and business.  The money will be used to purchase flour and wood so she can bake more and sell more.

loans.use: to buy more woods,flour etc.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S. O. produces and sells Prahok, a type of Cambodian cheese that includes fish.  She also sells cucumbers and can earn about $4/day in profits from her business.  Her husband is a soldier and earns $1/day from the government.  The couple lives in Kampong Cham with their 4 children--2 of whom help their mother with her sales.  Mrs. Heng S. O. plans to use this loan to purchase a motorbike with a trailer so that she can transport her goods to the market.  In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger so that she can send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her Prahok cheese and cucumbers to the market.

loans.name: Phos

texts.en:
Phos is an orphan with one brother and 2 sisters in her care. Her father died under the Khmer Rouge regime and her mother passed away in 1999 because of a serious illness. Phos and her sister learnt to weave silk from their neighbor 7 years ago. Her younger sister assists her by looking after cows in the village. Her brother is a construction worker and is currently working with her uncle in Phnom Penh.

Phos has already borrowed and repaid one loan from MAXIMA. The current loan amount she is requesting is US$ 500. She plans to use this loan to buy silk materials and sewing thread. In addition, she is going to set up a loom for her sister. Since Phos repaid her first loan in a timely fashion, we feel sure she will have no problem repaying this second loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials & sewing thread

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah A. is an experienced businesswoman. She has five years of experience in this business and has been with LAPO for the past five years. She sells clothes.

She is 46 years old, married with three children, and she lives in Benin. Deborah's business has grown rapidly. In order to cover the demands of her customers and offer better service, she needs a loan of $400, which she will use to purchase more clothes for sale. She promises to repay this loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.ru:
Zeynab M. was born in 1984. She lives in the city of Karakoiunlu, in the Ahsuin region. She is married and has 2 children. The first time she came to Normico was two years ago. The $200 credit allowed her family to purchase several cows. This year they came to Normico for the second time in order to obtain a credit for $600 that will allow them to increase the size of their business.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Магеррамова Зейнаб.1984 года рождения.Родилась и проживает в село Каракойунлу Ахсуинского района. Замужем имеет двоих детей. В первый раз она обратилась в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала два года тому назад. Получив кредит нак сумму четыресто долларов их семья купила несколько коров. В этом году семья вторично обратилась в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала чтобу повторно взять кредит на сумму шестьсот долларов,чтобы расширить свой бизнес.

loans.use: To increase the quantity animals

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Farhod B. is 22 and has a secondary school education. He is married. Farhod has been buying and selling large livestock for two years. Since it's hard to find a job in this region, this business is his main source of income. He plans to use his loan to purchase a few young bulls to fatten and sell. After each fattening cycle, which lasts 40-45 days, he will sell the fattened cattle and acquire more young bulls. Most of his customers are residents of the Khuroson region, who use the cattle to make dairy and butcher products to sell to the local population. Farhod plans to repay his loan within a 12-month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Бобоев Фарход, возраст 22 года, образование среднее, женат, детей не имеет. Фарход занимается куплей – продажей крупного рогатого скота уже в течение 2 лет. Так как у себя в районе трудно найти работу, этот бизнес является основным источником получения дохода. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести несколько молодых бычков для откорма и продажи. После каждого цикла откормки, длительность которого составляют 40-45 дней, он будет продавать откормленный скот и приобретать молодых бычков. Основными его покупателями являются жители Хуросонского района, который купленный скот используют для производства мясо-молочных изделий, которые в дальнейшем продаются местному населению. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Hudoyberdi

texts.ru:
Hudoyberdi A. is 34 years old, has a college education, is a teacher by profession is married and has 2 children. Hudoyberdi raises and sells livestock. He has been in this business for 11 years. He would like to use his loan to purchase livestock, which he will fatten and sell every 40-45 days. He will use his profits to support his family as this business is his main source of income.

Hudoyberdi will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Алимардонов Худойберди, возраст – 34 года, образование – высшее, по специальности педагог, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Худойберди занимается разведением и продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 11 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать для приобретение крупного рогатого скота. Он планирует откармливать скот и продавать его через каждые 40-45 дней. Полученную прибыль он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи, так как этот вид деятельности является его основным источником дохода. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
My name is Razia M.. I am borrowing for the first time for my husband’s milk shop, which he has run for the past six years. He sells milk, yogurt and butter at his shop. I am the group leader of four other women. all of whom need loans for their businesses. Shamshad R. needs this loan to start a grocery store, Rubina B. intends to expand their vegetable business. Parween B. will use the loan to buy stock for their grocery store. Shamshad S. plans to start a fruit-selling corner business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand milk sales shop

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Mityana Group

texts.en: Mary is the chairperson of Zibula Atudde Women’s Group, which meets every Tuesday in Mityana. The group has been together for 5 1/2 years, getting loans every 4 months, and they have always been prompt with the repayments. Mary has a shop selling second-hand bed sheets that she buys from Kampala, about 60 kilometers from Mityana, and she has been doing this for 30 years. She is 54 years old and married with 12 children, while she caters to 6 school-going grandchildren. Her husband is a retired medical assistant; therefore, all the responsibility is on her, and this is the reason she is so hardworking.

loans.use: Mary has planned to buy more bed sheets for her shop in Mityana, as well as use part of it to complete payment of school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Đào, 38 years old, joined TYM fund in 2001. Her husband is a farmer. They have 2 school aged children. Initially, she used her loans for raising pigs and buying fertilizer for her field. Her income was about 100 USD a month. When she was able to get bigger loans, she started investing in charcoal sales. Today her charcoal business is established, serving the people in the region. Her income has increased to 200 USD a month. Her business has picked up, she has been able to buy material things that her family needs. She has also bought a truck to transport the charcoal. She is requesting a new loan of 1200 USD so that she would be able to expand her business / increase her sales.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Đào, 38 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001. Chị sống cùng chồng, một nông dân, và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Các vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn về chăn nuôi lợn và mua phân bón làm ruộng, thu nhập hàng tháng khoảng 100USD. Khi bắt đầu được vay những mức vốn lớn chị Đào đầu tư vào buôn bán than. Đến nay chị Thủy đã có một bãi bán than phục vụ nhân dân trong vùng. Mức thu nhập hiện nay 200USD/tháng. Công việc kinh doanh phát triển, chị Đào đã mua được ôtô để chuyên chở, các vật dụng sinh hoạt trong gia đình cũng được sắm sửa thêm nhiều. Với mong muốn mở rộng quy mô kinh doanh, tăng lượng than bán ra, vòng vốn này chị Đào tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy coal

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.en:
Maria Graciela V. (41) lives with her boyfriend, Omar Brigido Aquino Aguiar, in the city of San Ignacio in the neighborhood Maria Auxiliadora. The couple has two sons; one of them is married and lives with his own family.

Omar owns a repair shop for motorcycles; it is called “TALLER OMAR”. It is located in a strategic place, in one of the main streets where many people can see the shop and thus become Omar’s clients.

The money provided by this Kiva loan will be used to purchase motorcycle accessories and spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle accessories and spare parts.

loans.name: Nizomiddin

texts.ru:
Nizomiddin has several businesses: he has a confectionеry, a small grocery store and he also raises cattle. He is 43 years old, married and has four children. A year ago he has come to MicroInvest and got his first loan which helped him buy several calves. After the sale he used the profits and invested into business expansion. In addition he has also rented out a small space for manufacturing of confectioneries and hired several workers to produce them. He has not abandoned his cattle business though. At this time the prices for cattle are lower and Nizomiddin has decided to apply for another loan to further expand this business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

У Низомиддина много занятий - у него есть кондитерский цех, маленький магазин продовольственных товаров и еще он занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. Ему 43 года, он женат и имеет 4 детей. Год назад он обратился в Микроинвест и получив свой первый займ приобрел несколько бычков. После продажи их он получив прибыль стал вкладывать его в расширение бизнеса. В дополнение к этому он взял в аренду мини-цех по производству кондитерских изделий и наняв несколько человек стал производить кондитерские изделия. При этом он не бросил выращивание скота. Сейчас когда цены на скот немного снизились Низомиддин решил обратиться за новым займом чтобы далее развивать свою деятельность.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jesus Francisco

texts.es:
Jesús began the business to be able to tend to the sickness of his wife. The medicines are too expensive and, with only one income, he could not afford them. In addition to selling hot dogs, he sells pastries in his house. He began 5 years ago renting a cart from a friend but in time he decided to buy it and in this way be the boss of his own business to help his wife and support their children.

He needs a loan of $1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, to put together the cart and complete a trailer to haul it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús emprendió el negocio para poder atender la enfermedad de su esposa, los medicamentos son demasiados caros y con un solo sueldo no alcanzaba a solventarlos, además de vender hot dogs, vende tortas en su casa, empezó hace 5 años rentando una carreta a un amigo pero ya con el tiempo decidió comprársela y así ser dueño de su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposa y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

El necesita un préstamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para componer la carreta y completar el total de una batanga para jalarla.

loans.use: To build a cart with a trailer for his food business.

loans.name: Claudia Rosa Elia

texts.es:
Claudia is a widow, and has five children. They are28, 26, 22, 21, and 20 years old, respectively. Claudia's business originally belonged to her husband, who taught her how to manage the finances and buy and sell goats. Claudia's husband was the only thing that she had to get ahead, and when he died Claudia faced the challenge of running a successful business. This business is 30 years old, and thanks to help from two of her sons, Claudia has been able to keep it running successfully.

Claudia needs a loan of $1100, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the capital to buy goats and supplies for a restaurant, as some of her clients have not paid her, and this delayed her deliveries. With this loan Claudia will be able to fulfill her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es viuda y tiene 5 hijos de 28, 26, 22, 21 y 20 años. inicialmente el negocio lo tenia su esposo, pero el fallece y ella se queda con el, ya que era lo que tenia para poder salir adelante, y enfrentándose al reto de sacar adelante el negocio ya que su esposo alcanzo a enseñarle como administrar y llevar a cabo la compra venta de los cabritos. Este negocio tiene 30 años funcionando y gracias al apoyo de 2 de sus hijos han podido mantenerlo con éxito.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1100 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar cabritos y surtir pedidos que tiene de un restaurante, ya que algunos de sus clientes no le han pagado, y esto le retrasa sus entregas, con este crédito va a tener la posibilidad de cumplir sus compromisos.

loans.use: Buy goats

loans.name: Mrs. Tork Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank consists of 29 people and is located in Traeuy Troeng Village in Kandal Province; they plan to use the loan differentL.. For instance, Mrs. Tork L. is the village bank president who is a pig breeder and raises ten pigs. Since her pigs are growing bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to buy pig food to feed her pigs. Thus, Mrs. Tork L. has decided to ask for a loan to invest in more food for her animals. Her husband, Mr. Lin Nget, is a farmer who owns a hectare to cultivate rice. Mrs. Tork L. is 55 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a rice wine maker while the others are attending the local school. The three men who are in the picture are requesting the loan on behalf of their wives.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. One member has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Maguatte Signane

texts.fr: MAGUATTE SIGNANE S. EST COMMERCANTE AU MARCHE CENTRAL DE THIES DEPUIS 15 ANS. ELLE VEBD DES HABITS, OBJETS D'ARTS PAGNES TISSES ETC.......ELLE HABITE AU QUARTIER CITE LAMY A THIES.
texts.en:
MAGUATTE SIGNANE S. has been a merchant at the central market of THIES for fifteen years. She sells outfits, objects of art, woven pagnes (colorful West African cloth), etc.... She lives in the CITE LAME district of THIES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothing and art objects

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, A. Ablavi est une femme courageuse qui se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle fait le commerce des chaussures et sacs pour femmes depuis trois ans. Ce commerce procure un peu de revenu pour venir en aide à son mari pour la prise en charge du foyer. Pour développer son activité et avoir plus de revenu, elle sollicite ce crédit.
texts.en:
38-year-old Ablavi A. is a courageous woman who works towards her children future success. Married and the mother of three children, for the past three years she has traded in shoes and ladies’ handbags. This business has brought in a little income to assist her husband in supporting the household. Abavi is requesting this loan to expand her business and to bring in more income.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of shoes and ladies' handbags

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El señor Feliciano es propietario de una panadería la cual cuenta con una antigüedad de cinco años establecida, el esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de su pan y seguir incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Feliciano has five years experience of running his own bakery. He is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients to make his bread and continue growing his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to bake his bread

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kasiani

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Kasiani dalam keseharian hidupnya ia mampu membantu suami dalam menambah penghasilan keluarga melalui usaha menjual pulsa dan aksesoris telepon genggam yang berada di depan rumahnya .
Dengan tambahan modal dari DINARI yang merupakan pinjaman untuk periode pertama Ni Ketut Kasiani  bisa menambah jumlah jenis barang yang akan dijual kepada pembeli yang bisa meningkatkan hasil penjualan dan dan juga keuntungan bersih dari hasil usahanya.  Ni Ketut Kasiani bermagsud untuk melanjutkan pinjaman periode ke dua dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan dengan pembayaran dilunasi pada akhir periode pinjaman. sehingga dengan tambahan modal tersebut mereka dapat meningkatkan jumlah persediaan barang maupun pulsa yang akan di jual sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh akan lebih meningkat guna penunjang pendapatan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Kasiani sells prepaid cellphone credit and cell phone accessories to get extra income, supplementing her husband's low income to support the family.

She got a loan from DINARI once before and with this loan she was able to add the range of merchandises in her store. She was able to increase her revenue and profit out of it.

She is now planning to take the 2nd term loan from DINARI with a tenor of 12 month period. This loan is repayable at the end of the period. She is hoping to be able to further increase her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add merchandise

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan A. lives in Barangay Usocan, Plaridel City, Misamis Occidental province, Philippines, and is married at the age of 23 and blessed with 1 child. 

Joan cannot find a job right now; for a meanwhile, she is vending “tempura”. Tempura is all time Filipino favorite street food. It is fried flour and has a meaty like taste. This is also a way to help her husband, who is a fisherman, to generate money. They earn money so that they can sustain their child, who is an infant.

Joan believes all the things that she needs could be accommodated by a $75 loan. “Life isn’t easy” Joan says, “but you could not reach the top unless you take the first step".  $75 would go a long way in making her dreams possible.

loans.use: additonal capital for tempura vending

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en: N. Annett, a married mother of 6 children, is the treasurer of the women's group of Kakawuka. She manages a poultry business as well as farming. Her farm consists of a banana plantation which she uses to make matoke, a local food staple, for sale and for consumption at home. She sometimes has difficulty managing her poultry business with high prices. She says being a friendly person has helped her to be successful in her business. She knows how to manage her finances because she is the treasurer of her lending group. She is grateful for the help of her husband who helps manage her loans. ( In the photo is Grace, the Coordinator)

loans.use: More chicks, chicken mash and labor on farm.

loans.name: Bachirou

texts.fr: Bachirou M. est un jeune homme de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est revendeur de chemises à Atakpamé, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.il exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans et les résultats sont convaincants. Son activité consiste à payer les chemises auprès des grossistes et de venir les revendre. Avec ce crédit il espère aussi faire des livraisons en gros. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
